complaint_text:
I have had an account with Bank of America since XXXX, and I live XXXX, XXXX. I called them in XX/XX/XXXX because my new debit card had not arrived, fearing it was lost. I bounced among several representatives, I was treated with suspicion and as a result I was locked out of the account and spent {$67.00} in calling a supposedly toll-free number. In XX/XX/XXXX, having received an email that my account was going to be considered dormant, I wrote them, attaching all the evidence ( passport, two BofA debit cards one with my picture, old address in XXXX XXXX, my daughter 's and my ex-wife 's account with BofA ) asking for help in accessing the account online. 
I was contacted by the Client Care Executive Response Team ( case n. XXXX ). Several phone calls took place in XXXX and XXXX : very frustratingly, I spoke to 5 different people, every time having to repeat my story. I was provided with wrong ( local XXXX phone numbers ) and conflicting information : in particular, they told me to get hold of a XXXX mobile phone and address where to send a new debit card ( to be used to validate access online ), but afterwards they backtracked, denying such possibility and refused to give me a copy of the phone recording proving that a representative ( XXXX XXXX ) had said. She seemed helpful and understood they needed to come up with a solution, but then disappeared. Maybe this happened because I honestly told them that the passport they have online - through which they identify me for the phone calls had expired. 
BofAs approach has been obstructive and discriminating : I have been told we are an American bank ( even though, according to their website, 50 % of their workforce in abroad ) ; it is my problem if am away, and if I dont have a XXXX phone nor address ( anymore, my mother is law has deceased ). When I hope the account, a XXXX phone was not needed, and I have not been informed of the need to have one : I have been caught by the new validation process : this can happen, but the unwillingness to help is against courtesy, the duty of are towards clients, if not against the regulations. 
They told me jump on a plane and go to a XXXX branch. They refused to refund me the {$80.00} cost of the initial call to a toll free number, as a gesture of goodwill refusing to explain why we dont pay compensation. 
My ex-wife was in New York and went to a branch seeking help on my behalf ; she was told I should to go to the BofA branch in XXXX ; but I called them and they would not know how to help me. 
I asked Client Care Executive Response Team to have my ID validated by one of their XXXX employees in XXXX : they did not want to. I asked to be sent a wire transfer with the balance of my account ( {$4600.00} ) : they did not want to They would send a check in the mail because maybe the relevant team could to validate my address so the same bank would validate me for posting a check, but not for online access, nor any of the other alternatives I proposed involving financial institution or XXXX resident persons? ( besides, a domestic check in USD would not clear, of be very expensive to, in XXXX ). 
I asked, as part of a wire transfer, to contact or be contacted by the receiving bank to validate my ID : they did not want to ( " you could get a guy in XXXX XXXX '' ). I proposed to do verify via XXXX : they did not want to. I asked to have a friend living in the XXXX go personally in a branch and validate his ID and address and be sent the debit card to his address : they did not want to. 
The discussions have become difficult, obstructive and confrontational. They keep repeating what the procedure is, they understand my difficulties, but in practice they are unavailable to help find a solution to a problem they have created in locking me out of the system. They say they made a business decision and that's it- it is my problem. 
I found the Client Care Executive Response Team difficult to deal with, unable to refer to external regulator/consumer protection entities if I was unsatisfied ; self-referential ( I could not escalate this further within the Bank ) ; unaccountable as a bank representatives kept changing but would not acknowledge what their colleagues had said ( I was not part of that conversation ). 
In summary, I was locked out BY BOFA when in XXXX called concerned by the debit card not having arrived ; the validation procedure than changed and I was left unable to access. Not having a valid XXXX address anymore ( my mother in law died ) nor a XXXX mobile phone. I can understand the online access procedure changed, but they are unwilling to provide an alternative having been left out by the changes they introduced. Nor they are willing to consider any of the alternatives to be validate that I proposed. I have been for 20+ years regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority in the XXXX XXXX I am familiar with XXXX and Italian financial consumer protection regulatory framework, but I have never seen anything like that.

We have been struggling financially for over a year now. Due to circumstances, we were not able to refinance our loan as we had planned. We did attempt to obtain a loan modification. For over 4 months I dealt with mortgage company providing them, over and over again, with documentation they requested. Finally, they said they had all documents they needed and I needed to complete a trial to be eligible for the modification. They said I needed to make special payments for 3 months, which I did, on time, even a month early. They said for me not to pay anything else until XXXX XXXX. After those three months were completed, they mailed me a modification letter that I had only a couple of days to read, understand, sign and return. They modification would help a little, but it would n't have helped us in the long run. Meanwhile we were able to repair the home well enough to finally be able to refinance our home with an FHA loan. We decided that we should refinance instead. We completed all we needed to refinance the house, but when the loan officer requested our payment history from the current mortgage company, it showed we were 3 months behind in our payments, which I knew nothing of. It took two phone calls for me to find out what was happening and I ask them to fix the situation so I could refinance, but they refused. They claimed the payments I had made for the trial were just to catch up what was behind XXXX they payments were larger than my usual monthly payments ) and I still owed for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. I paid those three past due payments in XX/XX/XXXX, however XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX still appear over 30 days late on my payment history and because of that NO ONE will consider refinancing our loan for another 12 months. I had no idea our payments were so far behind. I was simply doing as I was instructed my the loan company regarding the modification, which I thought would help us and the company managed to drag this situation out for months. Now we are stuck. We can not accept the loan modification, we can not refinance, we can not afford to pay the 8.9 fixed interest rate and fees on our loan. We have a nice home with excellent equity and need to refinance to pay our debts and lower our rates. All we need is our payment history modified so that we can obtain the loan. I feel like the loan modification process was not handled well, as they constantly " lost '' documents I had sent in, and was not explained well at all. I find it very unreasonable that this situation prevents us from refinancing our home.

Subject : Fraudulent transactions conducted in my absence amounting to over {$120000.00} from my Savings account at Marcus by Goldman Sachs.

In my absence there were total 345 fraudulent transactions conducted due to bank 's negligence and the bank failed to lock my account or notify me. These transactions happened for over 8 months from XX/XX/XXXX till XX/XX/XXXX. 
I have repeatedly contacted the bank to resolve the issue and refund the amount, but only a partial amount was refunded and the bank refused to acknowledge fraud stating that the transactions were legitimate. 
My family is going through a tough time and my father is still in XXXX XXXX Such a huge amount is a big loss for me and my family. 
I urge you to look into this matter and help me recover my funds.

I attempted to contact the company, however, they would n't allow me to talk to someone. I offered Bayview the opportunity to move the loan back to interest only and I would rent it and carry it for XXXX more years as the market recovered. complaint_text:
Subject : Formal Dispute Regarding Failure to Provide Proper Disclosure under FDCPA Section 805 ( e ) ( 11 ) Dear : PORTFOLIO RC - XXXX ___I am writing to formally dispute the manner in which your company has communicated with me regarding an alleged debt. Specifically, I believe that your communications have violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 805 ( e ) ( 11 ), which requires that debt collectors clearly disclose : During the initial communication, that they are attempting to collect a debt and that any information obtained will be used for that purpose.

In subsequent communications, that the communication is from a debt collector.

Your [ specify : phone call, letter, email, etc. ], dated [ date of communication ], did not include the required disclosure. As you may know, failure to comply with this section constitutes a violation of federal law and may result in legal consequences.

I request that you : Immediately cease further communication with me unless proper disclosure is provided.

Provide written confirmation that you have corrected your practices in compliance with FDCPA regulations.

Cease all collection activities on the alleged debt until you provide validation of the debt in compliance with Section 809 of the FDCPA.

complaint_text:
On XX/XX/scrub> 2025, I sent a formal debt validation request to Resurgent Capital Services for an alleged credit card debt originally from XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ), totaling {$1100.00}. They responded with a generic account summary and one billing statement this does not satisfy the legal requirements under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ).

They failed to provide the original signed agreement, a complete account history, and proof of ownership or assignment. Under federal law, any debt collector must cease collection efforts until full validation is provided. Despite this, Resurgent continues to pursue collection without proper documentation, which constitutes a clear violation of the FDCPA.

I respectfully request the CFPB to investigate this matter and require the company to either fully validate the debt with all required legal documents or immediately stop all collection activity and remove the account from my credit reports.
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

complaint_text:
They have not responded to my disputes at all. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$31000.00} was released and the balance is {$0.00}. This was released by XXXX and recorded as released with XXXX XXXX, CA. Equifax still shows it as open after years of being released.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/year> Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC Attn : Debt Validation Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, WA XXXX RE : Request for Debt Validation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Account Number : XXXX Amount Reported : {$1500.00} To Whom It May Concern, I am formally requesting that you validate the above-referenced debt as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. This is not a refusal to pay, but a request for validation and verification of the alleged debt that you claim I owe.

Please provide the following : 1. The original creditors name and contact information 2. The original account number 3. A complete payment history, including all charges and fees added 4. A copy of the original signed contract or agreement 5. Proof that Columbia Debt Recovery is legally authorized to collect on this alleged debt in my state 6. Documentation showing that this debt is accurate and belongs to me Until you provide the documentation requested above, I ask that you cease all collection efforts, including reporting this account to any credit bureaus. If you can not validate this debt, I request that you immediately delete it from all credit reporting agencies ( Experian, Equifax, and TransUnion ) in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ).

Please be advised that I am keeping detailed records of all communications for future reference, including any potential legal claims for violations of the FDCPA or FCRA. 

I expect a response within 30 days of receipt of this letter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

complaint_text:
We have had several banks over the years go under or get in trouble and we get sent to a different lender. Some times we pay the payment and then it gets frozen in the other banks account by government and then it takes months to show we paid in the mean time we have proven we made it cause it is on bank statements, yet the new lender would charge us late fees. We went to court over it 2 years ago with XXXX and thought they were to remove the fees move the payments and the new lender was going to lessen the amount since they had increased fees which was not due to anything we had done. Not having a lawyer we could not fight them and so we paid the amount sent to us even though other paperwork we had showed a lessor amount. We would receive foreclose paperwork every month and when I would call they would say disregard it is sent automatically and since we had paid the payment it was no longer actively being pursued. When we asked why our payment was higher than what was agreed upon in court they would give us a comment like taxes went up but when we called clerks office they had not, then it was insurance increase, we called no it was the same. We had a decrease in pay with my husband losing his job after XXXX and being limited to weight he could lift, FMLA ran out and the job let him go saying he could return once his limit increased but they no longer would hold his job. We missed 2 payments I sent in letter saying what had happened and said we would pay those payments over time and we had been, we were paying our monthly payment but we also were getting some late fees each month. We received notice of possible forecloser again so I called again and they said we will cancel it and send out a notice of what was owed to get caught up. When we received it the amount showed XXXX missed payments so I again called. They told me they had declined my last 2 payments and needed to contact XXXX to receive the money. That was for XXXX payments 3 months before. I asked why we had just now been informed and only after I called to find out. XXXX is who sent me a notice I had money to come get not them. We were told we had until XX/XX/XXXX to decide if we wanted to pay the fees of over XXXX and start making payments again or they would proceed with foreclosure yet 3 days later we received court papers for the foreclosure. We want all documents they have to explain all the fees they say we owe and where they got the amount from. Please help us. We did contact a lawyer but they said this was our first step. We have worked so hard over the 10 plus we have been in our home and feel we are being bullied by cooperation. We pay our payments when others just walk away leaving the home we have worked so hard, put our own water lines and electric lines in, did our own XXXX foot driveway, cleared the home site ourselves with a small yard tractor. 
Thank you, XXXX and XXXX

complaint_text: According to TransUnion the have in Public Records under docket # XXXX stating I file a chapter XXXX in XX/XX/2009. I did not and I am faxing over my police report as proof that my identity was used without my permission.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of TILA US Code 1666B since I was never late. " I recently reviewed my consumer report and noticed an incorrect late payment record. I have always maintained timely payments on this account. Under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), creditors are required to accurately report consumer transactions and provide a mechanism for correcting errors in a timely manner. Please conduct an investigation into this matter, and if you can not provide documentary evidence of these supposed late payments, I demand these payments to be updated to on time as they should be as I was NEVER late. I expect these updates to be made promptly, in compliance with the law.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
To Whom It May Concern, Urgently, I am writing to remove a repossession charge-off listed on my credit report by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which is significantly and negatively impacting my credit score. Despite my best efforts, I have been unable to resolve this matter directly with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I discovered an outstanding balance on a vehicle loan for which I was a co-signer. Unfortunately, the primary account holders, my parents, are deceased, and I was unaware of the remaining balance on the loan. Upon learning of this obligation, I reached out to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX. I was told by them that the account was sold to Radius Global Solutions. I immediately contacted Radius Global Solution to arrange a payment plan, as I am committed to fulfilling any financial responsibilities associated with the loan. Radius Global Solutions told me that any positive payments towards the account would not be reported since they are a non-reporting agency. I was told by them I would need to call XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX back to see what they can do to ensure that if I make a payment, it would be reported as a positive payment on my credit report. 

I then contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to see if there was anyway for them to report any positive payments. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX informed me that they would not report any positive payments until the full {$26000.00} is paid in full. They have explicitly stated that the account will not be removed from collections until the entire balance of {$26000.00} is paid in full. This inflexible stance is profoundly concerning and leaves me with limited options for resolution. There is no positive resolution for me to pay the amount when there is no reporting of payments. This account is scheduled to leave my credit report in XX/XX/XXXX. There is no incentive for me to pay the amount since it will not be reported at all as a positive payment. 

Furthermore, it is unjust that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is unwilling to allow positive payments to be applied to the account. As a co-signer, I am eager to rectify this matter and demonstrate my willingness to fulfill my financial obligations. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 's current approach only prolongs the negative impact on my credit history without providing a viable path toward resolution. This is greatly unfair to a consumer like myself. They expect me to literally " throw away '' money towards this account, and not one positive payment would be noted. I am not in a position to pay the full amount. 

Given the circumstances surrounding this account, including my lack of awareness of the outstanding balance and my earnest efforts to address the issue, I respectfully and urgently request that the repossession charge-off be promptly and permanently removed from all major credit reporting agencies, including XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. This removal is crucial for me to move forward with my financial endeavors and rebuild my creditworthiness, as I plan to attend graduate school and purchase a home. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and request that you conduct a thorough investigation into the actions of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Radius Global Solutions. A fair and equitable resolution can be reached with your intervention. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this dispute. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text:
I am disputing alleged late payments reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX to Experian, TransUnion, and Equifax. 

These accounts show impossible late payments after the XXXX  repossession, along with variations in negative months across the XXXX credit bureaus, including repeated charge-off statuses, which inflates the negative history and constitutes inaccurate reporting. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ), furnishers may not report information they know or should know is inaccurate. The payments in question are marked as late, but XXXX has not complied with the legal requirements for reporting under FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ).

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681, the term consumer report does not include information regarding transactions or experiences between a consumer and the person making the report. Therefore, any transactions or experiences between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX that are factually impossible or inaccurately represented should not appear on my consumer report. 

I demand a full investigation and the immediate deletion of these inaccurate accounts from all credit reports due to these violations and XXXX  failure to follow lawful procedures.

complaint_text:
LIST OF ACCOUNTS BELOW HAVE VIOLATED MY FEDERALLY PROTECTED CONSUMER RIGHTS TO PRIVACY AND CONFIDENTIALITY UNDER 15 USC 1681 XXXX XXXX ACCT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ACCT XXXX XXXX ACCT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT XXXX I looked at my Experian report on XX/XX/scrub> 2025 and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 usc 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

According to 15 U.S.C. 1681i, if a consumer reporting agency ( CRA ) finds that information on a consumer 's credit report is inaccurate, incomplete, or can not be verified after a reinvestigation, the agency is required to promptly delete or modify the information. This is a key provision of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) aimed at ensuring the accuracy and fairness of consumer reports. ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

( B ) Requirements relating to reinsertion of previously deleted material ( i ) Certification of accuracy of information If any information is deleted from a consumers file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ), the information may not be reinserted in the file by the consumer reporting agency unless the person who furnishes the information certifies that the information is complete and accurate.

( ii ) Notice to consumer If any information that has been deleted from a consumers file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) is reinserted in the file, the consumer reporting agency shall notify the consumer of the reinsertion in writing not later than 5 business days after the reinsertion or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by any other means available to the agency.

( iii ) Additional information As part of, or in addition to, the notice under clause ( ii ), a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing not later than 5 business days after the date of the reinsertion ( I ) a statement that the disputed information has been reinserted ; ( II ) the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available, or of any furnisher of information that contacted the consumer reporting agency, in connection with the reinsertion of such information ; and ( III ) a notice that the consumer has the right to add a statement to the consumers file disputing the accuracy or completeness of the disputed information.

( C ) Procedures to prevent reappearance A consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to prevent the reappearance in a consumers file, and in consumer reports on the consumer, of information that is deleted pursuant to this paragraph ( other than information that is reinserted in accordance with subparagraph ( B ) ( i ) ).

( D ) Automated reinvestigation system Any consumer reporting agency that compiles and maintains files on consumers on a nationwide basis shall implement an automated system through which furnishers of information to that consumer reporting agency may report the results of a reinvestigation that finds incomplete or inaccurate information in a consumers file to other such consumer reporting agencies.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

To Whom It May Concern:
I am writing this letter in the hopes that I can get some sort of resolution of the issues that I
am presenting to you.  Over a period of years, my wife and I have acquired a few properties, namely our XXXX home which we decided to rent out, our primary residence and an investment property (XXXXplex) in XXXX and our home in XXXX.  The mortgage to these properties were financed through XXXX Mortgage.  At some point in time, theses were acquired by PNC Bank.  At the time of the economic downturn, I reached out to the banks to attempt either refinancing or modification of the loans.  My credit rating at the time was XXXX plus.  I was informed that in order to qualify I would have to be delinquent and that refinancing was not an option because I had more than XXXX mortgages.  We began the modification process and after a year of repeatedly sending and resending documents somehow I received a modification agreement on XXXX property.  By the XXXX month of trial period just before the modification would have begun, PNC abruptly closed the account.  They stated we had broken the agreement, which was blatantly false and would not offer an explanation or discussion on the matter.  The property was immediately sold at auction.  Thankfully we kept a paper trail in anticipation of being defrauded in this process.  We hired attorneys to help us navigate through the short sale process on our original primary residence.  PNC  delayed the short sale process for over XXXX months with a qualified buyer waiting.  This home was also foreclosed on, so now we are down to one last trial and tribulation with PNC.  Even with a team of attorneys we have been unable to complete the modification process for over XXXX years.  I attempted the process alone for 18 months without legal representation.  So for close to 4 years we have been in limbo with respect to our primary residence.   Imagine our surprise or lack of surprise when we received a $XXXX settlement from the XXXX for discriminatory practices.  These last XXXX years have been hell on my wife and me.  After reading our situation we hope you can help us get this settled, for you are our last hope.  Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope to hear from you soon.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NJ XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Subject : Complaint Regarding Unfair Practice and Garnishment of Wages Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against LVNV FUNDING LLC and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. for unfair practices related to a disputed account that has resulted in the garnishment of my wages. 

I recently discovered that LVNV FUNDING LLC, in conjunction with XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, has initiated garnishment proceedings against my wages for an alleged debt that does not belong to me. The account in question, with the account number XXXX, was opened on XX/XX/XXXX, without my knowledge or consent. 

Despite my repeated attempts to dispute the validity of this debt in the past, LVNV FUNDING LLC and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. have continued to pursue collection efforts and have now resorted to garnishing my wages. It is worth noting that the reported amount of the debt is {$1000.00}, yet the garnishment sum taken from my paycheck is {$1000.00}, which further adds to the unfairness of this situation. 

I believe that LVNV FUNDING LLC and XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. have violated my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and other relevant consumer protection laws by engaging in these unfair and deceptive practices. Specifically, their actions constitute : Failure to provide adequate verification of the debt despite previous disputes. 
Garnishing wages for a debt that has not been verified or proven to be valid. 
Falsely reporting the debt amount, leading to an incorrect garnishment sum. 

I am seeking your assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring that my rights are protected. I request that LVNV FUNDING LLC and XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. cease all collection activities immediately and release the garnishment on my wages until the validity of the debt is properly verified. 

Furthermore, I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate action against LVNV FUNDING LLC and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. for their unfair and unlawful practicesXXXX XXXX XXXX Enclosed with this letter are copies of relevant documents, including previous dispute communications and evidence of the garnishment proceedings. I have recorded conversations with the agencies where inaccurate information was claimed to have been provided, and I am willing to provide the audio recordings if necessary. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

complaint_text:
I am filing this complaint against the three major credit bureaus Equifax, Experian, and TransUnion for their continued reporting of a collection account by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, a debt collector that is not licensed or authorized to collect debts in the State of Florida, where I reside. 

I have provided proof ( see attached screenshots ) from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX clearly showing that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX holds no collection license in Florida, making their collection activity unlawful under Florida law. 

Additionally, this company violated 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) of the FDCPA by ignoring my written request to cease communication and explicitly stating in their response ( see attached image ) that they will continue to send mail to my address, despite my clear cease-and-desist notice. This is a willful violation of my federal consumer protection rights.

The credit bureaus are further in violation of : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) by failing to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) by failing to properly reinvestigate the dispute despite the evidence provided.

15 U.S.C. 1681b by allowing the continued furnishing of consumer data to a company not legally permitted to operate in my state.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) which prohibits the reporting of information that the furnisher knows or has reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate or unauthorized.

Despite my previous dispute submission to the CFPB, no corrective action was taken, and this debt which is legally unenforceable in Florida remains on my credit reports, causing ongoing harm to my creditworthiness and financial opportunities.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:

Shellpoint never contacted me or my authorized representative in writing or via phone about any missing document between XXXX XXXX, 2016 ( when I submitted the application ) and XXXX XXXX, 2016 ( when Shellpoint sent me the denial letter ). The only communication I received from Shellpoint between XXXX XXXX, 2016 and XXXX XXXX, 2016 was a mortgage statement demanding payment for the arrears. Please see the attached supporting documents. 

Shellpoint Mortgage NEVER evaluated my application that I sent in on XXXX XXXX, 2016 and is now telling stories about contacting me for missing documents in it ongoing effort to take away my home via foreclosure.

complaint_text:
On XXXX XXXX XXXX my mortgage was sold to Nationstar Mortgage. On XXXX XXXX XXXX I sent a letter of financial hardship to Nationstar describing the fraudulent circumstances that were induced upon me at the signing of my closing documents. 

On XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of Nationstar replied to my complaint to both Nationstar and the CFPB by stating simply, " We have conducted an investigation, and it was determined the error asserted within your correspondence did not occur on the account. Please be advised Nationstar can not attest to the prior servicer 's actions, including their origination, underwriting, or lending processes. XXXX XXXX then threatened me with the full impact of the sales contract stating, " we will continue to service the loans in accordance with the valid, binding documents that you signed at the time of origination. '' I replied to both XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with citations and an Error Resolution Notice under 12 C.F.R. 1024.35. I then supplied additional documentation from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in addition to two separate professional opinions of the site description on the property for a re-assessment of my complaint. 

XXXX XXXX of Nationstar contacted me in XXXX of XXXX to say that my case had been escalated and they would be conducting their own internal investigation into the fraud allegations. XXXX XXXX contacted me shortly afterwards and told me the internal investigation confirmed my fraud allegations after escalations reviewed my case in detail and they would then approach XXXX XXXX with their findings. 

On XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX e-mailed me with the decision of Nationstar to fully enforce my mortgage contract despite the open records documentation of the fraud that has been confirmed and supported when initiating and servicing my residential mortgage contract, XXXX XXXX replied to my complaint saying there is nothing he can do for me. 

Specifically XXXX XXXX replied saying, " They realize an error was made '' however as they are not the investor they can not help me further and will enforce any and all contractual obligations that have been imposed upon me by the now defunct XXXX XXXX XXXX that was put out of business by the FBI for fraud in XXXX. 

I am XXXX and my XXXX was established in XXXX. As we are associated with the XXXX my business has survived however as of the XX/XX/XXXX and more recently for all of XXXX I am no longer able to receive a paycheck and my savings has depleted to the point of desperation. 

I am seeking a Loan Reduction to equate to the value of equity that was and still is being grafted from me and my family for the remaining balance of this loan. XXXX excessive taxas, closing costs, etc.

I am reaching out to you because of my concern for the accuracy and honesty of your company 's data. As per FCRA section 611, it is imperative that we have accurate records on file with those who rely upon them most- which includes not just customers but also potential lenders or employers! After doing some research into Metro 2 compliance standards as well ( since they are rather new ), I've found there may be some inaccuracies in reporting going forward if these issues aren't promptly resolved ; would love any feedback possible before taking action against us later down this road together My credit report is a representation of my financial standing and I take pride in keeping it up-to date. With that said, you have the responsibility to keep my credit profile and report accurate, authentic, complete! Therefore I need you to provide me with verification of everything within my credit report in a TIMELY manner. The information in my credit report and below is inaccurate. It never had any verification, compliance with reporting laws by means or even credibility -- so now I'm going through the process of correcting this oversight permanently! The inaccuracies that are currently on my report are having a serious negative impact to my quality of life! The data on my credit report is of high importance and is currently not a representation of who I am financially because its inaccurate. I'm demanding accurate documentation so you can document me- the person who deserves status in society- correctly!! Please make sure that all inaccuracies are removed immediately and that I am furnished with a new credit report upon the completion of your investigations into the details of my credit records.

A few months ago we were told that we were being denied for any type of help and that we needed to sell or move out of our house.

I am not shocked that this has occurred, because I have read that Ocwen has a history of misleading and lying to homeowners in foreclosure and in fact they were fined XXXX by the US government for these actions. I have researched the guidelines for the government modification programs and I am sure that we qualify, the problem is that Ocwen has not conducted an accurate or timely review (if they ever conducted a review at all) of our current financial circumstances.

You wanted to become this behemoth enterprise so you deal with it. I 'm done with you after paying this loan off and you will never see another dime of my money come your way.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of TILA US Code 1666B since I was never late. " I recently reviewed my consumer report and noticed an incorrect late payment record. I have always maintained timely payments on this account. Under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), creditors are required to accurately report consumer transactions and provide a mechanism for correcting errors in a timely manner. Please conduct an investigation into this matter, and if you can not provide documentary evidence of these supposed late payments, I demand these payments to be updated to on time as they should be as I was NEVER late. I expect these updates to be made promptly, in compliance with the law. ''
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

There are numerous instances of disobedience with mandated reporting criteria, thus the information in my report isn't accurate and comprehensive! Having said that, I dispute your claims and challenge you to show me that you have the authority to publish this inaccurate, misleading information to my credit report. 

Per 15 U.S.C 1681e Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 

According to 12 CFR Part 1022 ( Regulation V ) requires furnishers to : Provide truthful information about accounts or other connections with a customer. 
Provide accurate information about accounts or other interactions you have with customers. 
C - Look at consumer complaints in a reasonable manner According to CRRG, you have to adhere to the Metro 2 compliance guidelines in order to file a legitimate report. 

Furthermore, " Any Deviation From These Standards Jeopardizes The Integrity of The Data, '' according to the CRRG. This implies that discrepancies in reporting claims have the potential to reduce information accuracy and have an impact on the accuracy of reports that are subject to federal regulation.

I'm using my right to object to these erroneous and non-compliant items as a consequence. You will only demonstrate your lack of concern for my rights as a customer if you ignore my demand. Reporting information that hasn't been verified as ethical and compliant with certified reporting standards isn't fair. Once more, I contest these assertions and demand documentation of the appropriate reporting guidelines.

You are violating my rights! I have listed the concerns about your reporting in this document. It's not complete and does not meet my standards according to law, you must certify all aspects of required FCRA/ Metro 2 compliance which is done truthfully, correctly ( in a timely manner ), completely AND accurately as well - or else I would have to escalate these issues to the CFPB , FTC and my Attorney General.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
To Whom It May Concern, As a consumer, I am gravely disappointed by the lack of transparency regarding the steps your agency took to ensure the accuracy of the items in question under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) Method of verification- Description of reinvestigation procedure. A consumer reporting agency must provide a detailed description of the procedure utilized to ascertain the accuracy and completeness of the information to the consumer, as mandated by paragraph 15 USC ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ). This includes disclosing the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted, along with their telephone number if reasonably available, within 15 days of the consumer 's request for such information. I hereby wish to express my deep disappointment regarding the current situation with my credit report. It has come to my attention that despite my previous notifications and demands, the erroneous items that I have reported as a result of being a victim of a Data Breach/Identity Theft are still present on my credit report. I have taken the necessary steps of contacting both your company and the Federal Trade Commission, providing all pertinent information, and filing an FTC Report as proof of my grievances. You must take immediate and decisive action to rectify this matter. I demand that you block and remove all inaccurate information from my credit report as well as provide me with an updated copy without delay. I trust that you will treat this matter with the seriousness it deserves and address it promptly. We appreciate your prompt attention and cooperation in resolving this matter by the law.

complaint_text:
I have sent XXXX letters of complaint to the Office of the President at First Horizon Bank. 

The first on XXXX XXXX and another on XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX CEO Office of the President XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Tennessee XXXX XXXX By email & post XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Complaint Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX : ********************* I write to complain in the strongest possible terms at the unacceptable level of service that has been received from First Horizon following XXXX XXXX damage to our property. 
My husband XXXX & I live in XXXX, but have a home in XXXX XXXX, Florida on which First Horizon holds a mortgage. 
XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - our home was struck by XXXX XXXX, causing extensive damage resulting in the necessity of a completely new roof and other structural repairs. 
XXXX XXXX- we flew over to Florida to assess the situation. 

XXXX XXXX- entered a claim with our Insurers XXXX - Claim # XXXX XXXX XXXX - Loss Assessor assessed extent of damage and confirmed scope of repairs needed. 
We flew back to XXXX. 
Interim cheque from XXXX for {$9100.00} issued. 
XXXX XXXX interim cheque received in XXXX and sent to First Horizon ( FH ) for endorsement. 
XXXX XXXX cheque received and signed for at FH. 
XXXX XXXX email sent to FH asking for an update. 
XXXX XXXX reply from FH stating cheque would be sent out that day and asking for a copy of XXXX Assessors report. I telephoned FH to check where cheque would be sent. 
See attached invoice from XXXX XXXX for the phone call. 

XXXX XXXX - Copy report emailed to FH Loss Draft Dept. 
XXXX XXXX email from FH Loss Draft Dept confirming receipt. 
XXXX XXXX emailed FH chasing cheque see attached. 

XXXX XXXXr FH finally responded saying that for security and privacy they could not provide any information and suggested that I ring. 
We had to use our personal savings to transfer money to USA to pay the roofing Company. 
XXXX XXXX email FH saying that I wanted someone to ring me as it was over XXXX weeks since I was supposedly sent my cheque. 
XXXX XXXX I received XXXX x letters from FH both dated XXXX XXXX but post marked XXXX XXXX arriving over XXXX weeks later than posted and over XXXX weeks later than created. 
Why such a deplorable delay? 
Ironically XXXX of the letters states, We hope to assist you with repairing the property as quickly as possible Some hope!

Out of sheer frustration I rang FH and spoke at length to the Loss Draft dept who told me that our cheque had been returned to them on XXXX XXXX as undeliverable. They had apparently left a message on our telephone number in Florida despite knowing that we lived in XXXX and that is where the cheque was supposed to be going. 
If I had not rung it would still be there! I was rightly, as you will agree, beyond angry!

FH clearly failed to provide a satisfactory standard of service.

I asked that the cheque be sent out again and ensured that they had the correct XXXX address. I was then transferred to a Customer Service Supervisor, XXXX, who apologised for the ongoing debacle, assured me that the cheque would be sent out as a matter of urgency. She also suggested that I write in with my formal complaint. I told her that I was expecting further cheques from Insurers and did not want the same thing to happen again. 
I was on the phone for over an hour! See attached invoice from XXXX XXXX for the phone call. 

XXXX XXXX yet another email to FH enquiring about the whereabouts of the cheque which was supposed to have been sent out by FH as a matter of urgency and still not received XXXX weeks later. 

XXXX XXXX having had no reply to my email of XXXX, I emailed FH to make further complaint that I had been waiting for this cheque for 3 MONTHS and to ask about their Complaints Procedure. 

XXXX XXXX email to FH requesting the courtesy of a response. 

Deafening Silence! 

XXXX XXXX cheque finally arrived attached to a letter from FH dated XXXX XX/XX/XXXX but because it had not been presented ASI put a stop on it on XXXX XXXX and reissued it. 

I am still awaiting the replacement cheque and so this will have to happen all over again with cheques bouncing back & forth over the XXXX! 

It is now XXXX weeks since our home was damaged and we are no further forward and it is down to the ineptitude and prevarication of FH.

All this time FH has been able to send us several Mortgage Statements and notices of Interest Rate change stating that my mortgage is going up by {$200.00} or so, so why has it not been able to do a simple task of endorsing and returning XXXX cheque? 



I am so genuinely very XXXX XXXX and obviously distressed at, not only the mental, but the financial burden that all of this has placed upon myself and my husband through no fault of our own. 

Not only have we suffered the damage to our house we have been made to suffer further by FHs failure to operate in a professional or efficient manner and to deal with the matter in a timely manner. 

As an ex XXXX XXXX in Her Majestys government, I am appalled at the laisez-faire attitude of FH I am seeking an offer of recompense from FH for all the time ( XXXX hours and counting ), costs and angst that we have had to bear due to the direct failure of FH to provide a level of service that one could reasonably have expected it to provide. Also, some clear assurance that it will improve. 

Your advices awaited. 

Yours sincerely ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ By email & post XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Complaint Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX : I originally wrote to you on the XXXX of XX/XX/XXXX about the unacceptable level of service that we had received from First Horizon following XXXX XXXX damage to our property. 
On XXXX XXXX I have received a very curt response from XXXX XXXX  of your office asking for 30 days to investigate. She advised that we thereafter then receive a response as the matter had been escalated to the Office of the President.

Deafening silence! It would appear to have been filed, certainly not escalated. 

I have phoned your offices on several occasions and have always been assured that someone will be in contact but I have heard nothing. 

I wish to receive a letter of apology along with an offer of recompense within the next 21 days whereafter I will refer the matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau for them to deal. 

Your urgent advices awaited. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ First Horizon 's eventual response was factually incorrect and dismissive. 

They have acted in a truly abhorrent, deceitful and unprofessional way and I want them reprimanded and made to offer an apology and fair compensation.

I am hereby requesting your attention and assistance in resolving the conflicting issues on the second mortgage as depicted in the sequence of events listed below. We have been contacted with overlapping claims from several companies on the second mortgage ( HELOC ). 
Chronological sequence of events : 1. Acquired mortgage from XXXX XXXX on XXXX XXXX. 
2. XXXX XXXX XXXX sold the first and second mortgage to XXXX. 
3. XXXX XXXX,, XXXX XXXX sold the first mortgage to XXXX who then transferred loan servicing to XXXX XXXX. The first mortgage was restructured and continues to be serviced by XXXX XXXX. XXXX retained the second mortgage ( HELOC ). 
4. XXXX XXXX, XXXX The HELOC was discharged according to my credit report. 
5. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX sent " offer to satisfy '' letter for the HELOC. 
6. XXXX, XXXX XXXX filed for Chapter XXXX. 
7. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX sold the HELOC to XXXX for servicing as a result of the Chapter XXXX. 
8. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX letter informed me that the HELOC was " charged off '' according to records acquired from XXXX. 
9. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX issues an Assignment of Mortgage to XXXX. 
10. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX assigns Power of Attorney to XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX transfers servicing to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. Shortly after, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX transfers servicing to XXXX. 
11. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX issues an Assignment of Mortgage to Partners for Payment Relief. 
12. XXXX XXXX Our attorney send a letter to the attorney representing Partners for Payment Relief in an attempt to reach a settlement, although the last payment on the XXXX, XXXX XXXX, is past the 6 years Statutes of Limitations. Our attorney reached again in XXXX XXXX. No formal response has been received from Partners for Payment Relief to this date. 
13. Our attorney is formulating a legal Quit Title in order to clear the clouded title as a result of the second mortgage.

complaint_text: Hello, My compliant is with the TransUnion Credit Reporting Agency. I have disputed many times and IRS sent a IRS Tax Lien Withdrawal Notification to all XXXX credit reporting agency to remove a federal tax lien dated XXXX/XXXX/2010. Please I need your help to make TransUnion comply with federal regulations. Also, TransUnion should be investigated because they seem to understand that the 10 years a tax lien reporting requirement is from the date the tax lien is paid, which is incorrect. The 10 years a tax lien may report on a consumers credit bureau is 10 years from date filed. This is undoubtedly affecting millions of consumers who do n't understand the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Thank you, XXXX

My phone was stolen in XXXX at around XXXX XX/XX/2023. I noticed transactions were being made after calling my bank. Claim was started with Santander bank for 3 claims in the total amount of {$8000.00}. Today I receive notification that my claims were denied due to inconsistency. My phone was stolen and money was transferred out of my account and it wasnt done by me. Please help

XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is violating my rights by reporting accounts that have reported as charged-off. I have not received a 1099-C from either one of these companies. 

According to 15 U.S. Code 1692e - False or misleading representations A debt collector may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation or means in connection with the collection of any debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation of this section : ( 1 ) The false representation or implication that the debt collector is vouched for, bonded by, or affiliated with the United States or any State, including the use of any badge, uniform, or facsimile thereof. 

( 2 ) The false representation of ( A ) the character, amount, or legal status of any debt; or ( B ) any services rendered or compensation which may be lawfully received by any debt collector for the collection of a debt. 

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts above has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

complaint_text: I would like to file a complaint regarding an account Experian is reporting. I have requested information, validation and method of verification multiple times with them but to nothing has been done. I have not received any response to my mailing from XX/XX/2020. The error is XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). In my letter disputing this error, I told Experian that I challenge the accuracy and reporting of this item. Experian is reporting that XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX is {$2700.00}, but the Balance reports as {$3900.00}, which is larger than the XXXX XXXX reporting on the account. Experian replied updating the item but validating this inaccurate information as accurate. When Experian verified the account as accurate per the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I requested their method of verification showing how they validated the debt as accurate, documentation, contact information of the individuals they spoke with and all relevant documentation. Experian did not respond in the 15 days required by the Fair Credit reporting Act to respond to requests for their method of verification. Then on XX/XX/2020 I filed a complaint here with CFPB stating that they had not responded to my method of verification letter and were in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. They closed the complaint # XXXX, with the most outrageous response saying " Your CFPB complaint regarding your reinvestigation does not appear to have been sent directly by you or to be authorized by you. As a precautionary measure, we have not taken any action on the request. '' This was a blatant refusal to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act and a stall tactic. Experian can not validate this item but is stalling to remove it as they should have done already per the Fair Credit Reporting Act since they have provided no proof they actually verified the account. As I stated I would in my initial letter to Experian, I have filed a complaint here with CFPB and also with the Ohio State Attorney General 's office. I will have no other choice but to soon file a small claims lawsuit with my local court if they do not delete this account from my credit report. I have attached my initial letter to Experian, my method of verification request to Experian, the certified mailing receipt, and my CFPB complaint where Experian tried to stall saying Your CFPB complaint regarding your reinvestigation does not appear to have been sent directly by you or to be authorized by you. As a precautionary measure, we have not taken any action on the request and my Highlighted Credit Report showing Experian Reporting the XXXX XXXX as {$2700.00} while reporting the balance as {$3900.00}.
primary_category: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for a range of violations, including but not limited to deprivation of rights under the color of law and engaging in unfair and deceptive trade practices. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX and CAPITAL ONE BANK ( USA ) , NATIONAL ASSOCIATION, has violated my unalienable rights of XXXX religion and faith, falsely accusing me of owing an alleged debt which I adamantly refuse to pay. This company has demonstrated unfair and deceptive trade practices, as well as unfair debt collection practices. 

My religious beliefs, as stated in XXXX XXXX of the XXXX XXXX emphasize " Owe no man anything, but to love one another, for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, however, has disregarded my religious convictions and persistently harassed me, making false statements about my concerns. 

In response to CFPB ID XXXX submitted on XX/XX/2023, XXXX XXXX XXXX stated that my concerns were already addressed in their previous response dated XX/XX/2023 which is false and misleading. 

Despite my explicit statement that I do not give lawful consent to transfer my personal identification information, the company continues to cause intentional infliction of emotional distress, XXXX, and harm to my family, willfully depriving us of our rights and XXXX faith. 

I reserve the rights to sue XXXX XXXX XXXX, its agents, employees, counsels, attorneys, etc., and demand compensation for the damages inflicted upon me and my family.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely, XXXX, XXXX All Rights Reserved UCC 1-308

complaint_text:
In XX/XX/XXXX ( dates are best estimates since the messages have been removed from my online portal with Newrez ) I submitted a request to have my home value reviewed for removal of PMI. I sent payment of {$150.00} for the broker 's opinion required for review. This check ( check number XXXX ) was debited from my checking account XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX reached out about doing the home value review. I got this scheduled and XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX came out to my home and took photos. He said he couldn't discuss home value with me, but that I could contact my mortgage company after he submits his assessment and I could get a copy of it. On XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, Newrez sent a letter stating my PMI removal request had been denied for one of five possible reasons and gave no specifics as to why. The only reason that could have applied to my situation is that the home value assessment wasn't high enough for removal ( LTV still above 80 % ) since the other reasons had to do with delinquency, etc. I called Newrez after receipt of this letter and asked for specifics on why my request was denied. The CSR said that it must have been too low of a value, but did not give specifics. I asked him for a copy of the assessment and he said it would be at my house in 7-10 days. I never received it. The end of XXXX or very beginning of XXXX, I sent a request to Newrez through the online portal asking for a copy of the assessment and haven't heard anything from them. 

This morning, XX/XX/XXXX, I received a home equity marketing email from Newrez ( which I frequently get ) stating my home 's estimated value is $ XXXX. The necessary home value needed for me to reach a LTV of 80 % for PMI removal is only $ XXXX. I'm getting mixed messages from them. They want to lend me more money on my home, but then won't remove the PMI. 

My complaint is : I believe the assessment on my home is low and would like to see a copy of the assessment. 
I never received the assessment after multiple requests. 
If they are going to estimate my home 's value at $ XXXX above what I need for PMI removal, they should remove it. They're quick to want to make money, but don't want to actually service the loan properly.

complaint_text:
Back in XXXX we applied for a XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and market crashed. The B of A loan modification was handled back east. They lost loan refinance paperwork several times. Finally after like 3rd try the loan was handled and docs signed. 
Then when we started making mortgage payments according to the loan agreement, Bank of America would not accept the payments and sent it back. Stating not accordance to their agreement. The Attorney we met with through B of A stated to just keep mailing the payments in. 
Clearly the west side of BOfA didnt have a clue what XXXX XXXX of BOfA was doing. When we would call they couldnt find any of the paperwork. After years of sitting on this back and forth frustration is at its high feeling like you have know one to back you. You try and move on. Even after our moving and had forwarding addresses in place we had never heard of any help regarding the bank defrauding homeowners. Over the last few years talking this over with my husband you still feel like you have no help in this matter. This was my home of XXXX XXXX and we raised or children there and it was the investment of our lifetime. This was such an injustice done. Is there still anything that can be done???

On XX/XX/2020 I received a letter back from XXXX  stating that the account I disputed was verified and a derogatory mark still remains on my credit report per XXXX XXXX and XXXX. Upon, further research, this account was transferred/sold and I am no longer responsible for the account. Debtor 's creditor did not verify this collection/charge-off. Also, there was NO written form of communication, contract, or signature for this accused debt at all. A bill without a signature does not validate the debt and anybody can send a bill and say its mines. According to the FCRA, Target Card Services has violated my rights as a consumer and I'm requesting legal action to remove this account immediately.

secondary_category: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: I was alerted of a loan opportunity by XXXX  XXXX and what happened was, they said they would approve me for a loan. I gave them my banking information to deposit the loan into my account. What happened was chase bank started reversing charges into my account that I already paid to lenders. I don't know why or who gave them authorization to reverse these transactions in my account. But no one gave them authorization to reverse these actions in my account, they reversed {$2800.00} from my account which drew my account over and turned my lights off. Also messed up my XXXX, my cellphone. Everything in my account that I paid they messed up and was left in the dark the whole day because I didn't have power nor the money to pay it. Since then I've opened a new account, put fraud on my account, chase has STILL messed with my account. Constantly coming out of my account and I don't know where they are coming from. New charges are coming out of my new account and I don't understand where they are coming from. Chase is messing up my account as right now I am overdrawn because chase took a payment out of my account for entergy. They reversed that payment because I didn't have funs to pay it, so what they did was take XXXX of the fraud payments to pay XXXX, and that I would just have to pay {$200.00} to get my XXXX  on. What I don't understand is the same check I wrote to XXXX  they declined and went and sent it back and withdrew my account again. I also got a subscription from " XXXX  '' and I don't know who they are. I have been overdrawn since the XXXX of XXXX and I have no access to my account. Can you please help me with this matter and retrieving my reversals and getting them back so I can pay the creditors.

On XXXX XXXX, 2015 I informed Equifax that the judgment being reported on my credit file was vacated and should be deleted. I received a notice with the above confirmation number that Equifax will not delete it because it is accurate. I have supplied a copy of the docket report showing clearly where it states that the judgment was vacated on XXXX XXXX, 2015. Clearly this investigation is flawed, and/or there is questionable practices being made by Equifax. 
I am making this complaint pursuant to the FCRA, which states that : 621. Administrative enforcement [ 15 U.S.C. 1681s ] ( a ) Enforcement by Federal Trade Commission. ( 1 ) In General. The Federal Trade Commission shall be authorized to enforce compliance with the requirements imposed by this title under the Federal Trade Commission Act ( 15 U.S.C. 41 et seq. ), with respect to consumer reporting agencies and all other persons subject thereto. 

611. Procedure in case of disputed accuracy [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information ( A ) In general. If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall - ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer.

I am unaware of this debt and did not receive proper notification of this debt which violates 12 CFR 1006.34 ( B ) ( 5 ) but yet this has been placed on my consumer file. Debt collectors must notify you within XXXX days of receiving your account. THIS HAS NOT BEEN DONE. I also have not been given a chance to dispute this debt according to 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) if you believe you have supplied me with the proper notification, please provide the Certified Mail Receipt with my signature.

In late XX/XX/XXXX I chose to close out my escrow account and have my mortgage company refund my XXXX and after a series of haggles they FINALLY closed out the account and sent me the check for XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX which I promptly deposited on the same day. You can only guess the horror on my face when my bank deducted the money on XX/XX/XXXX labeling it as a " Returned Deposit Item ''! My mortgage company had issued me a BOUNCED CHECK! So I immediately called my bank and they said the check was not honored and to talk to my mortgage company. So I talked to a chat rep who told me she could either resend a check to me OR do a wire transfer. I elected a wire transfer since it seemed to be a lot faster. Silly me ... XXXX... Now my mortgage company is in the process of " INVESTIGATION '' and is telling me they have 30 days to resolve the issue unless they use the 15 day extension! It's simply UNBELIEVABLE a mortgage company bouncing checks that I pay my mortgage to, that won't pay MY escrow money back...

On XX/XX/XXXX. I spoke to XXXX XXXX at IC Systems Inc. rep # XXXX who was attempting to collect a debt for an account at XXXX XXXX XXXX. I asked XXXX a few details about the account and then I asked her if she could send me something in writing with that information. She said I would receive something. I never received anything. I got a notification on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Through XXXX  credit reporting app that There was a collection placed on my credit from this company. When I called and spoke to another representative XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I explained to him the situation and what I requested from the last representative and that I didnt receive anything in the mail. He then told me that there was an email sent out to me. I let him know that I did not receive an email and that I dont think that email is the best way for you to send something to someone because things go to spam and junk folders all the time. I asked if he could remove the derogatory mark from my credit and send me a formal letter to my address to give me time to look it over and verify the details and make sure everything looked OK if I needed to disputed, I could disputed and if everything looked Accurate then I would pay it. He said he could not. I called back and spoke to another representative and Supervisor who told me that they could not do this even though I told them that this appears to be an infringement on my rights as a consumer, I did not say I would not pay it if it was mine if the details looked accurate and everything is fine I just asked them to be able to look it over and make sure they are legitimate company. This is the right amount that this is my dad, those things of that nature which are due to me. I was then told that they will send a letter out to me today, but they will not. I can not remove the report. I was not giving my right to dispute the debt nor told that I could dispute the debt.

I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the negligence of my mortgage company in handling our mortgage payments, as well as their inadequate customer service. Their failure to properly process payments and the difficulty in reaching representatives has caused significant financial hardship and frustration. 

Our original monthly payment is {$1700.00}. Our first payment to Mr. Cooper was made in XXXX but was returned on XX/XX/XXXX, incurring a returned check fee of {$29.00}. The payment was then taken out on XX/XX/XXXX, but we were charged another returned check fee on XX/XX/XXXX, and again on XX/XX/XXXX. 

In XXXX, we made a payment arrangement for XXXX, XXXX, and XX/XX/year>, with XXXX payment set at {$2500.00}. However, the payments for both XXXX and XXXX were not processed properly. We were charged returned check fees of {$29.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. This led us to contact the VA to see what other options were available to make payments, and under their guidance, we were informed that we could pay via XXXX Mr. Cooper failed to inform us about, despite numerous inquiries. XXXX payment was successfully made via XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Later in XXXX, we received a call from the company informing us that the payment arrangement set up by the previous representative was no longer valid. The new arrangement extends until XX/XX/year>, with a payment amount of {$2300.00}. Furthermore, we were told that we could no longer use XXXX and must make payments via autopay, the very system that caused these issues in the first place. So we opted to pay XXXX payment the original amount of {$1700.00} until some kind of resolution can be made. 

Now, we are paying over {$1000.00} in loan interest, with only {$200.00} going toward the principal. We are also being charged return check fees of {$29.00}, 2-3 times a month due to their mishandling of the autopay system. The company has been inconsistent in handling payment agreements and providing clear information on payment options. 

Additionally, speaking to a representative has become an ordeal. Each time we need to speak to someone about our mortgage, we have to spend 20 minutes or more navigating through an automated system just to be routed to a representative. This experience tells me that customer satisfaction is not even a priority for this company. They do not seem concerned with their customers well-being, which mirrors the very same issues that led to Nationstar being bought out by Mr. Cooper. The problems continue, just under a new name. 

It is deeply concerning that this company is still allowed to handle peoples mortgages, homes, and sense of security. We have already spoken to the VA, who informed us that payments can be made via XXXX, despite the mortgage company failing to provide this option after multiple inquiries. They also falsely claimed that debit card payments can be made through their automatic payment line, which is not true. 

This company has repeatedly failed to uphold their end of our agreement, and their removal of other payment options has made it increasingly difficult for us to manage payments. Their negligence has caused us financial hardship and undue stress. 

I request immediate action to resolve this issue, including reinstating other payment methods, addressing the fees caused by their mishandling, and improving customer service for the benefit of all their clients.

I am a victim of identity theft and this debt does not belong to me.

complaint_text: Due to a significant drop in income, I initiated an application for mortgage assistance/modification to Chase on XXXX/XXXX/15 - since that time I have repeatedly submitted document after document per their request. I have been told on FOUR occasions that they had all the information they needed to proceed with their underwriting process. During this 7 MONTH process, I have complied with all requests and continued to make my mortgage payments - even though I had to take money out of my retirement to make those payments. Chase employees have lied to me several times, and failed to come up with any modification to my loan. I have read online that this is a common complaint and has resulted in multiple lawsuits - which may be the only way to resolve this issue. Either Chase is lying that they even have a loan modification program, or they make the process so impossible that homeowners are forced into foreclosure.

Hello, I am writing to delete the following information on my credit report. The following items are listed in the report. I am a victim of identity theft. The charges made on the account were not mine. The items need to be deleted as they are inaccurate items on my credit report. The theft of my identity was reported to the federal Trade Commission. Also, I have an enclosed copy of the Federal Trade Commission id-entity theft affidavit. Please find it in your best interest to delete the items. 


I would like to emphasize the following legal obligations under the FCRA : Under 1681b, a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only under specific circumstances, including " In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, or a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury. '' This provision strictly limits when my consumer report can be furnished, and I do not believe any of these circumstances apply in this case. 


Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), credit bureaus must conduct a " reasonable reinvestigation '' upon receiving notice of a consumer dispute. I am formally notifying you of this dispute, and I expect a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation of all items I've identified. 


15 U.S. Code 1681b outlines the permissible purposes of consumer reports, including conditions for furnishing and using consumer reports for employment purposes. I do not believe any of these permissible purposes apply to the disputed items on my report. 


15 U.S. Code $ 1681c-2 a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any. information in the file o
f a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt. 

15 U.S. Code 1681 Section B ( i ) - Requirements relating to reinsertion of previously deleted material - If a consumer reporting agency removes information from someone's credit file based on the requirements in the preceding section ( A ), the agency can not re-add or reinsert that previously deleted information back into the person 's file unless the entity that originally provided that information certifies that it is complete and accurate.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

In the quiet humdrum of everyday life, a sudden jolt shattered the tranquility : I had become a victim of identity theft. Like a thief in the night, unseen hands had stolen my personal information, plunging me into a bewildering maze of uncertainty. With each fraudulent transaction and unauthorized account, the breach of trust cut deep, leaving me grappling with the unsettling reality of a violated identity. Yet, in the midst of chaos, a glimmer of resilience emerged, a resolve to reclaim what was rightfully mine and restore the harmony stolen by unseen adversaries. These are the following accounts need to be removed :

complaint_text: I recently became a successor in interest on this loan. I am now trying to assume the losn as I was awarded the house through the divorce and since my ex husband has recently passed away I am trying to assume the mortgage so that I can be obligated on the note. Rushmore Loan Management has told me over the phone on XX/XX/XXXX and also through secure messaging sent to me in late XXXX that they do not allow Assumptions and they are trying to force me yo refinance. My loan is with XXXX XXXX and I believe that they allow Assumptions under certain conditions. I am a single mom with two kids who now no longer have a dad and I am struggling to ensure that not only we keep our home, but ensure I can sell it if I need too. Please assist me in getting this mortgzge company to allow an assumption. I am currently not behind on my mortgage, but they just raised my payments again in the last year due to an escrow analysis and I would not be able to complete a modification if I cant assume the note. Thank you for your help.

I then emailed XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to resolve and was directed to call their customer service team. I have also emailed XXXX XXXX and Credit Control Corporation to validate the debt has been discharged and can not get confirmation in written form.
