complaint_text:
I am filing a complaint against [ LOCKHART MORRIS & MONTGOMERY ). I requested that they provide validation of the debt they are attempting to collect, including proof of their right to collect the debt and evidence that the debt is mine. Despite my repeated requests, they have failed to provide the necessary documentation to validate the debt. 
The details are as follows : XXXX [ XXXX XXXX ], I sent a written request to ( LOCKHART MORRIS & MONTGOMERY ) asking for validation of the debt. 
I requested that they provide a copy of the original contract or agreement that indicates my obligation to pay the debt. 
I also asked for a detailed account of the debt, including the original creditor 's name, the amount owed, and how the amount was calculated. 
Additionally, I requested proof that [ LOCKHART MORRIS & MONTGOMERY ] has the legal right to collect the debt. 

Despite allowing a reasonable amount of time for them to respond, I have not received any of the requested documentation. This lack of response is not only concerning but also a violation of my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 
I am seeking assistance from the CFPB to ensure that [ LOCKHART MORRIS & MONTGOMERY ] provides the necessary validation of the debt and ceases collection efforts until they do so. I would also like to request that any negative information reported to credit bureaus be removed until the debt is properly validated. 



Thank you for your assistance in this matter.
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

complaint_text: Our loan with  XXXX  was transferred to NationStar in  XXXX  of  XXXX .     My husband and I filed Chapter  XXXX  in  XXXX  of  XXXX  and from that point forward we were no longer able to make online payments and no longer received any communication or monthly statements even though the mortgage is not included in the  XXXX   XXXX .     My husband and I are in the final steps of a REFI and were contacted by the Credit Bureau for a conference call with NationStar on Wednesday  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX . The call took place on Thursday,  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX , where we were informed that we were a payment late for the last 3 years starting in  XXXX  of  XXXX .     I called NationStar the next day, Friday,  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX , and spoke to customer service regarding my Payment History and they told me that I didnt show any late payments, but there was a payment in suspense and I just needed to pay {$890.00} to get it out of suspense and my account would be up to date. My daughter was sick at school and I needed to get off the line so I just paid it so I could get my daughter, but I really didnt understand why there was a partial payment in suspense and why I had to pay almost {$900.00}.     The next day, I pulled up my Payment History and I saw that the  XXXX   XXXX  payment was not applied as a payment. This payment was put in suspense causing any payment thereafter to b e 1 p ayment behind to date. I called on Saturday,  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX , and customer service said I had to call back on Monday when the bankruptcy department was open. I called first thing Monday morning,  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  and spoke to  XXXX   XXXX  and repeated what I had found. The  XXXX   XXXX  payment was not applied as a payment and showed next payment due  XX/XX/XXXX  instead of  XX/XX/XXXX . Once this is corrected, I will not only be current as I have always been, but a payment ahead because of the money that was held in suspense and the additional {$890.00} I paid to make up a full monthly mortgage payment. The customer service rep,  XXXX , put in a request to the research department and I told her that this needs to be dealt with today. I am at the end of a REFI and this is the only thing holding it up. She said she can only place a request and state it as a priority.     I have called every day since and my request has not been touched and I have even spoke with a supervisor named,  XXXX  and he said that they can not contact the Research Department via phone or any other way. I find this extremely odd for a huge company. NationStar is the one at fault for this error and needs to fix it in an expedited manner! I have been patient long enough and do not want to lose this REFI!!! This error should have been caught and fixed when the conference call took place with the Credit Bureau on  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX .

complaint_text: Equifax continues to report information on my credit file that is not mine. The company also continues to place an address associated with the inaccurate accounts back on my credit file after it has been deleted numerous times. ( See Attachments ) I have filed a number of disputes with the agency to no avail. I have called the US Bankruptcy Courts-XXXX who Equifax alleges furnished the information at ( XXXX ) XXXX. The Courts informed me that they did not furnish the information to Equifax. Equifax refuses to provide me with the name, phone number and/or address of the Company who allegedly verified the inaccurate information. The following address and accounts are not mine and are inaccurately reporting on my consumer credit profile ; 1 ) US BK Court-XXXX # XXXX 2 ) US BK Court-XXXX # XXXX 3 ) US BK Court-XXXX # XXXX 4 ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MD XXXX I have provided all documentation required of me by law and Equifax continues to violate my rights. The FCRA prohibits information furnishers from providing information to a CRA that they know or have reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate. However, the furnisher is not subject to this general prohibition if it clearly and conspicuously specifies an address to which consumers may write to notify the furnisher that certain information is inaccurate. Sections 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and ( a ) ( 1 ) ( C ). Equifax has provided false and misleading information that the Courts have furnished and verified the inaccurate accounts when in fact the Court has not provided the Consumer Reporting Agency with any information. These inaccurate accounts have hindered me from gaining credit and I also have been denied credit do to the frivolous accounts.

This situation has become unbearable. Out of nowhere, I find myself tied to a debt that isnt mine, completely unverified, yet Im being harassed non-stop through various channels. The aggressive collection tactics and threats of legal action are beyond unacceptablethis is a violation of my rights and an insult to me as a responsible consumer. The stress has taken a serious toll on my mental health, and Ive endured sleepless nights dealing with this nightmare.
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

complaint_text:
Subject : Request for Blocking and Deletion of Accounts Due to Data Breach Dear Equifax Dispute Resolution Team, I am writing to formally request the blocking and deletion of certain accounts from my credit file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ), which provides protections for victims of identity theft. As a victim of the recent data breach, I have reason to believe that the following accounts were fraudulently created or have been impacted by unauthorized use of my personal information.

Please take immediate action to block and delete the following accounts from my credit report : Collections Accounts : XXXX XXXX Balance : {$3000.00} Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX Status : Placed for Collection Removal Date : XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : {$230.00} Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX  Status : Placed for Collection Removal Date : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Balance : {$400.00} Original Creditor : XXXX Status : Placed for Collection Removal Date : XXXX/2031 XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Balance : {$2400.00} Original Creditor : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Status : Placed for Collection Removal Date : XXXX/2030 Online Information Services Balance : {$310.00} Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Status : Placed for Collection Removal Date : XXXXXXXX Charge-Offs : XXXXXXXX XXXX  Balance : {$0.00} ( was {$2400.00} ) Status : Sold ; was in Collection Removal Date XXXX XXXX In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ), I am providing the following documentation to support my claim : A copy of my government-issued ID ( e.g., driver 's license or passport ) A copy of my Social Security card A copy of a police report or FTC Identity Theft Report I request that you complete this investigation promptly and notify me of the outcome. If additional documentation or information is required, please contact me at the information provided below. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to confirmation that these accounts have been blocked and deleted from my credit report. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

complaint_text: I want to stress that I did not give written permission for these specific transactions to be included in my consumer report. At no point did I authorize these entries, and their presence on my report is unwarranted. Consequently, I am formally requesting that these accounts be blocked and removed from my report immediately. complaint_text:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : CFPB Late Payment Removal - Final Request Dear CFPB Representative, I am filing a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX  and TransUnion for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Despite multiple written requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ), my requests have been ignored, constituting a violation of multiple federal statutes, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
Violations Committed : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations : Under 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors must send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The continued reporting of this inaccurate late payment demonstrates a failure to comply with this requirement. 
15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of consumer credit files. In my case, this obligation has not been upheld. 
15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) requires that consumer reporting agencies maintain reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy in credit reports.

15 U.S. Code 1681a ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) states that certain transactions and experiences should not be considered part of a consumer report if they do not meet specific criteria. 
Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Violations : The TILA emphasizes the necessity of accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The wrongful reporting of a late payment has damaged my creditworthiness, causing undue financial harm. 
Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) Violations : 15 U.S. Code 6801, 15 U.S. Code 6802, and 15 U.S. Code 6803 require financial institutions to protect consumer privacy and ensure the accuracy of financial reporting. The mishandling of my credit information suggests a failure to meet these obligations. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX of Obligations XXXX ( XXXX ) : This act holds creditors accountable for providing timely statements and preventing unfair penalties. The continued presence of this late payment on my report contradicts this protection. 
XXXX XXXX and XXXX - 18 U.S. Code 1028A : The continued reporting of false information could be classified as a misrepresentation of identity or fraudulent reporting, which carries legal consequences under federal law. 
Formal Request for Correction : I formally demand the immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notation from my credit report. 
If this issue is not resolved immediately, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant agencies. 
Reference to XXXX ( Paid As Agreed Never Late ) : The terms of our agreement have always been met, and the account in question must reflect the status of " Paid As Agreed, Never Late. '' I request documented proof supporting the claim of late payments, including : Dates, amounts, and all communication records indicating that the payments were actually late. 
In the absence of valid proof, I expect an immediate correction of my credit report. 
If, after investigation, you fail to provide verifiable proof of late payments, I demand that the account be updated immediately to reflect its accurate status as " Paid As Agreed, Never Late. '' Per the FCRA, I expect a timely investigation and a written response within 30 days from the receipt of this dispute letter. Failure to comply will be considered a direct violation of multiple federal laws. 

Discrepancies Identified : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  reports a XXXX late payment for XX/XX/XXXX, while TransUnion and XXXX both report the account as " OK '' ( on time ) for the same period. 


This inconsistency shows the late mark is unreliable and unverifiable. 


Account XXXX and Remarks The account is reported as " Closed '' and " Paid '' by all three bureaus with a {$0.00} balance, contradicting any ongoing delinquency. 


XXXX  states : Account previously in dispute- now resolved by data furnisher, which further casts doubt on the accuracy of the late payment reported. 


No Valid Reason for Delinquency With the account marked as paid and closed in XX/XX/XXXX, the reported late payments for XXXX and XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX are illogical and should not exist post-closure. 
XXXX Requested : XXXX removal of the late payment notation from my credit report. 
Written confirmation of the correction. 
Acknowledgment of compliance with federal laws. 
I trust that you will promptly rectify this issue and ensure my credit report reflects accurate information. Thank you for your immediate attention to this serious matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
Complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and State Attorney Generals Office Subject : Formal Complaint Against FirstCredit Services for FDCPA and FCRA Violations To Whom It May Concern, I am filing a formal complaint against FirstCredit Services for improper debt collection practices and violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The company has failed to provide proper debt validation before reporting a derogatory collection account to the credit bureaus, causing unjust harm to my credit profile.

Details of the Complaint : 1. Lack of Proper Notification & Debt Validation On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX claims to have sent me an email regarding this alleged debt. This was their only attempt to notify me before reporting the debt to the credit bureaus. 
Under FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g, a debt collector must provide written notice of a debt within five days of initial communication. No such written notice was ever received.

2. Failure to Provide Debt Validation Upon Request On XX/XX/year>, I received a phone call from a representative of FirstCredit Services, during which I first became aware of this alleged debt. 
I immediately requested a validation letter, yet the company has failed to provide any documentation proving the validity of the debt or their authority to collect it. 
This is a clear violation of my rights under the FDCPA, which requires debt collectors to cease collection efforts until proper validation is provided.

3. Unlawful Reporting to Credit Bureaus Despite failing to provide debt validation, FirstCredit Services reported this account to the credit bureaus, resulting in a derogatory mark on my credit report.

Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ), information furnished to credit reporting agencies must be accurate and verifiable. Reporting a debt without first validating it is a violation of the FCRA and constitutes unfair and deceptive practices.

Consumer Reporting Agencies are required to handle credit information fairly and respect every consumers right to privacy. Accurate reporting is essential to the banking system, and unfair or inaccurate reporting harms public trust. I never gave my explicit written consent for these agencies to report my information, which violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ). Because of this, I am now dealing with an alleged case of identity theft, covered under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, and the accounts listed are not connected to any transactions made by me.

Additionally, the debt collector involved has violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). They violated 15 U.S.C. 1692f by attempting to collect amounts not authorized by any agreement or by law. They also violated 15 U.S.C. 1692e by using false, misleading, or deceptive methods to collect a debt or obtain my information. On top of that, they have contacted me at inconvenient times and have harassed me about a debt that is not mine, which is strictly prohibited. THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNTS ARE NEED TO BE REMOVED :
MOHELA - Under 15 U.S Code 1605 ( a ) If a Finance Charge was included which is the sum of all payments There Should be no late payments on this account. Your improper procedures are highly damaging to my credit score. Please immediately delete this item. - Please remove.XX/XX/XXXX Under 15 U.S Code 1605 ( a ) If a Finance Charge was included which is the sum of all payments There Should be no late payments on this account. Your improper procedures are highly damaging to my credit score. Please immediately delete this item. - Please remove. KIKOFF - Under 15 U.S Code 1605 ( a ) If a Finance Charge was included which is the sum of all payments There Should be no late payments on this account. Your improper procedures are highly damaging to my cr
edit score. Please immediately delete this item. - Please remove. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b Permissible purposes of consumer reports I never gave you any written consent to report anything on my consumer reports no consent is identity theft. - Please remove this from my credit report. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX - This inquiry was not authorized- Please Remove XX/XX/XXXXXX/XX/XXXX - This inquiry was not authorized- Please Remove XXXX XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX - This inquiry was not authorized- Please Remove
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
I am the executrix of my deceased parents estate. I use the term estate begrudgingly. As I was left a monumental disaster to deal with. I am still in the process of dealing with this mess. My parents had no life insurance policies, no savings, no retirement. They only had debts, and I have spent thousands of dollars of my own money dealing with this mess. Ive spent thousands on dumpsters clearing refuse out of their house so I can someday put it on the market to be sold, this is an ongoing process. I am not there yet. This estate has placed me in financial distress. But I am trying my best to deal with it. 

But in the meantime creditors have put liens on the property, which is understandable, as this estate is ongoing and there is no money to pay these debts at this point. But they will be settled when the property is eventually sold. 

Except the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and their solicitor, XXXX XXXX XXXX, who have chosen to pursue a debt of an unpaid sewer bill with me personally, the executrix, instead of placing a lien on the property of my parents. 

First of all, my mother died two years ago, in the subsequent two years they have never sent a bill or attempted to collect any money from me or the estate. They claimed to have sent bills, which is a blatant lie, as I check my mail everyday and would have paid the quarterly bill due. Instead they have chosen to wait until the amount is large enough that I or the estate can not afford to pay it. I did offer to make payments to a nice gentleman, named XXXX. His last name escapes me. XXXX refused to accept the payments that I was able to make and instead threatened to put a lien on my parents property. I told him he was free to do so. Apparently that wasnt enough for XXXX, he likes to harass the families of deceased people and threaten to ruin their credit and place them in dire financial situations over a bill that was never theirs. 

My name is not on the account associated with this sanitary authority, it is not my bill personally and it is not my account nor is it my property! The home, therefore the subsequent debts, do not belong to me personally. Yet, I am being harassed and threatened by the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and their lawyer. They refer to the debt as your past due sewer account. That is a blatant misrepresentation of the facts. This has never been my sewer account. I dont even know the account number. Then they go on to threaten legal action against me personally if the amount of {$780.00} isnt paid in full within 30 days. Im not sure why they would harass me and threaten to sue me when they can just put a lien on the property, which ensures they receive payment when the estate is settled. This is abusive. Then they proceed to threaten to seize my property and place a judgment against me. I do not have the ability to appear in court. I do not even reside in the same state where my parents owe this debt. I live hundreds of miles away. 

This is clearly an attempt to scare me into paying this debt, a debt that is not even mine. It is a blatant attempt to extort money from me through methods of intimidation and harassment and I will not tolerate it. I will make further complaints and I will not stop until this issue is resolved. Any further contact is unwanted and will be viewed as continued harassment.

complaint_text:
The credit bureaus keep disrespecting the laws. I showed them multiple times of how they are violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

According to 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) the credit bureaus have to modify or delete accounts that are not reporting accurately According to 15 USC 1681b ( 1 ) the credit bureaus dont have no written premission According to 15 USC 1681 I have the right to privacy According to 15 USC 1681s-2 A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

I can go on and on The credit bureaus have no respect for the laws. 

Someone needs to hold them accountable for this XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

complaint_text:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered an account that had been " added '' on my credit report with no notification. It was an auto loan with XXXX from XX/XX/XXXX. The " date reported '' was listed as " XX/XX/XXXX ''. On XX/XX/XXXX, I faxed numerous documents to Equifax showing that it had never been on my report and was not mine. They have repeatedly mixed my data with other people with the same name as mine and taken months to correct it after I 've informed them of it. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed a dispute since they would not remove it via phone or fax. I called Chase Auto Finance to confirm that the account was belonging to someone else with the same name as me, but an address I never lived at, and different social security number and date of birth. 

Today on XX/XX/XXXX, it shows it has been updated. They moved the " date reported '' to XX/XX/XXXX, the day I faxed them proof showing that it did n't exist prior to then, and moved it from Open Accounts to Closed and charged off. I called XXXX again and they confirmed that I do not have any accounts with them. 

Clearly Equifax did not actually verify the ownership of this account under the requirements of FCRA and on top of that, they altered the history to hide that it was mixed in with mine through their data-linking software by changing the date it was reported to the file. 

I attached reports from XX/XX/XXXX - no account present ; XX/XX/XXXX - account present with XX/XX/XXXX insertion date and a screen shot of the updated account showing that the insertion date was changed to XX/XX/XXXX. I have a record of numerous reports that I can provide as well. I provided multiple Equifax reports to Equifax to show that the information was erroneously linked to my report ( along with two other accounts they removed that shared the SAME address and SSN as this account ).

EQUIFAX has been given notice by my XXXX that they are in violation of my XXXX consumer rights. They have still not performed their Fiduciary duties to ensure the accuracy of the consumer report and file. They have failed to provide written proof of my Trusts consent to furnish any information. 

. This dispute is based on the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically : 1. 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) - Exclusion of transactions between consumer and creditor.

2. 15 USC 1681b - Permissible purpose law.

3. 15 USC 1681e ( b ) - Duty to ensure accuracy and completeness.

I. Unauthorized Information Pursuant to 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ), all transactions between me and the creditor are excluded from my credit report. However, my review reveals unauthorized information still present. I request immediate removal, as it violates federal law.

II. Inaccurate Information Furthermore, I've identified inaccurate information. In accordance with 15 USC 1681b, I request documentation supporting accuracy. Specifically, I demand : 1. A signed affidavit under penalties of perjury attesting 100 % accuracy ( 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ).

2. Proof of written consent from me authorizing information collection and disclosure.

3. A completed Form SSA-89 with a wet signature.

III. Initial Investigation I take issue with your agency 's failure to contact me during the initial investigation to validate disputed information. This oversight violates 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), requiring reasonable reinvestigation and direct consumer verification. 

IV. Legal Precedent Recent case law supports my dispute : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Credit reporting agencies must ensure accuracy ( XXXX XXXX XXXX  ). 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer consent required for information collection ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
- XXXX v. Equifax Information Services, XXXX ( XXXX ) : Agencies must conduct reasonable reinvestigations ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 

Additional resources : - Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) : Disputing Errors on Credit Reports - Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) : Disputing Errors on Your Credit Report - Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 15 USC 1681-1681x.

Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Freedom Mortgage regarding a serious issue with the creation of an escrow account without my knowledge, which has led to the improper distribution of tax dollars and an unjust doubling of my mortgage payments. 

Background : I recently discovered that Freedom Mortgage incorrectly established an escrow account for my property taxes in XXXX XXXX. Despite my property taxes being fully paid and not overdue, Freedom Mortgage has disbursed tax dollars from this account for taxes I did not owe. This mistake has had significant financial repercussions for me. 

Specific Issues : Incorrect Escrow Account Setup : Freedom Mortgage initiated an escrow account without verifying the accuracy of the tax information. As a result, they have erroneously collected and distributed funds for taxes that were not owed on my property. 

Increased Mortgage Payments : Due to the incorrect setup of the escrow account, my mortgage payments have been unfairly doubled. This increase is directly related to the mismanagement of the escrow account and the improper disbursement of funds. 

Actions Taken : I have attempted to resolve this issue directly with Freedom Mortgage, but their responses have been inadequate. They have not provided a satisfactory resolution or corrected the errors in their records, despite my numerous attempts to rectify the situation. 

Request for CFPB Assistance : I kindly request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that : The incorrect escrow account setup is corrected. 
The erroneous payments made from the escrow account are reimbursed to me. 
My mortgage payments are adjusted to reflect the correct amount, eliminating any undue increase caused by this error. 
I am including copies of all relevant documents, including correspondence with Freedom Mortgage, statements showing the incorrect escrow setup, and evidence of the undue increase in my mortgage payments. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt assistance in resolving this issue. 

Sincerely,

I am disputing the late payment reported on my credit file, as it is inaccurate and does not reflect my consistent record of on-time payments. This erroneous entry misrepresents my financial responsibility and unfairly harms my creditworthiness.

complaint_text:
Dear CFPB, My name is XXXX XXXX, and I am writing to demand the removal of an inaccurate collection account from my credit report and compensation for my time and effort in disputing it. The account in question is from Portfolio Recovery Associates and it is showing on my credit report without my consent. I have no contract with Portfolio Recovery Associates and have given no consent for them to use my name, likeness, or credit data. 

Furthermore, this collection account violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) as per Section 607 ( a ) ( 1 ) and ( 2 ) of the FCRA which requires credit reporting agencies like XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX to ensure that the information they report is accurate, complete and up-to-date. Also, Section 615 ( a ) ( 1 ) states that no person shall furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or consciously avoids knowing that the information is inaccurate. Additionally, this violates Section 621 of the FCRA which states that any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this title with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00}, as the court may allow.

Furthermore, this violates 15 U.S.C 1681 et seq, particularly 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 15 U.S.C 1681j which states that credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates and any person who fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this title shall be liable to the United States for a civil penalty. Furthermore, this collection account was fraudulently bought and sold, which is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Rosenthal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( RFDCPA ), which prohibit the sale or purchase of a debt that the seller or purchaser knows or should know is not legitimate. This also violates the prohibition of any form of deception or fraud under the federal laws such as 18 U.S.C. 1341 ( Mail Fraud ) and 18 U.S.C.

1343 ( Wire Fraud ) I demand that you immediately investigate this matter and take necessary action to remove the illegal collection account from my credit report and also compensate me for my time and effort in disputing it. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

complaint_text: I am filing a complaint against Equifax for their continuous violations of several federal laws that are designed to protect consumers like me. These laws include 15 USC 1681 section 602a, which mandates that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate consumer information ; 15 USC 6801, which establishes privacy and security standards for consumer financial information ; 15 USC 1681 section 604a section 2, requiring a reasonable investigation of consumer disputes ; 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ), which demands comprehensive information security programs ; 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ), prohibiting the reporting of outdated information ; 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A, outlining responsibilities in investigating and correcting inaccurate information ; 15 U.S. Code 1681e, requiring accurate reporting of credit information ; and 12 CFR 1016.7, mandating a reasonable investigation of disputes within 30 days. Despite my attempts to address the inaccuracies on my credit report, Equifax has failed to take appropriate action to rectify the situation or comply with these federal laws. I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau conducts a thorough investigation and holds Equifax accountable for their unlawful practices, including the removal of inaccurate information and appropriate penalties for their violations.
primary_category: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: to whom it may concern good morning, I hope you can help me my name is XXXX XXXX I am very angry and sad about a situation with my bank wells fargo this would be the second report that I make through you the first report with number XXXX, what happened It is that they misused my account with my debit card, charges were made that I did not authorize and the bank deposited one of the claims and the other told me that I authorized them and that is false because they are the same expenses, the same claim There were two reports, one of several purchases that add up to {$3300.00} with XXXX XXXX, this one was already reimbursed to me and the other claim that was for the same situation for the amount of {$3800.00} with XXXX XXXX, they do not want to reimburse me and I do not understand why a claim does and the other does not, I would like to know why they are ensuring that I make or authorize said purchases, that is false, I never signed or gave any authorization, they are only recovering {$3300.00} when the total is {$7200.00} There is a shortfall in my account of {$3800.00}, as I mentioned, I am very upset because I need my money, it is all my savings, and because I feel that they are defaming me badly, I have read a bit on the internet and from what I understand they are responsible for charges not recognized or not authorized by the zero liability protection, I hope that through you the bank resolves me soon, I would not like to resort to other legal instances, I would also like to know why they determine and close a case without conducting an investigation, I thank you Your help I hope you have an excellent day sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX

We have not made a home loan payment to Bank of America ( our home loan carrier ) since XXXX, XXXX, and that payment was late ; for XXXX. 

I was told by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that for {$2400.00}, we could stop making payments and get an amended or refinance for our home loan. So in XXXX, XXXX, we stopped making pmts to BoA. Several months later, XXXX was shut down for operating illegally, and I found a non-profit corp. in our town to help us deal with BoA on saving our home. A few things contributed to our inability to make the 5 % fixed 30 year payments of XXXX $ XXXX ( incl. late fee ) - a death in the family and a forced early retirement for me. We had about $ XXXX in other debt, which ( with help ) XXXX got settled with each lender for ~ XXXX total and then built up a $ XXXX savings toward a new home-loan modification, and worked to pay off the final XXXX, which is done, and our XXXX payments have started coming in in XXXX for XXXX spouses. We have just over $ 3800/month total income now ( incl my XXXX. pension ), and this was all forseeable and could have been enough to work with even XXXX3 years ago, with a payment that would increase when the XXXX payments started to arrive each month. 

We could easily save our home, but BoA said they did not have a program to make adjustments, or have a balloon pmt due later, or whatever we could have done, so i worked as hard as i could to get all other debt down, and prepare to make much larger home-loan payments. - The thing is, for the previous 20 years, I had always financially prepared for any financial hit, such as happens to almost everyone at some time ; Loss of a job, or death in the family, etc.. I had an old radio/junk collection, as an inventor, just glancing at parts & pieces of it would inspire me for electrical/mechanical design, product designs, style.. Well, weeding that collection out on XXXX could always get us thru the rough spots when unforseen bills would arrive, etc.. But, when the Banks ( BoA, etal ) threatened to crash the XXXX economy if they did not get their XXXX emergency loans in XXXX XXXX, and our economy went into a tailspin anyway ... It was MY credit rating that became affected, not theirs, and the XXXX market collapsed too. I stopped under that situation and burned out. In XXXX, an application to BoA for loan mod included {$500.00} sales in XXXX weeding out of junk, so that after expenses, $ XXXX/month more was available, and from XXXX, XXXX to XXXX XXXX, I proved I could do that, while weeding out my collection of XXXX junk. I could show BoA that i could do that, but they never asked for my records, and so then, in XXXX XXXX, my mom gifted me $ XXXX for 18 months, payments to help us qualify for a loan mod. & signed a letter to that effect. BoA wanted her financials with only # XXXX & # XXXX pmts remaining. There was so much foot-dragging by BoA, but I just kept my mouth shut and hoped for enough delay that our XXXX pmts would arrive before foreclosure time, and they did, but the delays kept being. 

In all the time we have tried to deal wht BoA thru our local legal non-profit, they would accept to review the case, but would try to engage us, and did XXXX3 times ), by going around the XXXX to dealing directly with my wife & I. Everytime we sent in a new application that showed an improved financial picture, BoA sat on it until the bank statements needed updating. Delay delay, .. 

But, that dual avenue approach was not right. IT was also very stressful. My wife and i are now separated and I '' m still trying to same the home for her and our daughter. It has been a long & stressful 5 years, but now BoA is selling the complete file to XXXX Bank, and all this time, they managed to not lower our 5 % fixed loan to easily under 4 % any time in the last 3 yrs, and we will be fleeced for every last dollar while BoA takes their profits all the way to themselves.

complaint_text:
My mortgage is with PHH Mortgage, serviced by mortgagequestions.com.

I have been paying PMI since the loan originated, but last year applied to have PMI removed. I paid their fee for their appraiser to come out and appraise the current value of my home. Their appraiser stated the value at just under the value that was needed to remove PMI on the loan.

In XX/XX/2018, I had another appraisal done to try to refinance the house. The appraised value came in higher than the value needed too remove PMI last year, so, once the refinance failed ( due to a separate issue with divorce ) I contacted PHH/mortgagequestions.com to start the process to remove PMI from the stated value from the appraisal. I have contacted them several times. More than 1 week after each contact ( their autoresponder to email states I'll get a response in 24 hours ), I get a response to my request that they will send out a letter outlining requirements within 7-10 days. I've been trying for a month now and I have not gotten this letter, nor have they responded with a reason as to why they're delaying responses.

Their delay in removing PMI and their appraisal last year feels deliberate in an attempt for them to continue collecting that fee even in light of the requirements for removing its having been met.

Additionally, I have my mortgage payments set for 2 equal payments each month. The first payment is always the requested payment, the second payment of the month is always higher than requested with no explanation as to why. Additionally, my account statements never reflect the additional amount that has been taken from my checking account for payment nor what the additional amounts were used for.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( XXXX ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. complaint_text: ITEM REPORTED ON MY CREDIT FILE THAT HAS BEEN PAID IN FULL

From the onset of Roundpoint mortgage purchasing my loan there has been continued efforts on the company 's part to attempt to get me, the homeowner, to pay sooner than is required. There is a 15 day grace period on the loan. This is common practice and is stated on the mortgage statement. However, Roundpoint sends a letter each month on the XXXX or XXXX day of the month stating the mortgage is late, even though it is paid within the 15 days allowed. They also send the mortgage statement out prior to the final day to pay, which is the XXXX, and this bill suggests the mortgage is over due or late. So the bill which should state {$3400.00} instead says {$6800.00}. All these letters and statements are intentionally written to be deceptive. It also puts pressure on home owners to pay earlier than is required. This pressure is unfair to the consumers and if successful is a huge financial benefit to the company. This behavior is predatory, and unethical, if not illegal. In addition to pressuring homeowners to pay early, XXXX failed to pay the house insurance on time. This put the house at risk. I have never experienced such unethical behavior in a mortgage company. I have owned 7 houses, and currently own 3. I have never had such a problematic mortgage company. They should be investigated and sited for unfairly pressuring homeowners to pay early.

complaint_text:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, AZ XXXX SSN : XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/1989 To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute and request enforcement of my legal rights regarding inaccurate and unverified account information on my credit report. I kindly ask for your assistance in rectifying this matter and ensuring that my consumer rights are upheld. The following details outline my concerns and the violations I believe have occurred : Creditor : XXXX Account Number : XXXX I am requesting your intervention to address the following potential violations : XXXX. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) - Failure to Verify Accuracy : The account associated with XXXX and identified by account number XXXX has raised concerns as I am unable to recognize this business. As a consumer, I have the right to accurate and verifiable credit reporting under the FCRA. However, the existence and legitimacy of this account remain unclear, leading to doubts about its accuracy. 

Relevant Sections of FCRA : Section 611 : Procedure in case of disputed accuracy Section 612 : Charges for certain disclosures Section 613 : Public record information for employment purposes Section 614 : Restrictions on investigative consumer reports Creditor : XXXX Account Number : XXXX I am also disputing the accuracy of the following account : XXXX. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) - Failure to Provide Accurate Information : The account information associated with XXXX, bearing the account number XXXX, has been a source of distress and concern in my financial life. As per the FCRA 's mandate for accurate and verifiable credit reporting, I have the right to expect that the information reported about my credit history is both accurate and fair. However, the details pertaining to this account are questionable, and despite my attempts to seek clarity, the matter remains unresolved. 

Relevant Sections of FCRA : Section 611 : Procedure in case of disputed accuracy Section 612 : Charges for certain disclosures Section 613 : Public record information for employment purposes Section 614 : Restrictions on investigative consumer reports Personal Story : To convey the impact of these inaccuracies, I want to share how these issues have disrupted my financial well-being and overall quality of life : Over the years, I have worked diligently to restore my credit standing after facing financial challenges. I have conscientiously managed my financial obligations, aspiring to secure a stable future for myself and my family. The uncertainties surrounding the reported accounts, however, have injected turmoil into my efforts. 

The unrecognizable XXXX account and the questionable XXXX account have cast shadows on my attempts to secure loans and housing. These inaccuracies have led to unjust denials, preventing me from accessing opportunities that could improve my life. The emotional toll of these setbacks is substantial, affecting my confidence, self-esteem, and mental health. 

Requested Action : Given the distress and tangible consequences I have faced, I kindly request the following actions : For XXXX : A thorough investigation to verify the legitimacy of the account associated with account number XXXX. If the account can not be verified as belonging to me, I request its removal from my credit report. 

For XXXX : A clarification of the information associated with account number XXXX, or its immediate removal from my credit report due to its questionable nature. 

In conclusion, I wholeheartedly appreciate your attention to this matter. Your support in enforcing my consumer rights under the FCRA is paramount to resolving this situation and allowing me to regain control of my financial future. I kindly ask that you keep me updated on the progress of this dispute. 

Should you require further information or documentation, please feel free to contact me at [ your phone number ] or [ your email address ]. 

Thank you for your dedication to consumer rights and your invaluable assistance in achieving a positive resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

I applied for modification due to my interest-only loan becoming fully amortizing and interest rate increasing which resulted in an unaffordable payment. This complaint is due to Nationstar 's determined income being significantly beyond our available income and ability to repay. It appears their model for determining income does not support QM or ATR requirements. 
Nationstar uses a gross income average from XXXX paystubs and annualizes this income as stable qualifying income. This is without regard to the source of income. In our circumstance, their method of determination significantly overstated both my spouse 's and my incomes. Their approach negligently disregards the continuance of all income sources and is not in agreement with both QM and ATR requirements. 
For example, my income determination used overtime that was not supported with YTD earnings. It was not considered if this income was supported or expected to continue. My modification application intentionally excluded overtime as monthly income since this was not stable or expected to continue. Per the documentation provided, my most recent paystubs have bi-weekly overtime of {$1200.00} and {$1300.00}. Nationstar calculated total gross income as an average of {$4300.00}, annualized to $ XXXX = or {$9500.00} mo. Considering base income per paystub of $ XXXX {$6600.00}, Nationstar considered {$2800.00} as stable overtime income for qualification. Check ending date of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and pay ending date of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX does not support this as stable income. YTD overtime average per last paystub is {$1300.00} monthly ( {$11000.00} XXXX ). This evidences that this is potentially not a stable income source and would require additional analysis for consideration. In reality, this overtime is not stable and resulted from significant mortgage volume resulting from the lowest interest rates in history ( XXXX XXXX ). Any significant overtime is not currently or expected to be available. Overtime at this amount was not supported by the XXXX XXXX or YTD income. This is why this income was not included on the modification application. In summary total income was determined at {$120000.00} ( Annual bonus plus Nationstar determined income ) rather than base salary of {$79000.00} plus bonus of {$9300.00}, or {$89000.00}. Based on the documentation and the above analysis, this is a {$34000.00} overstatement of annual income. It should be noted, my modification request did indicate my base income at {$84000.00} due to an expected increase which is supported on my supplemental paystubs with base of {$83000.00}. Effectively this would reduce this overstatement to {$30000.00}. 
For my spouse 's income, she is a XXXX and her salary is listed on the paystub. The base salary was not considered and Nationstar used the gross income which included a {$170.00} one-time income earnings adjustment to take advantage of a paid pre-planning event. Since this is not a stable income source it should not be considered as part of stable qualifying income. Again, stability of income was disregarded by Nationstar and they determined her income to be {$43000.00} rather than her actual income of {$41000.00} as indicated on her paystub. 
Ultimately, I appealed their income determination and this was rejected. Their rejection is on the basis that the supplemental documentation provided is considered new information. None of the supplement documentation was new information. The original income documentation provided did not support the income Nationstar used to qualify and the continuance of all income sources was not addressed by Nationstar. Based upon the response by Nationstar, this appears to be a systemically negligent policy and has likely negatively impacted many people requesting modification.

My loan servicer, Wells Fargo, is transferring my mortgage to XXXX XXXX ( effective XX/XX/23 ). Wells Fargo customer service has stated that there's nothing they can do to stop the transfer. Even though that is my preferred outcome. 

This practice of transferring mortgages to a different servicer without consulting the consumer and getting permission, is not fair to the consumer. When the mortgage is transferred, it will negatively impact the consumer 's credit score due to a new account on the credit report that changes the length of credit history factor and other calculations. 

As someone actively working to increase my credit score, I am aggrieved, that my credit score will now take a negative hit for no fault of my own. 

This practice needs to change for everyone.

On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, I deposited a check at the local Huntington bank branch for {$2900.00}. I asked the bank how long it would take the check to clear and the bank advised it takes about 2-3 days for a check to clear. 
On the morning of XX/XX/XXXX ( Wednesday ), I called the local bank branch where I deposited the check to confirm that the check has cleared. The bank branch transferred me to the banks customer service and a customer service agent confirmed the check cleared and the money could be used. After this confirmation, I used the money for the intended purpose. 
On Thursday, XX/XX/XXXX, I found out that the check has returned because of insufficient funds. 
I went to the bank to understand why this happened after their customer service representative ( CSR ) confirmed that the check has cleared. They kept on saying that the check returned due to insufficient funds and they can not do anything. They also said that since the CSR told me the check cleared I should talk to them to find out what happened and resolve it through them. 
I called Huntingtons Customer Service on the morning of Friday, XX/XX/XXXX, and talked to a CSR first and then to a manager. I explained the whole situation to them and asked for an explanation and resolution of this issue. I wanted to understand why the check returned after the CSR said the check has cleared. The manager could not provide a clear explanation as to why this happened. He said that the CSR may not have the recent most information and that the information from their check clearing ( returned check ) department may not have been available to the CSR. He said that they will take this feedback to improve their system to prevent this but unfortunately can not pay me the lost money. 
I lost my money due to the wrong information provided by the CSR and now Huntington Bank is not ready to take responsibility for it.

complaint_text:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XX/XX/year> Subject : Request for Method of Verification Under FCRA Dear Sir/Madam, I recently disputed the accuracy of certain information on my credit report, and I have received your response. However, I am not satisfied with the outcome of the reinvestigation. Therefore, I am writing to request the method of verification for the following disputed item ( s ) : Disputed Item ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Reason for Dispute : Multiple inaccuracies ( payment history, credit limit, date last active, and date of last payment. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Reason for Dispute : Multiple inaccuracies ( payment history, credit limit, date last active, and date of last payment. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Reason for Dispute : Multiple inaccuracies ( payment history, credit limit, date last active, and date of last payment. 


Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ), I have the right to request " a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information. '' Additionally, FCRA Section 607 ( b ) requires that credit reporting agencies " follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information '' contained in consumer reports. 
Please provide the specific details on how the investigation was conducted, including : 1. The name, address, and telephone number of the person or entity that verified the information.

2. The method and sources used for verification. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your detailed response as required by law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Experian has failed to fulfill its legal obligation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information on my credit report, leaving inaccurate or unverifiable accounts unresolved. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has recently filed a lawsuit against Experian, alleging systemic issues such as failing to forward consumer-provided evidence to furnishers, accepting unreliable responses, and failing to adequately notify consumers of dispute outcomes. These failures align with my experience, where Experian has neither corrected nor removed disputed items despite the evidence I provided, causing ongoing harm to my credit standing. I am requesting immediate corrective action to remove or amend the disputed accounts, as Experian 's inaction violates federal law and my rights as a consumer.

secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text:
I discovered an unauthorized and inaccurate collection account on my credit report, reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and reflected on my report with TRANSUNION. The account is identified as account number XXXX. I do not recognize this account, and I believe it has been included on my credit report without proper authorization. 
I submitted a formal dispute with TRANSUNION, requesting verification and removal of the account in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 623 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), which require that only accurate and verifiable information be included on my report. Additionally, I cited Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), which mandates that all access to my credit report must have a permissible purpose. 
Despite my dispute, TRANSUNION responded by marking the account as " verified '' or " updated '' without providing any documentation or evidence supporting the accounts validity. I believe this is a violation of my rights under the FCRA, as credit bureaus are required to conduct a reasonable and thorough investigation, and failure to do so can result in liability, as upheld by case law like XXXX XXXX Trans Union XXXX. 
Additionally, the actions of TRANSUNION and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX constitute a violation of the Unfair, Deceptive, or Abusive Acts or Practices ( UDAAP ) standards. By retaining unverifiable information on my report, they are potentially engaging in deceptive or unfair practices. This inaccurate information has negatively impacted my credit score, affecting my financial standing and access to credit.
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 U.S.C.169g, I dispute the validity of the debt they purport I owe. I request that these companies Provide verification of the following : 1. ) The original Application or contract ; 2. ) Any and all statements allegedly related to this debt ; 3. ) Any and all signed receipts ; 4. ) Any and all canceled checks ; 5. ) Original date of default and collection activity begin 6. ). Whether you purchased the debt, and if so, the amount paid for the debt 7. ) The date ( s ) the debt allegedly accrued ; 8. ) An itemization of the costs, including an accounting, for any additional interest, charges, or other fees placed on this account. I want to request that these companies Cease and Desist all further communications and collection actives and provide the verification of the purported debt.

To whom it may concern, this complaint is in reference to a Fraudulent check withdrawal from my CHASE account on XX/XX/22 in the amount of {$950.00}. The fraudulent check was addressed to XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  and was cashed by a person unknown to me who forged my signature on the aforementioned check. Upon making this discovery I contacted CHASE via XXXX and was advised to report to my branch which is located on XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in Florida. Shortly thereafter, I arrived at the bank when I made contact with a bank employee whose name I can not recall assisted me in cancelling my old checking and savings accounts for new ones. Prior this incident a fraudulent check was deposited into my account on XX/XX/22 for the amount of {$930.00} with my forged signature. The check was from a company called XXXX XXXX of XXXX XXXX. Upon making that discovery I responded to my branch when I made contact with an employee name XXXX who assisted me with cancelling my accounts for new ones. I stated to XXXX that only two agencies deposit checks into my account and they are my employer XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and the Internal Revenue Service and no one is authorized to withdraw. In exercising due diligence a security pin was set up to deter future fraud attempts going forward. After the second incident I asked the bank employee how could {$950.00} be withdrawn from my account if a security pin was set up and I was advise that the security pin was removed but no one can give an answer as to why. It should be known that the security pin was removed without my knowledge or consent. 
I was told by the bank employee an investigation would be conducted and my {$950.00} will be credited after 90 days. On XX/XX/22 I made contact with CHASE Fraud Dept via the aforementioned number when I was told my funds shouldve been credited to my account a long time ago and if in 5 business days my funds were not credited to call back. On XX/XX/22 I made the call but on this occasion I was communicating with CHASE Fraud Dept Located overseas. The Overseas Fraud Dept Personnel stated that Based on their investigation my ID was used together with my signature and I did not report my ID was stolen and the case was closed. I told the investigator I never lossed my ID so there was no report to be made in addition which bank location the Fraudulent Check was cashed he refused to give me that information. In conclusion CHASE does not have any Clear and Convincing Evidence that Im responsible for this fraud but theyve made that decision anyway. Im hoping that your agency can look into this matter to hold CHASE responsible for their error in protecting my accounts. Thanking you for your attention in this matter. 
Yours Sincerely.

The first one is with an alarm company that my husband included in his bankruptcy. So now the put it on my credit as a delinquent account. The other one is with a mortgage company, I paid the account in full XX/XX/XXXX and is till open in my credit report.

To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally request reconsideration of the denial of my fraud claim regarding {$5000.00} that was coerced from me on XX/XX/year> under severe duress through a sophisticated phone scam. 

I received a call from a number that appeared on my caller ID as the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The men on the line identified themselves as law enforcement officers and claimed that I was under investigation and would be arrested immediately unless I complied with their instructions. They had highly detailed personal information about me and my children, which made their threats even more credible and terrifying. 

Despite my initial doubts, the level of detail they knew about my life, combined with the call appearing to come from a legitimate law enforcement agency, caused me significant distress. I am also a past victim of armed robbery, and this call triggered intense emotional fear and panic. These feelings were exacerbated by the fact that I am pregnant and that the callers had detailed information about my children. I feared for my safety and the safety of my children. Under this emotional duress, I followed their instructions and went to XXXX to send multiple transactions totaling {$5000.00} using my Capital One card. 

After the panic subsided and I was able to safely process what had happened, I contacted the actual sheriffs office and confirmed this was a scam. I also immediately contacted Capital One to report the incident. Unfortunately, my initial fraud claim was denied. 

I respectfully ask that you reconsider my claim based on the following : This was not a voluntary transaction. It was made under extreme emotional duress caused by a credible and targeted impersonation scam, which exploited personal trauma and used sophisticated spoofing techniques to impersonate law enforcement. 

The perpetrators used caller ID spoofing to make it appear that the call was coming from a legitimate government agency, which is a known tactic used by scammers and has been acknowledged by the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) as increasingly common and dangerous. 

I am a trauma survivor of a prior armed robbery. This event triggered a heightened state of fear, panic, and compliance that led to my coerced actions. I would not have sent this money had I not truly believed that I or my family was in immediate danger. 

This was reported as a scam immediately after I was safe and able to fully understand what had happened. I have since submitted a report to [ insert police department or relevant agency if applicable ], and I am willing to provide any necessary documentation to support this claim.

I understand that chargebacks typically cover unauthorized or fraudulent transactions, and I respectfully assert that this situation qualifies. The transactions may have been entered physically, but they were not made of my own free willthey were the result of a criminal threat and psychological coercion.

The scam I experienced is consistent with a type of fraud identified by the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) as an imposter scam, specifically involving law enforcement impersonation and caller ID spoofing.

Key characteristics of this fraud included : Spoofed caller ID : The incoming call falsely displayed as the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, increasing the perceived credibility. 

Use of threats and fear : I was told I would be arrested immediately if I did not comply. They referred to specific personal details about my family, heightening the urgency and emotional distress. 

Coercion to make payments : I was instructed to physically go to XXXX and make transactions under surveillance, mimicking cooperating with authorities.

Exploitation of past trauma : As a past victim of violent crime, I was especially vulnerable to this type of psychological manipulation.

According to the FTC, these scams are sophisticated, highly manipulative, and leave victims feeling overwhelmed and confusedoften only realizing what has happened after the immediate fear subsides.

I would be grateful if Capital One could further investigate this matter with a lens of compassion and understanding for victims of targeted fraud and trauma. I have been a responsible customer and am asking only for protection under circumstances no person should be subjected to. 

I have also attached a letter from my therapist, XXXX XXXX XXXX. Please let me know if additional documentation is needed to support this request. I appreciate your time and attention to this matter and hope for a fair resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX

This refusal to act on clear evidence of fraud constitutes willful misreporting and has inflicted measurable harm on my credit profile. Supporting case law : XXXX ( XXXX ). Prohibition on Outdated Adverse XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) Penalty : $ XXXX. Each account shows conflicting or reaged delinquency dates that extend adverse reporting beyond the sevenyear limit. Supporting case law : Millerv.WellsFargo & Co.,2018WL1578440 ( N.D.Cal.Mar.302018 ). XXXX principle : XXXX and XXXX. Statutory penalty calculation : $ XXXX $ XXXX. c. Failure to Investigate Disputed Information15U.S.C.1681i Penalty : $ XXXXperviolation. No goodfaith investigation followed my dispute for any of these accounts. Supporting case law : Cortezv.TransUnion, LLC,617F.3d688 ( 3dCir.2010 ). XXXX mandate : XXXX ( right to defend ones good name ). Statutory penalty calculation : $ XXXX $ XXXX. d. Knowingly Reporting False XXXX ( a ) Penalty : $ XXXX. All XXXX accounts continue to be reported after receipt of incontrovertible evidence of fraud. Total FCRA penalty exposure for the XXXX accounts : {$66000.00}. Additional Violations under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Misrepresentation of the fraudulent obligations listed above violates TILAs transparency mandates. XXXX insistence on truth and restitution ( XXXX, XXXX ) reinforces these statutory requirements. Final Demand In light of the above federal statutes, enforceable penalties, binding case law, and XXXX doctrines of justice and restitution, I demand the immediate and permanent deletion of all XXXX fraudulent accounts from every consumerreporting database. Noncompliance will result in formal complaints to the FTC, CFPB, OCC, and the Michigan Attorney General, as well as civil litigation seeking monetary damages. Total statutory penalty exposure to date : {$190000.00}. I expect written confirmation of deletion within XXXX of your receipt of this notice.

complaint_text: I filed a complaint with the reporting agencies stating that the Public Record Information was inaccurate. It is my understanding according to Public Record law and dictionary definition that the term " Dismissed '' means that it is adjudicated by the law. My case concerned no form of solvency, nothing was placed under conservancy, examinership, liquidation or provisional debt reconstruction. There were no exemptions, no surrender of any kind as stated within the regulations of the BAPCPA " Means Test ''. The credit bureaus have retrieve my information from a third party entity without my authorization, therefore holding my identity and credit under " Consumer Lock '' for 10 years. I approached the Bankruptcy court where the case was initiated and the Bankruptcy Court has confirmed that they did not verify by documentation. Although I received proof that the reporting agencies did NOT " verify '' from the origin, the credit agencies have stated I can no longer challenge this negative entry which is against FCRA law. This discrepancy has prevented me in my personal life 's pursuit. Please advocate for me in this challenge.

They are now unwilling to postpone the sale stating there is not enough time, there would be enough time if they would postpone the sale and allowing me to send another pay stub from my next paycheck and keep the review open.

complaint_text:
We currently are facing a forclosure on our home due to lack of communication. We applied for mortgage assistance and were approved paid the XX/XX/year> in full. XX/XX/XXXX payment ran through bank but did not clear due to a glitch in our new account. Was told to wait and have them rerun payment they never did. Tried reaching out with no help. Then 3rd payment XX/XX/year> was not even attempted. We found out through my mother in law on XX/XX/XXXX that our house was in forclosure and due to sell XX/XX/year>. We have never received a notice from mortgage company or any attorneys regarding this. I called and spoke with customer service who told me it was due to sale, I asked why my assistance had been cleared from account and he told me that we did not give them 37 days which we didn't even know about this so their system not even a human denied it. He was going to reach out and see what someone in company could do. He also told me when asked why no one from Selene ever called me that they did several time. I confirmed the phone number when to my cell provider and looked for this number all the way to may and they never called. He then said they called my work number no one ever did because we are a small 3 person doctor office and ate open from XXXX Monday through Friday and we have never received a call or voice mail. I also never received a voice mail on my number from them. I called several times asking to speak with my case manager on loan XXXX XXXX and no one will let me talk to her or have her call me. They tell me they can't let me through to her. If that is the case why is she all over my portal as the person to call. I GA you are suppose to receive a 30 day notice about foreclosure as of today XXXX we still have not received anything. Customer service also told me they would mail me the system denial on assistance still have not received. I was also told between 3-5 days i would get a statement of payoff to catch up still nothing from them. They have a legal right to give me 30 days and since they didn't I'm suppose to say ok but since I didn't give them 37 days for assistance they just deny me with out any thing. How can I save my house and work with this company when you never can speak to the people that matter? We have had no communication whats so ever since they got our mortgage no calls letters nothing.

All we want to do is keep our home and catch up. I'm still waiting with the glitch XXXX payment and non run XXXX payment for them to take.

complaint_text: I had sent a request to all XXXX credit bureaus to remove the tax liens currently on my credit report because they do not meet the criteria to be posted on my credit reports since the reporting agencies updated their policies regarding The minimum information needed for a tax lien to be included on a credit report on XXXX XXXX 2017. Trans-Union and XXXX  both came back that the information on the tax liens was " updated '' and still remained on my credit report while XXXX found that there was not sufficient enough information for the Liens to remain on my credit and it was removed. If XXXX found that there was not enough information from The courts where the Liens were filed, then there is no reason why transunion and XXXX seem to think there is enough information given the information comes directly from the same court No matter which agency was To look at the information. Instead the third party who reported the Lien to XXXX and Trans-union just updated the information I provided to prove their was n't enough information in their own system and sent it back saying the data was " updated '' this is illegal and the information needs to be checked against the court record from the court system only.

complaint_text: Dear Director XXXX, Re : Denial of due process I am a XXXX XXXX homeowner for 18 years who was penalized by M & T Bank in denial letter dated XXXX XXXX, XXXX of a workout agreement. On XXXX XXXX, XXXX I lost my job and was having difficulty making the payments to the trustee for my bankruptcy. I was later dismissed and defaulted, so I filed for a workout agreement afforded to me based on my FHA loan program. I worked with XXXX and the representative did not make it clear that my debt to ratio would be a problem - so I was denied on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. XXXX, XXXX and XXXX had filed in XXXX and were waiting to pounce on my house to sell it. So, I kept close communication with M & T representatives and they informed me that I could send in my information for my son who agreed to move back home from California and contribute to the household income. I started working in mid XXXX and was told that it would be part time ( 7 hours daily ) but my hours would increase to 140 hours and I would be paid monthly. I provided that information and my son 's 3 months of Profit and Loss which clearly was more than enough. I was notified that the attorneys had scheduled my house for sale on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX but if I turned in my package and it was a complete one, they would remove it from the auction list as it would be in the underwriters department for review. On Wednesday, XXXX XXXX, XXXX I submitted a letter of employment verification and was told that the person hiring me needed to have a letterhead. ( The person who offered me a personal assistant is the XXXX XXXX for the XXXX. ) I tried to explain that I was not working directly for the XXXX - so after M & T representative insisted that iw would not be adequate, so I was forced to accept another position with a placement organization for less money ; and a letter was sent in to the M & T office on Thursday morning, XXXX XXXX, XXXX stating I would be starting employment on Monday, XXXX XXXX, XXXX. I went to the HR office to complete my paperwork and returned late that evening to find several missed calls from a XXXX number I did not recognize. There was no name of the caller either. The next morning at approximately XXXX the same call came through and when I answered it XXXX XXXX introduced himself as a rep of M & T bank and he immediately after verifying who I was, proceeded to inform me that I had submitted information of a job that I had started in XXXX and they denied me in XXXX and now I was starting another job on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. I told him I was looking for the best opportunity with pay that was significantly hire and when hey would not accept the other job I accepted another He became combative and rude and yelled -that I did not have a consistent job for the last 12 months, I corrected him and said I lost my job in XXXX XXXX and I had worked there since XXXX XXXX. His tone was abrasive throughout and when I asked him if he would deny me due process - he said yes. I told him that I would have my attorney contact him to clarify what he just told me. He then yelled who is your attorney? I said XXXX XXXX, he snapped she is NOT your atty she is with the XXXX office- I said she is advocating for me. He was furious and said " your house is not coming of the sale list '' and hung up. I typed up a motion to stay and hurried to the circuit court for an emergency hearing. Next morning at XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX M & T rep called to say that they had received a complete workout package and it had been uploaded the night before and sent to Underwriters. I asked about the timing sensitivity and whether I would be off the sale list now- he said it was not automatic, but they would have it pretty early on Tuesday XXXX before the scheduled sale @ XXXX. On Tuesday am I called to confirm that my package was still in underwriting. I then witnessed the sale proceed at XXXX
