complaint_text:
I have been a member of PenFed since XXXX. In XXXX, I began receiving a number of calls from an unknown number advising me that there may be fraud on my account. I would contact PenFed because there was no identifying information on the phone ( possible spoofing ) and they would transfer me to the Fraud company. In XXXX, the calls became more frequent and culminated this week with NO access to my funds on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX ( or the XXXX ), I complained to PenFed telephonically and via email that routine transactions ( ATM withdrawals ) are being denied and I am fielding more and more calls from the " fraud unit ''. PenFed and I together called the fraud department and I inquired about the frequency of the calls and could they annotate the account to indicate certain activity was permissible. The fraud employee stated " no '' and towards the end of the call, she became very snarky which I complained of the fact that they could not annotate " safe transactions ''. 

I continued to call PenFed about these numerous " security holds '' on my account on XX/XX/XXXX was assured that notes were placed on my file. I was blocked from escalating the matter by XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX as he informed me that I have to adhere " the to policies set forth when I opened the account ''. I replied the only " policy '' I'm aware of are certain limitations. He refused to escalate my call. I emailed the chairman of PenFed and filed a complaint with XXXX. 

I am requesting appropriate action and response to the following concerns : 1. What authority does the 3rd party vendor have to continually place 'holds '' on access to my funds? 
2. The 3rd party vendor is very happy to review the details of your account. What data is being provided to them? 
3. What level of security is in place to protect me and my PII from the 3rd party vendor? The vendor knows where I work and all my PII. I don't trust the actions of the 3rd party vendor. 
4. Why has my card access denied and why?

5. Who determined I am a potential risk for fraud?

6. Why is my account constantly being flagged?

7. Who is in charge of the 3rd party vendor? It appears they have more clout than PenFed.

8. Why are my transactions being mounted by the 3rd party vendor?

9. What policies are in place to ensure the 3rd party vendor does not overstep their authority?

10. Does the 3rd party vendor share our personal data? 
11. Is this increased scrutiny resulting from the complaint reprisal for complaining about their staffers remark on XX/XX/XXXX. 

10. How do I restrict the data that is being provided to

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of TILA US Code 1666B since I was never late. " I recently reviewed my consumer report and noticed an incorrect late payment record. I have always maintained timely payments on this account. Under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), creditors are required to accurately report consumer transactions and provide a mechanism for correcting errors in a timely manner. Please conduct an investigation into this matter, and if you can not provide documentary evidence of these supposed late payments, I demand these payments to be updated to on time as they should be as I was NEVER late. I expect these updates to be made promptly, in compliance with the law.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
In XXXX XXXX our monthly mortgage payment was made by phone to the customer service department of HSBC. We were told that due to our account being in good standing we were eligible for refinancing. We were referred to the refinancing department and spoke to a refinancing personnel of HBSC by the name of XXXX, who completed with us the initial application for refinancing. We were then assigned to another of HBSC employee by the name of XXXX XXXX who took over the application process and told us that closing date would be sometime in XXXX XXXX, and that we should not make the XXXX XXXX XXXX mortgage payments as they were being included in the refinancing. He also told us that our first mortgage payment would be for XXXX XXXX. 
We received a call around XXXX from HSBC employee XXXX XXXX XXXX informing us that the closing date had to be changed to the first or second week of XXXX XXXX. Our insurance agent also received a call from HSBC employee XXXX XXXX XXXX, making request re paper work, pertaining to the refinancing of our home. HSBC through XXXX XXXX XXXX contacted us again by XXXX XXXX informing us of a final closing date of XXXX XXXX, XXXX. After that no further communication was received from HSBC. 
Numerous calls were made by us and messages left on XXXX XXXX 's HSBC extension voice mail and direct line ( XXXX ) XXXX - XXXX at HSBC. Our insurance agent also made several attempts to follow up with XXXX XXXX XXXX of HSBC refinancing department but to no avail. At this point we desperately tried to obtain information re our pending refinance closing and was able to obtained information through HSBC customer service that the mortgage payoff was given to XXXX XXXX in the refinancing department and that they were awaiting the closing. 
While waiting for the closing to our dismay, we received an intent to accelerate letter from HSBC dated XXXX/XXXX/XXXX which added stress to an already stressful situation. We at this point sacrificially made the XXXX Mortgage payment, believing that, HSBC would resolve the matter, which they did not. Verbal and written complaint was made to HSBC emphasizing that our financial hardship was brought on by the breach of contract by HSBC. 
It is hereby unbelievable that even in the light of the overwhelming evidence of breach of contract and fraudulent activities by HSBC, including but not limited to forgery, HSBC did not do the right thing of resolving the matter by completing the refinancing process. This, they themselves initiated which if done would not result in us being in foreclosure. 
We hereby seek your help in investigating this urgent matter. 
Contact number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX email : XXXXXXXXXXXX Yours Truly, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

There are collection accounts on my report that I believe contain inaccurate information. Under my rights pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) and 15 USC 1681i, I am entitled to an accurate credit report. I request a review of these entries, and if they can not be verified as accurate, I ask that they be removed.

ATTN : Risk Management Officer This is a DEMAND TO COMPLY LETTER with written instruction related to I the consumer Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ). Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act has been established by Congress, your agency 's role to me the principal, A consumer, is to adopt reasonable procedures to uphold the need to ensure that your grave responsibilities fairness, impartiality, and respect for my right to privacy must be maintained for maximum accuracy. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e et seq, you may not procure or furnish a consumer report without following 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) as my written instructions. There has been a violation of these reasonable procedures because as I showed within my attachments there has been inaccurate and unverifiable information removed from another consumer reporting agency and has not been removed from your system. You should be aware your failure to maintain your reasonable procedures for maximum accuracy has resulted in a conspiracy that deprived me of my right under the Truth in Lending Act subsection 1602 ( f ) to extend new credit for me. This deprivation of my rights is a federal criminal violation under 18 U.S. Code 241. I am well aware that the reasonable procedures requiring each consumer reporting agency to compile and maintain consumer files nationwide shall establish and maintain a notification system jointly with other such consumer reporting agencies under 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( e ) ( 6 ).

Understand this is NOT a dispute letter as there is nothing to dispute. I am DEMANDING you, the agent, follow your fiduciary responsibility to me and REMOVE/DELETE the following information from my consumer file. This has been an egregious failure to follow your very own reasonable procedures required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

In the zip file attachment included with this letter, you will see my identifying information as well as my consumer report from XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax which shows these inaccurate and unverifiable information. 
However, these accounts are reported to the reporting agencies. This should not exist. To maintain the maximum possible accuracy, you must have joint systems to notify each other of this incorrect information as consumer reporting agencies. This violation and failure to maintain reasonable procedures for maximum accuracy are false and misleading reporting. This information is also inaccurate and falsely reports XXXX XXXX fields that do not match XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax. I demand these accounts be removed from the consumer report by your consumer reporting agency for the federal law violation of failure to maintain your reasonable procedures for maximum possible accuracy and violation for failing to promptly delete the items of information as required for treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information according to 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) ( A ).

REMOVE/DELETE the following accounts. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  REMOVE these accounts UNDER PENALTY OF PERJURY, DELETE these accounts for violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681e, Failure to maintain reasonable procedures, 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( e ) ( 6 ), FDCPA Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1692e False and Misleading reporting, Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) ( A ). Deprivation of Rights 18 U.S. Code 241.

I am demanding my remedy for your willful noncompliance with each violation of the law.

? Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681e- {$1000.00}? Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( e ) ( 6 ) - {$1000.00}? Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1692e- {$1000.00}? Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) ( A ) - {$1000.00} Total Amount Due : {$4000.00} I am well aware you have no legal standing in court and numerous cases of case law illustrate that the consumer reporting agencys failure to maintain reasonable procedures is grounds for a suit and judgment in favor of the plaintiff. complaint_text:
On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a formal dispute to Equifax regarding inaccurate and fraudulent items on my credit report. These inaccuracies are negatively impacting my credit profile. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA Sec XXXX ), Equifax is required to respond to such disputes within 30 days ; however, as of today, no response has been received. Below are the details of the disputed items : Correction of 30-Day Late Payment on XXXX XXXX  Account Account : XXXX XXXX  - Account Number : XXXX Issue : A one-time 30-day late payment was inaccurately reported on my account. I have not missed any payments, not to mention one can clearly see XXXX and XXXX reported that there was a 30 day late in XXXX where as Equifax reported the same in XXXX, none of the reporting was correct and needs to be updated according to the supporting documentation, including a copy of my payment statement for the month in question, was provided with the dispute to demonstrate that the late payment mark is erroneous. 

Dispute and Removal of XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX XXXX  ) Account : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) - Account Number : XXXX Issue : This account was fraudulently opened in my name. Supporting evidence, including documentation proving the account was unauthorized and fraudulently created, was also included in the original dispute. 

Despite providing all necessary supporting documentation, Equifax has failed to respond within the 30-day timeframe stipulated under the FCRA. This lack of response represents a violation of FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ), which mandates a timely and complete investigation of consumer disputes.

complaint_text:
I have requested the following items from Midland Credit XXXX times in the past 9 months and all I have received is the billing statements which is not what I requested. 
XXXX. The XXXX XXXX that Midland Credit has with the alleged original creditors. 
XXXX. The full contract agreement I allegedly signed with my full wet verifiable physical signature from said original creditors. 
XXXX. Documentation demonstrating how Midland Credit acquired the debts, how much it was purchased for in a dollar amount by Midland Credit, and how they accessed my personal information including emailing me with the threat of a lawsuit on XXXX when I never received any physical letters before that stating the alleged debt was in collections with my name on it. 
XXXX. The agreement and contract with Midland Credit with my full wet verifiable physical signature stating that I owed a debt to their company and allegedly agreed to pay it. 
XXXX. The business license for Midland Credit to collect on alleged debts in the state of Texas. 
XXXX. Copy of the chain of custody to collect the alleged debt from original creditors to Midland Credit. 
None of these things were sent and they continued repeatedly to have me threatened with a lawsuit and went as far as to have process servers call me to find out where I was to have me served with a lawsuit when it clearly states that all debt collecting actions must cease when a dispute is taking place. I have screenshots and photos of them calling me at my job and on my cell phone when I told them to only contact me through the mail. They clearly can not verify any of these alleged debts and I am requesting the alleged debts, along with my personal information, be removed from their systems, erased from my credit report and they pay me a settlement for harassment. 
Their responses to the disputes are dated the day received but are not sent out in the mail until the XXXX dispute deadline is nearly up which gave me only XXXX to XXXX days to respond and that is underhanded tactics by a predatory company. I have all of the certified mail receipts and copies of the disputes I have sent over the past 9 months along with the responses from Midland Credit with the dates they put on the response along with the dates I received them. 
All of these alleged debts have been reported as closed and charged-off accounts and according to XXXX 15 USC 1681B of the FDCPA they are not to be put on my credit reports and this company has failed repeatedly to validate the alleged debts as well. I read them all through the CFPB Database of Agreements and not one of the credit agreements states anything about the alleged debts being sold to a third party to be collected in my name and making me responsible for them. Midland Credit pays XXXX cents on the dollar for these debts as well and demands consumers pay the full amount that was already charged off by the original creditors and reported on their taxes for tax breaks. 
I appreciate your help in this matter. Thank You.

complaint_text:
Back in XX/XX/2017 i opened a bank account online with TD bank. On XX/XX/2017 i went into the XXXX XXXX branch to deposit XXXX. The clerk at the bank advised me to sit and speak to another bank associate so that i could get an ATM card given to me. The bank associate asked me to write down my date of birth and social and to give her my id so i did. She then went to the back to make copies and came back a short time later. She went back a second time and then returned with my ATM card. 
On XX/XX/17 i deposited another XXXX into the account. 
on XX/XX/17 two person 2 person fraudulent transactions were made from my account. on XX/XX/17 two additional fraudulent transaction were made again and on XX/XX/17 an additional 2 fraudulent transactions were made. in 3 days a total of {$9300.00} were stolen from my account. i filed a claim and it was denied i was advised to resubmit a claim with a police report and i did. i was contacted by a detective from TD bank ( i have the voice message he left ) statin that the claim was denied because " he thinks '' the transactions were made from my IP address but that he's no sure exactly while it was denied. i have tried getting in touch with him with no success. i have left countless messages for him, have gone into the branch and have just been told that there is nothing i can do. i have never been given any proof or official reasoning as to why my claims were denied. i have called to speak to his supervisor and was told his supervisor was unavailable but will be notified via email as to what was going on. i still have not heard from anyone at TD and have been left without anyway to get my money back. TD has been so irresponsible in not tending to this issue and contacting me or reaching out to me. i have that one message from XXXX and have never heard from anyone else or received any papers or notices regarding this issue.

You previously filed this dispute. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, we will only process another dispute if you add a comment or attach documents with new, relevant info.

Additional comments ( required ) cant provied original purchas 15usc168i 15usc1681 ( b ) 15usc1681 ( c ) 66/210 Dont share any personal information, like your SSN, account number, etc.

I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX for their continued attempts to collect a debt that was included in my bankruptcy filing and for their inaccurate reporting of this debt to the credit bureaus. complaint_text: On or around Thursday, XX/XX/year>, I logged into my Credit Karma ( XXXX ) account. I noticed that there was old contact information on the account. This was information that I have changed before, but somehow the old information was added back to my account. I changed the email address and mailing address associated with the account. A few days later, I noticed that I received an email stating that my account had was frozen and that I needed to provide a copy of my drivers license ( front & back ) as well as a photo of me holding the license under my chin. I did this and still received no response from the company. Finally, after waiting a couple days, I attempted to reach out to CK to check the status of my documents. I was on hold for nearly XXXX hours. I even tried chatting with them, but no one ever answered the chat. Finally, I was able to get someone on the phone. I had to provide the same information ( my drivers license and a selfie ). I tried this twice and was told that they were not able to authenticate me ( for reasons that they could not disclose ). Meanwhile, my account is still frozen with no explanation. I can only guess that it is because I changed my email address and mailing address ( something that I have done before, but CK still keeps reverting back to my old information ). Also, I authenticated the email address when I changed it. So there was no reason to freeze my account. It would be logical to freeze the account if there were suspicious transactions on the account. But I only changed the contact information. I have provided all the necessary documents and they still are not helping me. I do not know what to do at this point. It seems as though my money has been taken ( which really is not that much ) for no apparent reason.

Reporting duplicate accounts on my credit with XXXX  which is a violation and I didn't receive any information about this bill which I am not claiming because I don't know what it is which is also a FDCPA violation.
Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified inaccurate accounts that need reporting and correction through your company.

I recently discovered a medical collection account on my credit report from a collection agency representing XXXX XXXX XXXX. This was the first time I became aware of this alleged debt. I was never notified in writing, by phone, or by email about any outstanding balance from XXXX. 

Before my scheduled XXXX in XX/XX/year>, XXXX required me to pay in full and in advance for all hospital and surgical services. I was specifically told that the payment covered the surgery, hospital stay, doctors, anesthesia, newborn care, and all related services, as long as there were no complications. I paid in full with my debit card, and after delivery, XXXX even refunded part of my payment, stating that I had overpaid.

Since then, I never received any bills or notices from XXXX. I even visited the emergency room in XX/XX/year>, paid the required fees, and was not informed of any outstanding balance. 

Last week, I received a credit alert about a new collection account. When I contacted the collection agency, they confirmed it was from XXXX XXXX  XXXX but could not explain the nature of the charges. When I called XXXX today, they said the debt was related to my XXXX  but that they had the wrong contact information on file. This is incorrect, as my email is correctly listed in my XXXX  patient portal, where all my balances appear as {$0.00}. 

I have now requested an itemized statement from XXXX to understand the alleged charges. However, I find it unfair and damaging that this account was sent to collections without any prior notice, explanation, or opportunity to pay or dispute the charges. I was never informed of my rights to dispute the debt or request validation, as required under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

I am requesting that this account be investigated, corrected, and removed from my credit report, as I was never notified or billed for this debt before it was reported.

I kindly request that a thorough investigation be conducted into each of the disputed accounts, and that the necessary steps be taken to update and correct my credit report without further delay. Restoring the accuracy of my credit file is imperative, and I hope your team will give this matter the attention it deserves. 

Your prompt cooperation in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated. I trust that, with your help, I can restore the integrity of my credit report and regain control over my financial stability. 

Thank you for your understanding and swift action in addressing this matter.

complaint_text:
XXXX XXXX has denied my request to remove the 30 day late payment for my vehicle payment that was due on XX/XX/XXXX. I was shopping for a vehicle, throughout the month of XXXX and hand to wait until labor day to get the deal I was shopping for. My vehicle was traded in on XX/XX/XXXX. When we called to get my payoff on XX/XX/XXXX ( I believe was the date ), we let the person on the phone know that the vehicle was being traded in. I asked about the payment and was told that as long as it was traded by XXXX I would not be turned into the credit bureaus as 30 days late. Additionally, I have never been late with XXXX XXXX and have worked very hard to build my credit up after having to file bankruptcy in XXXX due to a divorce. The late reporting has drastically lowered my credit score and has hindered the process of starting a business, which I was in the middle of!

As a one time exception, I asked to have this removed at least as " Good Will ''. Being a mortgage broker, I have seen that happen more times than I can count. The account with XXXX XXXX is PAID IN FULL and over the 2 years that I owned the vehicle I paid over XXXX XXXX Dollars in interest and because of that, I was upside down in my vehicle by over XXXX dollars! Is asking for a one time deletion really too much?

complaint_text: On XXXX XXXX I received via mail that my loan from Dovenmuehle was being transferred to XXXXXXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX. My next payment is due on XX/XX/XXXX and I was to send my New payment to : Attn : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Tx XXXX. At the end of the letter there is a bogus date of XX/XX/XXXX, so somehow it took 14 calendar days to reach me in the mail. I was instructed to send my payment due on XX/XX/XXXX to my new processor and there is no instruction on who I should make the payment out to. The address doesn't even have a company name associated with the address. I logged into my Dovenmuehle online account and there is no notice in there letting me know my loan has been transferred. Also the new loan provider XXXXXXXX XXXX  has sent me zero information about where to send my payments. I made a payment to my old service provider Dovenmuehle on XX/XX/XXXX so I can avoid any late fees with the new provider. Even if I were to send a check in the mail the day I got this notice I doubt it would make it to the new loan servicer by the due date of XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX. I'm sure there is a grace period with loan transfers, but this is ridiculous that I have to jump through a bunch of hoops to figure out where I make my new payments. Tried signing up on the XXXXXXXX XXXX for online services and it says my account isn't eligible. So I get a notice that my loan has been transferred, but I was not provided who I make a new payment out to and all I'm given is to send it to Cash Processing ... ... XXXX? At first I would think scam but my current loan servicer shows my automatic payments are shut off so I going to assume the transfer is in progress. Only thing I can figure is my current loan ( XXXX ) servicer does this every year right before Taxes are due to the county you're in so they can hold onto your escrow funds for as long as they can to earn interest on those funds before sending them to the new loan servicer. My loan was sold to Dovenmuehle in XXXX XXXX and they sold it again in XX/XX/XXXX ... .why do I have to go through all this effort just to pay my mortgage????

complaint_text: Opened an account at Chase Bank using certified cashier 's check from my former credit union. They opened the account. They deposited the checks. A day later, they called me to tell me that the account was suddenly and unexpectedly closed because they 'felt ' that a check " looked '' like it was altered, when in fact it is not. The said that they needed me to contact them regarding fraud. I called that same day and explained that the checks were from a local credit union. The local credit union was able to verify to Chase 's " Fraud Department '' via their XXXX phone number. The phone people told me that the issue has been resolved and that I can go back to the branch to obtain my funds. This was not the case. I then spent the next XXXX days going back and forth between my old credit union and Chase bank trying to clear this up. They have allegedly determined that the deposited cashier 's checks WERE NOT ALTERED. When I tried to call back today, they said that they could not release the funds and the account was still closed. They then stated that they needed the checks to clear before I could access them. Chase Bank created a situation that could have been cleared up with XXXX simple phone call. Chase has already told me that the funds are already cleared but refused to release the funds to me.

My mortgage has gone into foreclosure due to a separation/divorce. At the time my husband left I was only working part time and could not afford the payments. I have since obtained full time employment. He has walked away from the loan. He has no contact with the bank and does n't care if the house forecloses. I have tried everything I can to work something out with Bank of America. I call them weekly, applied for a modification, and even saved the past due amount to reinstate the loan. To my dismay, they pushed forward with a foreclosure and filed judgement against me in local court. The are requesting additional information from my husband, which he would not provide because he does not want the loan anymore. I offered to pay the bank to reinstate the loan. They sent me reinstatement figures. There were XXXX of dollars in fees attached in addition to the past due amount of the loan. I asked for a detailed listing of the fees. They would not provide them to me. I was told by my Bank of America Customer Relations Manager to contact the attorney handling the foreclosure to obtain a breakdown of their fees. When I contacted the attorney, XXXX XXXX XXXX of XXXX of XXXX, PA, The amount to reinstate was completely different and a lot less than the bank was telling me. The woman at the attorney office told me I could send payment to them directly and the loan would be reinstated. I contacted the bank again, they denied this was an option. The told me to forward payment to them. I asked the amount needed to reinstate. I was given another estimate. Completely different again. It had gone down from the first quote, but was still higher than the attorney. They told me this was due to " estimated '' charges. I asked for a breakdown of these charges. They can not provide that to me. They told me to pay the amount by XXXX XXXX or they are filing for a Sheriff Sale date in my county. I have told them again and again I do not have the {$13000.00} or the {$11000.00} needed to reinstate that they want. I can pay the past due amount, the {$9700.00} for my back payments and have asked to make other arrangements to pay back the " fees ''. They refuse to accept the payment. They want the full amount they keep telling me. I asked why foreclosure went through when I was trying to get a modification. They could not answer me. Bank of America was requesting additional documents they told me. Every time I call I get a different person with a different answer. Bank of America is telling me it 's the lender, FHA, that 's requiring the full amount to reinstate, yet the amount changes every time I call. It 's like they want to foreclose on the loan and are not willing to help me save it.

MY SON HAD RENTED A PROPERTY AND HE GOT A FINAL ACCOUNT STATEMENT EMAILED TO MY HUSBAND OF {$830.00} WHICH HE DISPUTED AND THAN THEY REPORTED TO THE CREDIT REPORTING AGENCIES A BALANCE OF {$2400.00} THEY CLAIM THAT BECAUSE A 60 DAYS NOTICE WAS NOT GIVEN. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX IL XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Re : Account Number XXXX Metro 2 Verification/Dispute Request * * Dear Credit Reporting Department , I am writing to dispute the reporting of the above-referenced account on my credit report in accordance with the Metro 2 reporting standards and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I request a full investigation and method of verification for the accuracy of all information reported for this account. 

Specifically, I am disputing the following items : Account Type : Revolving/Charge Account Balance : {$0.00} ( noted as Paid in Full / Charge-off ) Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Date Closed : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  High Balance : {$480.00} Credit Limit : {$200.00} Payment Status : Sold ; was Charged-off Remarks : Purchased by another lender ; Paid in Full / Was a Charge Off Payment History : Reported OK in XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Under Metro 2 reporting rules, all data must be accurate, complete, and verifiable. I request the following : 1. Verification of the account please provide written proof of my responsibility, account opening, payment history, and any charge-off details.

2. Correction or deletion if you can not verify the accuracy of the above-referenced information, please correct or delete the account from my credit report immediately.

3. Response timeline per the FCRA, please respond to this dispute within 30 days. 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and any supporting documentation. I also request that all correspondence be sent in writing to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: The XXXX charges on my credit account has been paid in full, and have not been removed from my credit acct, which causes me to have a lower score than I should. Please look into this matter, as it hinders me from obtaining credit.

On XXXX-18, I opened up a tab at a bar with my Chase debit card. Upon closing the approx {$20.00} tab, a Chase debit card was given back to me, although it turned out to not be my debit card. I did not come to this realization until the next morning. I immediately checked my online banking accounts the next day and saw numerous fraudulent charges ; detailed dates and transactions attached. I then called Chase claims services to file the claim and report my debit card stolen. Chase investigated the claim and came to the conclusion that the claim was denied. They stated that because my PIN was used on the fraudulent transactions, that i was not owed my money back. I have evidence on one of the attached documents of an email that was sent to me at the time of the fraud. The email is a fraud alert from Chase showing that 2 ATM cash withdrawal were attempted and then successful at a XXXX XXXX. This was the beginning of nearly {$4000.00} in ATM withdrawals and purchases on XXXX-18. I have witnesses that can state I was out with them in XXXX at the time of the fraudulent transactions ; most of the transactions occurred in the XXXX suburbs. The end result is I was not reimbursed for the fraudulent charges and Chase claims was not helpful in the matter.

Under the counsel of my HUD advisor, I had sent an appeal request to my lender US Bank Home Mortgage in regards to a denial letter dated XXXX/XXXX/2015. According to their denial letter, my appeal needed to be submitted no later than XX/XX/XXXX XXXX,2015 I sent my appeal letter directly to my relationship manager as well via certify letter on XXXX/XXXX/2015, and I also gave my relationship manager a call letting her know that my appeal letter had been sent. ( left a voice mail on XXXX/XXXX/2015 ) no response. I left a second voice mail on XXXX/XXXX/2015, no response. Being concern that I was hearing from my relationship manager, I called again on XXXX and talked to another agent from US Bank and I was told my she would pass on the message to my relationship manager because she was the one in charge of my file. 
On Monday the XXXX, I had a missed call from XXXX XXXX XXXX, my relationship manager, I called her back on this day ; but I was not able to talk to her. Finally, XXXX XXXX called me on XXXX telling me that because I had sent my correspondence to the wrong department, US Bank Mortgage, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MN instead of US Bank Home Mortgage, Escalation Center, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MN. and despite the fact that I had also faxed the appeal letter directly to her on XXXX/XXXX/2015 they were no longer considering my case, and she suggested to sell the house. 

I related this answer to my HUD counselor and she advise me to contact as soon as possible the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

I have my property taxes escrowed each month along with my mortgage payment. Rocket Mortgage indicated that the taxes were paid on XX/XX/2023. However, when I checked with the local taxing authority if my property taxes had been paid, they said that the taxes had not been paid. Currently my taxes are delinquent, and my home is subject to being sold for non-payment of taxes. I contacted Rocket Mortgage and provided them with contact information for the revenue commissioner 's office and my tax account number and the parcel ID. However, Rocket Mortgage refused to pursue this matter and required me to get a letter from the revenue commissioner 's office stating that my taxes have not been paid before they would take any action. This is easier said than done. I live in a small rural community, and the revenue commissioner 's office has limited staff. I have no idea when I can get such a letter. I don't want to lose my house because of Rocket Mortgage 's failure to pay my taxes with money I have already given them to do so.

My name is XXXX XXXX, I am the widow of XXXX XXXX and the executor of his estate and legal heir to this property as ruled in the state court of Montana. I am embroiled in a conflict with my mortgage servicer Nationstar, who has obstructed my attempts at modification and resolution of my loan by continually questioning my rights as the legal heir and forcing me to provide the same documents over and over again. As a result of these games that Nationstar is playing, my home went up for a foreclosure sale. I am a widow living on fixed income and taking care of my XXXX year old son. This is not right!! 

My husband and I purchased this home 9 years ago. He was the breadwinner while I stayed home to take care of my XXXX son. My husband ( the listed borrower XXXX XXXX ) passed away in 2012. I was named the executor of the estate and the rightful heir and have all of the necessary court documentation to prove this. I assumed the mortgage and continued making the mortgage payment as agreed for nearly two more years. However, as a widowed mother on fixed income I did not have any type of safety net and when I had a major plumbing emergency due to the main water valve pipe breaking I was in big trouble. I had to take care of this and the out of pocket costs were nearly {$3500.00}. Due to this emergency I started sinking financially and eventually missed my mortgage payment and desperately tried to figure a way out of my financial hole. I contacted Nationstar but they were not helpful at all. I was not even aware that there were programs available to help homeowners until I saw a commercial on TV about the Obama HAMP program. 

After learning of this program I contacted Nationstar again, and NOW their agents admitted there were options for help. I sent all of my information in for review and tried repeatedly to follow up and get updates. However, at every step of the way Nationstar obstructed the process -- I was continually grilled about the ownership of the home, about the survivorship and executor of the estate paperwork etc. I sent these papers in at least 4 different times but Nationstar seemed to lose the papers every time. I was never able to get anywhere with Nationstar. Instead of working with me Nationstar tried to auction off the house.

Capital one is not providing customers including me with full transparency. My account has been XXXX  up since XX/XX/year>. Where is my direct deposit!?!??????

complaint_text:
Back in 2023... I financed about {$1800.00} or to have my teeth straightened with smile direct club, with {$250.00} down and {$88.00} a month.. half way through back around XXXX of XXXX I get an email stating smile direct club is no more and has filed for bankruptcy case no. XXXX with the southern district of Texas XXXX XXXX XXXX So no more services could be obtained.. no support, no trays to continue with the straightening of ones teeth or anything.

complaint_text:
My account was never late! I have had exceptional payment history all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment to be updated.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 


This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 


Update the late payments from my consumer reports
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: To whom it may concern I have been having grief with the same companies over and over. I have disputed these debts on numerous occasions and yes they are removed but they are later reinserted, sold to another debt collection agency, with no update on my credit report or proof that I am the owner of these debts from Commonwealth Financial Systems. I have made several calls to the original collector XXXX XXXX XXXX and no one is able to help me or tell me what this is about. They are damaging my credit and reputation substantially without any proof of original contract or signatures from me. The disputes are not even showing on my credit reports and I am aware that my reports should reflect that information. Nor have I received updates from my disputes or original time frame or contract from debt instead after the disputes these accounts are re-aging and that is completely illegal. Also following disputes it seems to me that they are reselling the accounts to someone else after showing removed and then opening again. In addition each time these inquiries are placed back on my credit report I have never received a 5 day reinsertion letter and if there is proof of such letter, please also send to my address. IF not this is yet another violation of the FCRA section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ( ii ), which states you are required to notify me in writing. I am asking for the last time for this agency furnish original contracts and proof and initial contract dates for all collection accounts they are claiming belongs to me. I will take further legal actions if these accounts are not removed. I have exhausted all my efforts with this company and the games they are playing or illegal. Please review all 3 credit reports to see the removals, re-insertions, and re-aging that is continually happening. I am really doing all I can to get my credit at a good standing but this is really impacting my credit. I was at XXXX and have received. LASTLY, the account number showing is XXXX all this should be visible on my report. Please rectify this.

I am submitting a complaint regarding a debt that was improperly assigned to me by XXXX XXXX XXXX, the former property management company for XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA ), and collected by Qualia Collection Services based in XXXX, CA. 
Here are the details of my case : I submitted a lease application for a unit at XXXX XXXX XXXX but never signed a lease, moved in, or occupied the property. This was because the leasing agent at XXXX XXXX XXXX later informed me that the unit was made unavailable after I had begun the lease application. I then communicated with the leasing agent that I would like to terminate the application as the unit was not available anymore. This prompted me to ask for a refund for the {$40.00} application fee. 
The property management at XXXX XXXX XXXX proceeded to charge me {$320.00} for an undisclosed reason for which I communicated to the leasing agent that I would like those charges to be disqualified because the unit I wanted was no longer available. 
The leasing agent neither issued a refund for the {$40.00} application fee after I provided the necessary information to issue a refund nor communicated with the property management that the outstanding charge should be waived. 
Two years later, I received notice from Qualia Collection Services claiming I owed {$320.00}. I was never told what this debt was for prior to collection efforts. 
Under fear of credit reporting and to protect my credit score, I paid the full amount on XX/XX/year>. 
After paying, I requested documentation for the debt, and I received a statement from XXXX XXXX XXXX labeling the charge as a Move-Out Charge even though I never moved in or had a lease agreement. 
Tracking the paper trail, I never lived in XXXX XXXX XXXX and as such should never have been charged for a so called move out fee. 
This appears to be an invalid debt under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), as well as an improper charge under California Civil Code 1950.6, which caps application fees at approximately {$59.00}.

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance in : Investigating the improper creation and collection of this {$320.00} debt.

Ensuring the charge is removed from any credit reporting.

Assisting in the refund of the {$320.00} that I paid under false pretenses. 

Parties involved : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Qualia Collection Services XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA, XXXX I have attached copies of : The debt statement labeling the charge as a move-out fee involving both Qualia Collection Services and XXXX XXXX XXXX Email correspondence with the leasing agent showing I was never a tenant Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I hope that you can offer some assistance in this wrongful charge to my account and credit. Please let me know if you require any additional documentation. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I had an unfortunate experience with Discover Card company. Despite filing a claim back in XXXX, it took until XXXX of XXXX for the claim to be processed. The fraudulent charges on my account are primarily digital, and there are also a few charges made at locations I have never visited or shopped at. 
Initially, Discover credited my account for these fraudulent charges. However, they later removed these credits, claiming that they had sent notifications to the cellphone that was stolen from me. As a result, Discover is now demanding payment for the same fraudulent charges that I had already paid while patiently awaiting the completion of the initial investigation. Furthermore, they have closed my account, which is adversely impacting my credit score. It's important to note that I have never missed any payments. 
At this point, I am in urgent need of assistance to recover the funds that were stolen from me and relieve the burden of being recharged for these unauthorized transactions.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: On XX/XX/XXXX I made a purchase using my Chime Credit Builder Account at XXXX for {$140.00} for a 2 night stay. Things didn't turn out exactly the way they were suppose to so on XX/XX/24 I opened up a dispute with Chime Bank about the charges. They then opened their investigation into the matter on XX/XX/24. I inquired about a provisional credit to make up for the money that I was out of. They told me that since the matter was a credit card, not my debit card that it fell under different rules so there would be no credit given on the account until after 10 days, 20 days at the latest. During this time I read on the laws and what happens under Regulation Z about a credit being applied after 10 days etc etc. I have no contacted the bank on 3 different occasions the latest left me on the phone with them for 2 hours 29 minutes, transferred 6 times. Some of the representatives were rude and almost hostile towards me for questioning the lack of funds being given for the credit. They kept trying to shift the blame to the merchant which I told them is not the problem, the problem is the credit given to the customer while the investigation is ongoing. Again they cited Regulation Z and that because it was a credit card, not a debit card different rules apply. My understanding is that I do not have to pay for the charge on my credit card until after the investigation has concluded. I explained this to several representatives that I have indeed already paid for this charge because when I made the purchase, I had transferred money from my checking account to my credit card account and then made the transaction. You can not make a purchase on the credit builder account unless you have the funds available and you move them to that account and you no longer have access to them. In my statements from Chime, they show the transfer from the checking to the credit builder account on the XXXX. They then show that the money was paid to XXXX on the XXXX. I then opened my complaint on the XXXX XXXX  XXXX and then Chime shows to have paid the bill to the Credit Builder Account on XX/XX/XXXX. The bill has been paid and they say they are giving me a credit on the next billing cycle. That is all fine and dandy except for the fact that they have already taken that money out of my checking account. If I was writing a check to them for the amount, they would not be able to charge me for that amount and it would therefore remain in my checking account and I would have access to those funds. I have asked them to credit my account back for that amount until the investigation is done which is scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX. They have a repeated history of holding on to any and all funds possible whenever there is any kind of hold or whatever put on the accounts especially holds from hotels for incidentals. This isn't the first time they have done something like this. A previous time I transferred the money from the checking account to the credit builder account and then made my reservation. The money some how disappeared between the two accounts but the hotel saw the hold put on the account. They refused to pay for the bill even though they had the funds because they were not showing up in my account. Several days later they blamed everything on the hotel and said it was their fault which at that point didn't matter anyway because I had been forced to sleep in my vehicle that night. I stay at that particular hotel every month and have never had a problem with them only when I use the Chime Credit Builder Card. Just like now, I am in a different city and need to get a hotel room but I can't because I am short on the amount needed which would easily be taken care of if they would provide the credit to my account. At the bottom of every Credit Builder Account Statement it says regarding any disputes : We will investigate your complaint and will correct any error promptly, if we take more than 10 business days to do this, we will credit your account for the amount you think is in error, so that you will have the use of the money during the time it takes us to complete our investigation. That statement apparently means nothing.

My account locks back and fourth every other day and Im traveling at the moment and Im stranded in XXXX Arizona with no food or shelter when I supposed to be here for vacation and now I have no money to buy food or pay for shelter ( hotel ). Ive called 6 times and had been hung up on 3 out of those times. I am not mean Im very nice I even called this last time with me begging and crying because I didnt know what I was going to do because I dont have anyone that can help me. Then they tell me it will take 72 hours. Today is Thursday the XXXX of XXXX since Saturday and Sunday are non banking days and Monday the XXXX a holiday so 72hours is really 5 days until I can hear from someone. This is unprofessional. Im here on vacation to see my grandma that I havent seen in 17 years before she passes the lack of compassion and the lack professionalism is unreal. I want to transfer all my money from there when I can so I can not deal with them no more.

I am so displeased with the way my information was used. I was trying to buy a home for my family, and I got denied due to damages on my consumer credit report. This is defamation of my character, and it's hindering my success. I take my livelihood very seriously, and I expected you all to as well. According to 15 U.S.C & 1681, you are supposed to promote fairness and accuracy on my credit report. But all I see are fraudulent and unauthorized accounts. I have been a part of several breaches, so at this point, you all should be protecting my privacy. This is detrimental to my emotional and psychological health to the point I had to have my pastor pray for me several times. I don't have access to buy a house now. I am enforcing my rights, and I expect you to be more ethical with my information. According to 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, not one credit reporting agency shouldn't be reporting any inaccurate information anyways due to neglect use considering that I was in breach. I need help now so I can proceed to buy my family a house.

The original creditor has requested that this account be remove from my credit profile on the XXXX credit reports but XXXX refuses to do so.  They also never updated my account as paid with XXXX.  This is a very shady company as I am sure you get several complaints about them.  I would like the account removed from my credit profile.

I am a hardworking individual has been diligently paying my accounts on time for the quite a long time. However, upon reviewing my credit report, I discover several instances of late payments recorded by these creditors. Perplexed by this discrepancy, I contacted these creditors to inquire about the inaccuracies. After discussing the matter with a customer service representative and the billing department, it becomes evident that there was a mutual agreement between me and these creditors to adjust the payment schedule due to unforeseen circumstances. Despite adhering to this adjusted schedule, the payments were mistakenly marked as late in the system. Understanding the gravity of the situation, these creditors swiftly acknowledge the error and assures me that the inaccurate late payments will be rectified. Additionally, they offer to provide written documentation of the agreed-upon payment schedule to prevent any future misunderstandings.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
I am concerned about the validity and accuracy of your recent investigation of these accounts that are reporting on my credit report. Last month I requested an investigation because I felt the item was not being reported legally. Couple of days ago I received a letter stating that you have ceased investigation of my credit reports because, in your opinion, you believe that I have used a third party credit repair agency. Not only do I believe this to be a stall tactic on your part to grant you an additional 30 days to comply with my original request, but I believe it to be a blatant violation of the FCRA.

I have attached a copy of my government issued ID as well as mail showing proof of address. So, there shouldnt be any confusion or stall tactics on your end. I have maintained a careful record of my communications with you for the purpose of filing a complaint with the FTC should you continue in your non-compliance.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
I'M DONE ASKING NICELY. I'VE SENT YOU NUMEROUS LETTERS INFORMING THERE IS INACCURATE, ERRONEOUS and UNVERIFIABLE INFORMATION ON MY CREDIT REPORT. You are required under the FCRA to have a copies of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is 100 % true, accurate and correct. 
In the results of your numerous investigations and subsequent reinvestigations, you stated in writing that you verified that the item being reported correctly? I'VE ASKED YOU " WHO VERIFIED THIS ACCOUNTS? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation, OR COPIES FOR THAT MATTER, as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly UPDATE all information which can not be verified.

Sections 616 and 617 provide me with remedy when a credit reporting agency does not comply with the law. You are willful noncomplying with the FCRA.

Since you CLAIM TO HAVE VERIFIED THIS ACCOUNT BUT HAVE NOT PROVIDED ME WITH ANY INFORMATION. I WILL GIVE YOU ONE LAST CHANCE TO UPDATE '' THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT.

Please update the following account, or inaccurate information, from my file immediately & send me the results to the address listedXXXX XXXX XXXX
primary_category: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: I reactivated my account last week with BankMobile using my current address. When they sent me my debit card they sent it to my old address instead of my current address. When I found this out the only choice I had was to report the card as lost and get a new one sent out which had a {$10.00} fee. I told them it was their systems fault and I shouldn't have to pay the fee and they told me to use the email customer service. I did this and they refused to refund the fee even though the card being sent to my old address was their fault. I told them I was going to report them but it did no good.

I previously reported a duplicate entry to the creditor. They removed the duplication from my XXXX XXXX credit report ; however, it is still reported on my XXXX credit union. Therefore, I am submitting this complaint on the creditor due to their failure to correct this information with all three credit bureaus.

I received a credit alert on XX/XX/2020 in regards to an inquiry from XXXX on XX/XX/2020. I called XXXX to ask what was going on. The representative stated that the inquiry was soft and was pulled in relations to a potential credit line increase on my existing XXXX card. I told the representative that was false and there is indeed a hard inquiry on my credit file. She then stated that normally they don't pull credit for increases, only for new credit. Then after being put on hold she then says that the inquiry was something I authorized. I told the representative that I am currently in the home buying process and I would not authorize an inquiry knowing it would jeopardize my chance of qualifying. She stated that I should contact TransUnion to dispute the inquiry. 
I contacted TransUnion to tell them what happened and they refused to dispute the inquiry stating that it is " factual ''.
primary_category: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text: PNC Mortgage Loss Mitigation wo n't give me any information regarding countless declined Short sale offers. They hold on to offers then decline and not counteroffer stating it 's too close to sale date. We have submitted latest offer at PNC 's BPO 's value and no one will look at it nor help with getting sale date extended. We have been trying to work with the servicer for past 6 months and get no information except declined. Our sale date is Monday XX/XX/XXXX and really need help getting to a decision maker. Supervisor over loss mitigation wo n't return phone calls. This foreclosure litigation has been on going for almost 5 years because PNC could not prove standing. It has been a nightmare and never once have they reached out to help mitigate the foreclosure. PNC is subservicer, XXXX f/k/a XXXX mortgage is Master Servicer Investor is XXXX TRUSTEE for XXXX XX/XX/2007 pass through certificate Trust put together by XXXX. The Investor name had to be changed as plaintiff on Foreclosure because PNC could n't prove Standing. But as servicer they are the only one we can submit loss mitigation options to because trustee does n't make those decisions. But it seems like if Servicer did n't have standing to foreclose them they do n't have standing to approve a short sale. Resulting in us the homeowners in a BLACK hole. Please help get Sale extended and help us forego a foreclosure by completing a short sale. Our buyers are qualified and approved for XXXX waiting on PNC approval. PNC 's BPO As is Price is XXXX.

I am listing accounts below that have been reported inaccurately on my credit report. In compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act and as a gesture of respect to the Federal Trade Commission Committee on accuracy and completeness of credit information I am formally writing in today to dispute negative information appearing on my credit. This incorrect information is greatly hindering me from getting the credit score I deserve and hopefully, this letter will resolve all the issues on my credit. I demand to see Verifiable Proof ( an original Consumer Contract with my Signature on it ) of the accounts listed below. Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text:
I hope this compliant finds you well. I am filing a compliant to express my concern regarding my XXXX credit card account and the manner in which you have handled the reporting of my XXXX credit card debt to the credit bureaus. 

Recently, I have successfully completed a debt settlement program1099C form, which led to the discharge of a significant portion of my credit card debt with XXXX. I understand that the discharge of debt is a legal process, and I appreciate that XXXX has acknowledged and accepted the discharge. 

However, I have noticed that despite the discharge of my debt, XXXX has not updated this information with the credit bureaus. This omission has a direct impact on my credit score and financial standing. It is crucial that accurate and up-to-date information is reported to the credit bureaus, as it plays a significant role in determining creditworthiness and financial stability. 

I kindly request that XXXX takes the necessary steps to update the credit bureaus regarding the XXXX debt. This will allow me to rebuild my credit and demonstrate my commitment to fulfilling financial obligations. I believe it is in XXXX 's best interest to accurately report this information to the credit bureaus, as it reflects positively on your company 's commitment to responsible lending practices.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: My personally identifiable information was obtained from Equifax by an unauthorized third party. As a result the security of my identity will forevermore be in question. Additionally, this incident will cost me both time and money while I attempt to take the proper precautions to reduce my likelihood of becoming a victim of identity theft.
primary_category: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text: I conducted a serious of disputes regarding suspicious negative items on my credit report in XXXX and the items pertinent to the disputes were deleted. I distinctly remember a fraudulent charge under {$200.00} that was attributed to an address at which I did not reside-one XXXX XXXX at XXXX, TX. Incidentally, following the resolution of the dispute, a department at the XXXX of XXXX referred the " deleted debt '' to an agency called " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' The item was already deleted as the dispute demonstrated that the debt was unfounded and not mine, yet it is being reported once more. I contacted Contract Callers Inc and spoke with a XXXX XXXX, who stated explicitly to me that the company is unable to suspend the account on-file with their office to begin an investigation of sorts to get this matter resolved without obtaining my address to provide me a fraud packet. As I understand it, despite what she said to me, a police report is not needed to move forward with such claims, nor is a company obligated to use a 'fraud packet ' as the sole basis for an identity theft investigation. It was an aggression and deceit that which the collections representative XXXX XXXX employed to obtain personal information from me despite the fact that as a victim of identity theft, I did not feel comfortable giving a company unknown information after already having to use my SSN as self-verification. The information she provided regarding the procedure is untrue just as much as the company is wrong for seeking the fraudulent debt that which has already been permanently removed from consumer reporting agencies.
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

complaint_text:
I received today a XXXX XXXX Notice from a debt collector called Valor Intelligent Services. The Notice claims that I owe {$21.00} for an alleged debt regarding tolls incurred by some automobile, however, it is impossible to read the license plate number from the photo that the debt collector has included on the XXXX XXXX Notice. 

The Collection Notice fails to provide the following required information : A debt collector must provide the consumer with certain basic information. If that information was not in the initial communication and if the consumer has not paid the debt five days after the initial communication, all of the following information must be sent to the consumer in written form : The amount of the debt The name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed Notice that the consumer has thirty days to dispute the debt before it is assumed to be valid Notice that upon such written dispute, the debt collector will send the consumer a verification of the debt or a copy of any judgment If the original creditor is different from the current creditor, notice that if the consumer makes a written request for the name and address of the original creditor within the thirty-day period, the debt collector will provide that information. If, within the thirty-day period, the consumer disputes in writing any portion of the debt or requests the name and address of the original creditor, the collector must stop all collection efforts until he or she mails the consumer a copy of a judgment or verification of the debt, or the name and address of the original creditor, as applicable. 

False or Misleading Representations A debt collector, in collecting a debt, may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation. Specifically, a debt collector may not Falsely represent or imply that the consumer committed a crime or other conduct to disgrace the consumer. This paragraph from their Collection violates this provision : YOUR ACCOUNT IS IN COLLECTIONS Please resolve this matter by XX/XX/2021 to avoid an additional of {$15.00}, and the placernent of a STOP on your vehicle 's registration. 

Use or distribute written communications made to look like or falsely represent documents authorized, issued, or approved by any court, official, or agency of the United States or any state if the appearance or wording would give a false impression of the documents source, authorization, or approval When I called the credit reporting company 's headquarter, a call that was recorded by me after informing the other party, the XXXX employee : Failed to disclose in the initial written communication with the consumer, and the initial communication if it precedes the initial written communication, that the debt collector is attempting to collect a debt and that any information obtained will be used for that purpose. 

See attached Guidance from the CFPB. A copy of the debt collector 's first communication is attached so that its violations can be verified by CFPB. The communication further proves that the license plate number is illegible in the photo. I attempted to pay the toll for License Plate XXXX, which was actually printed on the first notification from the alleged original creditor, proving that even they could not decipher the illegible photo. When I entered the Invoice Number with the license plate, XXXX, no violation was displayed by the computer system. Because of the problems with the photo, the difficulty with reading and confirming the license plate number in the photo, which is the sole evidence that supports the alleged debt, the XXXX  XXXX agent stated that he would request that his supervisor cancel the debt. I never heard back from XXXX XXXXXXXX, until today 's notification. 


XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Attorney at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX

I am writing to you because I feel that I have been severely wronged by Wells Fargo. I had lost my job and was 2 months behind on my mortgage and doing my best not to miss another payment for fear of falling into foreclosure. I had also had to file bankruptcy due to my financial situation. One month I could not pay the mortgage until the XXXX of the month and the lender sent me a notice of pre-foreclosure and said they could not accept my payment because my file had fallen into pre-foreclosure. I tried for over a year to get the hardship assistance from Wells Fargo and they played constant games with me. They told me I had to be at least 3 months behind before they would review me for any assistance. They also kept switching customer relationship managers every month. I could never get the same person on the phone. Even though I sent paperwork multiple times they claimed they never received it. When I did get them to acknowledge that they received it, the next time I called in, the next rep would tell me they lost my paperwork. They also would tell me that certain documents were not received on time and made me apply and re-apply over and over again. Wells Fargo made this process very frustrating for me. I am a good person and believe in paying my debts, but the way Wells Fargo has treated me, I do n't think they want me to keep my home. I have a legitimate reason for hardship and my mortgage is 55 % of my gross monthly income. If Well Fargo would just do the right thing and lower my interest rate and payment from the 5.25 % adjustable loan I am in, then I would be able to afford my bills and the mortgage with money to spare. I think the real reason Wells Fargo is denying me is that they see that I have some equity in the home. From what I understand, this is not a valid reason to deny my hardship. I know that I meet all of the federal criteria. I just want to keep my home. Please help me get this resolved with Wells Fargo. I know they were fined a lot of money by the government last year specifically for playing the types of games they are playing with me, but I guess that fine was n't enough because they are still violating the agreement with the government. Please help me keep my home.
Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified inaccurate accounts that need reporting and correction through your company.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text: I would like the authorized user credit card Chase XXXX  XXXX with a {$5000.00} limit removed from my credit report. I do not want this reporting on my credit report because according to the FCRA I can block anything from my credit report. Please remove it immediately.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text: I'm really not sure what happened. I have mailed off letters to the credit bureaus continuously and thus far I have not gotten a response. My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX and I am filing this complaint for falsely reporting misleading information. There is no third party involved. Please review the uploaded letters.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: My issue is with a federally chartered bank, in fact, the first federally chartered bank in the U.S., Wells Fargo. I started a short sale with Wells on XX/XX/2015 -- XXXX days ago. The file has been passed through XXXX ( XXXX ) negotiators -- XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and now, XXXX XXXX. There have been numerous requests for information ( including request to change items Wells has previously asked us to do ) -- all information requests from Wells have been satisfied within XXXX hours. ( Incidentally, these information requests have been made, notwithstanding the fact that the XXXX negotiator, XXXX XXXX, indicated he had everything he needed to proceed ). What 's disturbing is that each time Wells moves the file to a new negotiator, there is no reason given, and the new negotiator can ask for a single document, or update of a document, and the clock starts ticking anew. It 's a chronological merry-go-round that seemingly never ends because Wells can start the process all over for any reason : " Could you resubmit Addendum One because the buyer 's signature is n't legible enough -- is it XXXX or XXXX? '' Assuming such a request is legitimate, does it warrant starting all over? It 's clearly used as time management mechanism. There has been no communication from Wells since XX/XX/2015 when the negotiator said she 'd be back in touch " shortly. '' We have emailed and called the negotiator 's manager ( XX/XX/2015 ) with NO RESPONSE. The matter has been escalated with the Wells Fargo Executive offices XXXX ( XX/XX/2015 & XX/XX/2015 ) with promises of a response within XXXX hours -- again, NO RESPONSE. I 'm at wits end. If there 's no response to their own management 's request for information, as a consumer, I 'm totally helpless. The mortgage is significantly past due and the next step is foreclosure. This has become an enormous hardship. Having this matter unresolved prohibits me from taking other actions that would benefit my overall health and well being. Like all federal agencies, I know that CFPB has limited resources and I really tried to resolve this with Wells internally. But at the point the EXECUTIVE offices at Wells states that someone will call within XXXX hours, and XXXX days later there 's still no response, I simply do n't know what else to do.

I closed on my house last XXXX of XXXX and the loan servicer was United Wholesale Mortgage. At the end of XX/XX/XXXX, I received notice that I was being transferred to another loan servicer in XX/XX/XXXX. It turns out I was transferred to the same company, United Wholesale Mortgage. I sent a payment in XXXX as usual to the " new '' company. On XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX, I contacted UWM as it showed I was 56 days past due on my mortgage. Their customer service chat feature says it's " unavailable '' no matter how many times you log in. I called the company at that time and a loan servicer named XXXX XXXX answered. I had sent a payment to the company on XX/XX/XXXX and it shows on my bank statement. However, the agent told me that she saw the payment was returned and did not know why, which it doesn't show returned in my bank account. She advised for me to call back to speak with customer service on Monday and to not pay from my bank account until the situation was rectified. She proceeded to remove my XXXX payment. She said to send a certified letter to their " research department '' as well to a XXXX XXXX XXXX look into it and it would take 30 days. She also advised I'm being transferred again to a different mortgage company in XXXX. I sent the certified letter on XX/XX/XXXX and have not received a response yet. After this, I still attempted to call their company and was on hold for over an hour with the call being transferred numerous times and the chat feature still " unavailable ''. I was finally able to speak to someone on the phone on XX/XX/XXXX but they couldn't answer my questions about why my payment was showing " returned '' and tried to pressure me to give them money right then and there, which I refused without an itemized statement and they hung up on me. Their practices don't seem legal to me at all and before anything happens to my mortgage, it needs to be investigated as it seems they are trying to get whatever they can before I go out the door to another company. If you XXXX this, you will see I'm not the only XXXX in this situation. No one answers at the company. They are sure quick though to send warnings of foreclosure.

I recently checked my credit report and i notice there is unauthorized credit inquiries made by the companies listed I never authorized and for no legitimate purposes. This constitutes a violation of my rights under the fair credit reporting act 604 as well as violation of my rights to privacy.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text: In XX/XX/2017 my vehicle was reprocessed after only 30 days of delinquency. However my chief complaint is that I was never notified when the vehicle was auctioned or sold. According to the reprocession laws in the state of Nevada, as the consumer I was supposed to be notified of the date, location of the sale of the vehicle. Also I never received notice of how much the deficiency amount owed if any. This finance company is also reporting inaccuracies on all 3 of my credit reports. Quality Acceptance is reporting every month that I am delinquent which has added extra charges from original balance at the time of charge/off placed on my credit reports. None of the information is accurate that's being reported by Quality Acceptance to all 3 credit agencies. XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX.
primary_category: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text: On XX/XX/22 a person pretending to be a customer service representative from XXXX guided me through a problem with my phone. They instructed me to fix the problem through XXXX XXXX. In the course of the conversation they gained access to my Bank of America savings account and used XXXX to make unauthorized transactions on my account totaling XXXX. I reported this to Bank of America, but they have not credited my account.
THESE FRAUDULENT ACCOUNTS ARE NOT MINE AND MUST BE TAKEN OFF FROM MY REPORT
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed
