complaint_text:
On XX/XX/2019 at XXXX XXXX ( 31 mins ), XXXX XXXX ( 2 mins ), XXXX XXXX ( 1 min ), and XXXX XXXX ( 16 mins ) I called my mortgage company Mr. Copper. I spoke with XXXX ( ext # XXXX ) in regards to a letter I received in the mail. The letter has a statement date of XX/XX/2019. In the letter it states that I have to pay {$80.00} to my escrow account by XX/XX/2019 to have a monthly payment of {$990.00}. Mr. Copper calls that option 1. That is an increase from my past monthly payment of {$980.00}. Option 2 is to have the escrow shortage divided for 12 months and my new monthly payment will increase to {$1000.00}. I paid {$90.00} on XX/XX/2019 to my escrow account to have my monthly payment be option 1 of a monthly payment of {$990.00} and yet my monthly payment increased to {$1000.00}. 

The reason for the call was ensure if I place {$1000.00} in my escrow account would it decrease my monthly payment. When speaking to XXXX she told me that was not possible. I told her I would like to see a copy of Mr. Copper 's policy on escrow accounts and would also I like to speak with her supervisor. The supervisor name is XXXX ( employee # XXXX ), she gave an analogy of the escrow account being like a bank checking account. She said, " If you escrow account is in the negative, then the increase in the monthly payment increases to cover the projected escrow cost. '' I then said, " If that is so then if I transfer {$1000.00} my escrow account then my monthly payment should decrease. '' She told me that is not correct and the escrow account could not have a positive amount and I would receive a refund the following monthly. I then ask if she could send me Mr. Copper 's policy on escrow accounts, a document in writing where it clearly states that as being the company policy. 

It is now XX/XX/2019 and I have not received Mr. Copper 's policy on escrow accounts and that is my chief complaint. 

My secondary complaint is that I paid {$90.00} to my escrow account on XX/XX/2019 to have my monthly payment of {$990.00} and it still increased to {$1000.00}. 

This occurred to me last year as well. I paid the required escrow payment and my monthly payment increased anyways. I am sure if Mr. Copper is doing this to me they are doing it to other people. 

-- Sincerely

Truist is sending me bogus letters related to insurance. They failed to pay my insurance and I ended up paying. I paid a {$45.00} fee for a gap in insurance. I reinstated my insurance on XX/XX/XXXX. The gap was XX/XX/XXXX- XX/XX/XXXX. So as of XX/XX/XXXX, I was covered. 

On XX/XX/XXXX they sent me a letter saying that I had no coverage and they were taking out coverage and charging me {$900.00} for this coverage. This makes no sense since the insurance coverage was solved on XX/XX/XXXX and the letter was issued XX/XX/XXXX. Additionally, I talked to them on the phone in early XXXX to pay the {$45.00} and make sure all was correct and accurate. 

In the letter, they sent they listed an old phone number that does not function correctly. it leaves customers in an endless loop where you can't get in touch with a human. The wrong number they listed on the letter XXXX there is no way to talk to a human from this number. Ins spite of trying all the menu options to get to a human I kept getting cut off. I spent several hours trying to get through. I ended up calling 4 other XXXX numbers for Truist before I got a human. That person ( in mortgages ) was able to get me a functioning phone number. She explained to me that the letter was 'system generated ' and that is why the number did not function correctly. How can they send out a letter that has a useless number? 
the new number she gave me was XXXX My primary complaint is that Truist makes communication near impossible for any normal person with work they need to do during the day. It is very costly to take half a day off of work to spend time trying to get through by phone. 

In the end, I finally got a human and they confirmed that the letter was in accurate. They have my insurance information there is no additional {$900.00} to spend. I lost my entire morning chasing this information down. How do they get fined for creating such duress and needless lost of work time and wages for me to solve a problem they created? 

How would this work for a single mother with shift work where she could not take time off to call Truist to find out they sent a bogus letter?

One year later I find out the house was not in compliance with the local township. I spent more tha {$20000.00} to repair violation which was overlook by the bank inspection. As a result, I fell behind on my mortgage. 
For over two years I have been trying to get a mortgage modification. U.S. bank has been IMPOSSIBLE to deal with. U.S. Bank Agent XXXX XXXX has been using all the XXXX tactic to delay and denied my modification. 
U.S. Bank Agent : XXXX XXXX # XXXX ext XXXX I need a modification. Please help XXXX

complaint_text: I contacted Bank of America when I got behind in my mortgage payments. I asked for a loan modification. They sent me a packet of forms. I filled them all out and faxed them and the nessacary documents all back to them. I spoke to them numerous times while they said they received them. Then every other week they said they did n't get this or that. So I faxed them over and over. And continued to call and talk to the to stay on top of things. Then they said oh the forms are over 90 days old we need new forms and documents. So I faxed new forms and documents. I had a loss in income and provided documentation. Again XXXX need new forms and documents. Again I faxed new documents and forms. All mean while they had there collection people calling me from XXXX to XXXX over and over all day long. Being rude while I explained my situation over and over. Threading for foreclosure. After a good 9 or 10 months went by I could n't understand why or what was taking so long. I told them if they did n't process my request and give me an answer I would drive to California and contact the local news media. Suddenly I received what they said was a modification. Now instead of my payment being a little over {$1000.00} a month it went to {$1300.00} a month. There were property taxes they claimed I owed and they were paying yet I have an Exemption due to military XXXX. I contacted the XXXX County Tax Assecors office and spoke to them. They told me all tax payments had been sent back to Bank of America and gave me the dates & amounts refunded & even the dates those checks were cashed. Yet Bank of America still has never refunded that money to my escrow or stopped charging my account for taxes they are not paying. They said paying the inflated payment was my only option and I did not qualify for any of there programs. Either I agreed to pay or they would foreclose on my home. And if I made the trial payments on time they would drop all the fees associated with my payments being late at the end of the trial period. I made the trial payments and no they did n't drop the fees they tacked an additional {$15000.00} plus in fees onto my loan. I could n't keep making the inflated payment as I lost more income. I contacted them again and there Help line told me there was nothing I qualified for in terms of help but that this Law office XXXX could help me But that I would have to pay them {$3600.00} in 3 monthly payments of {$1200.00} each. I paid and they said they would get my modification and straighten out the tax issue. I was sent the same forms Bank of America sent 3 times I filled them out and faxed them the forms & documentation. But got nothing suddenly I started receiving letters from lawyers saying my house was in forclosure and about to be sold on the courthouse steps. But no letter from Bank of America I called back and forth to XXXX and got the run arround being Tx that all these lawyer letters were just a scam and I had nothing to worry about. I called Bank of America and they passed me arround to multiple extensions and said they would get back to me but nothing. I then called XXXX of the letters I received from XXXX XXXX Firm and they told me to come in for a free consultation. I did and sure enough my house was in foreclosure and about to be sold. So I filed Bankruptcy and here I am

Debt Validation Failure & Illegal Reporting of Charged-Off Account Company Name : UPSTART NETWORK Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$15000.00} I am filing this complaint against UPSTART NETWORK for violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in their handling of a {$15000.00} account they are reporting as a collection/charge-off.

I sent a written request for validation of the debt under FDCPA 809 ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ). They failed to respond with : A copy of the original signed agreement Proof of assignment or ownership of the debt An itemized breakdown of the amount owed Despite not validating the debt, they continued to report this account to the credit bureaus, which is unlawful under both FDCPA and FCRA. 
Additionally : The original creditor, Upstart, declared this account a charge-off in XXXX 
I was not offered any hardship plan or repayment options, despite suffering from : o Job loss due to the COVID-19 aftermath o Financial devastation from an ongoing divorce o The complete disruption of income due to XXXX XXXX It is unjust and unlawful for this debt to continue appearing on my credit report without validation and with no proper communication from the collector. The pressure tactics used also caused emotional distress and may constitute harassment under FDCPA 806.

1. Equifax is well past 30 days past due on a Judgement in the amount of {$620.00} that was awarded to me and is attached. 

2. RE : Intent to file lawsuit, no response for Validation documentation. 
Validation Letter sent to : XXXX A Debt CollectorXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Account ending in # XXXX To Whom It May Concern : Please be advised I have requested " validation '' { not verification } of an item reported to you by the above original creditor/collection agency. I have received no response from them and/or no proof to validate their claim. 
They have broken the law by their non response within the time period allowed by law. I am proceeding with legal action as prescribed by law against the above named original creditor/collection agency. Should this item not be deleted within the required time allowed by law I will seek every legal remedy available to me and file suit against the credit bureau responsible for reporting this erroneous claim. 
I urge you to take this extremely seriously as I have documented my case without error. I encourage a response from you expeditiously.

To Whom It May Concern, I am writing in response to a received on regarding an alleged debt Collection you claim I owe. Please be advised that I am requesting validation of this debt, as is my right under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g. Pursuant to this law, I respectfully request that you provide the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor. 2. A detailed statement of the alleged debt, including the amount and how it was calculated. 3. A copy of the original signed debt collection agreement or contract. 4. Proof that you are legally authorized to collect this debt. 5. A full accounting of payments, interest, fees, and charges applied to the alleged balance. 6. A copy of the judgment ( if any ) or other documents proving your legal right to collect this debt. Until you provide proper validation, I am requesting that all collection activity cease, including any reporting to the credit bureaus. If this debt is being reported to any credit reporting agency, be advised that failure to validate may constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and I will take appropriate steps to dispute the entry. This letter is sent in good faith and for the purpose of resolving any errors or misidentifications. Please respond to this request within 30 days from your receipt of this letter. regarding an alleged debt you claim I owe. Please be advised that this is not a refusal to pay, but a request for validation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. Pursuant to my rights under the FDCPA, I request that you provide the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor 2. The amount of the alleged debt, including a breakdown of all fees and interest 3. A copy of the original agreement or contract bearing my signature look the same on my Id 4. Proof that you are authorized to collect this debt 5. A complete payment history, starting with the original creditor While awaiting verification, please : * Cease all collection activities, including phone calls, letters, or reporting to credit bureaus. * Do not contact me at my place of employment. * Do not contact any third parties about this debt. If you can not provide the requested verification, you must stop all collection efforts and remove any related information from my credit reports. Please respond to this request in writing. I recommend all future communication be done via mail only. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

complaint_text: It all started when CitiMortgage bought our loan from XXXX. I made my normal payment to my mortgage company ( XXXX ) and another mortgage company ( CitiMortgage ) called to tell me that I was late with my payment. When I informed them that I had already mailed my payment I was told that CitiMortgage bought my mortgage and I was to pay them. We were making our payments and such and got a letter saying that CitiMortgage was charging us for homeowners insurance that we already had and was sending in the certificates for every year. We later found out that we were being charged for insurance for 7 years. We started really looking at our bill and saw " fees & fines '' and when we asked where these fees and fines came from, they could n't tell us. We tried to do a modification with them in XX/XX/XXXX/XX/XX/XXXX and was denied after the 6 month trial because they said that they did n't get our first payment. When I told them when it was mailed in and the money order number they did an investigation and found our payment on the desk of someone that no longer worked for the company, but they still denied our modification and the only option that they gave us to keep the house, was to do a modification that started with a low interest rate that would increase every year until we got to our initial interest rate, so we did. We started another modification in XX/XX/XXXX, but I lost my job and they quit talking to me. I stopped getting monthly statements from CitiMortgage and started getting them from a company called XXXX. We tried to do a modification with them, but were denied for different reasons, and then they said that they were going to foreclose without offering any other options such as putting what we owed on the back of the mortgage because they said what we owed was {$30000.00} which means @ {$580.00} a month, we would n't have paid for at least 7 years which is untrue. XXXX said that the house went to auction XX/XX/XXXX, but no one bought it. They continued to send us statements until XX/XX/XXXX. My husband was talking to a realtor that works for XXXX and he told us that the deed was transferred XXXX XXXX, XXXX, which we found out was a lie. I got a letter in the mail that says the deed was transferred back to the lender on XX/XX/XXXX. A guy from the mortgage company showed up at the door to see what to tell the Sherriff 's Office, and when we told him what was going on he informed us that XXXX is not even a mortgage company, but a debt collector and never had any intention in helping us keep our house and suggested that we get a lawyer

I found out the company is owned by XXXX at XXXX XXXX, OR XXXX and that is who filed the complaint with Equifax. I just double checked with the leasing office that I applied to that received this fraudulent information from the credit report from Equifax telling me that it was the last apartment I lived at and gave me the property name of XXXX that was on the credit report. This company runs XXXX and XXXX my Account ending in XXXX. I will attach my ID that has nothing to do with the address where I use to live, but I hope it helps. I can also attach a photo of the first page of the first year lease. Also it 's {$650.00} that is listed that I owe on the credit report - my rent was {$680.00} - they had me moved once and possible are confusing me with someone else 's old lease - they actually owe me money, security deposit - {$150.00} - possibly being accused by two roommates whom verbally and physically assaulted me continuously accusing me of not paying the electric bill ( verbal abuser replaced her lease to a physical abuser ) They felt I was solely responsible for the electric bill ( which all my payments are noted on EWEB for my share or I have a receipt for the much earlier ones to this of the physically delivered payments to the verbally abusive roommate whose name was on the bill. Being XXXX, it appeared the office was abusively discriminating me to this constantly trying to run me out. I have video on Instagram to the physical abuse and living conditions to this as well as emails from XXXX ignoring my cries and even trying to throw me out to previous cries before moving me to this different room when I was getting seriously ill from smells of heavy drug use which I reported to campus police.

I had a XXXX transfer out from Citi account to XXXX XXXX  account on XXXX XXXX  2021 and it shows that money came into my XXXX XXXX  account on XXXXXXXX XXXX 2021. But when i checked into my Citi account on XXXX XXXX 2021, it is showing that this transaction is showing as returned now? 
When i contacted Citi about the same, Citi has the most lousy and useless excuse that after my XXXX XXXX  2021 ACH out transaction of {$2500.00} there was another ACH out transfer or {$200.00} from my Citi account to my XXXX XXXX thus {$2500.00} is returned as at a time there could only be one ACH out transfer. Citi Customer should one ACH out transfer only at a time. 

I checked with my XXXX XXXX account. {$2500.00} was there on XXXXXXXX XXXX  2021 and {$200.00} on XXXX XXXX 2021. What Citi is saying is very confusing and not accurate. 

It doesn't appear that Citi knows even the basics of banking. Overall Citi is too big, inefficient and worst customer service folks. 
Moreover why citi returned ACH out transaction of {$2500.00} and why not {$200.00}? as {$2500.00} was first transaction??? 
Very doubtful actions of Citi. 

I have to do another transaction of XXXX from Citi to XXXX  now. 
When checked with XXXX XXXX, they are also not aware of what citi is doing. 
Moreover Citi never sent me an email or communicate that they are going to do the reverse of any ACH transaction.

complaint_text: I opened a Citibank account on XX/XX/XXXX. I recently deposited a check from my salary, and then my online bank was closed. They also said that I can not deposit money with my Citibank card. However, they deduct service fees every month, and the bank card is not allowed to be used normally, and the service fee continues to be deducted. What is the use of this card?

I want to stress that I did not give written permission for these specific transactions to be included in my consumer report. At no point did I authorize these entries, and their presence on my report is unwarranted. Consequently, I am formally requesting that these accounts be blocked and removed from my report immediately. 

It is important to clarify that this request is not due to any error or negligence on my part. There has been no oversight or misunderstanding on my end. Instead, this issue arises solely from the fact that I did not explicitly authorize the inclusion of these transactions in my report. I am diligent about maintaining the accuracy and privacy of my financial records, and these unauthorized entries compromise that integrity. 

I trust that you will handle this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. Please confirm the removal of these transactions from my report as soon as possible. Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue.

complaint_text:
You closed my complaint # XXXX but it has not been corrected by Ally. In fact it has gotten even worse. 

Ally called yesterday with a request for yet another form. They say there paperwork is incorrect. I now believe this is intentional delay as retribution for my complaint.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX and list of Inquiries. 

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

complaint_text:

Despite prior disputes, each bureau has failed to investigate and correct multiple items that are inaccurate, incomplete, and legally unverifiable, in violation of : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 1681e ( b ), 1681i, 1681s-2 ( b ), and 605 ( a ) ( 5 ) Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) 3-305, 3-501, and 9-210 Specific Issues in My Report : XXXX. XXXX XXXX Charge-Off Marked as profit/loss but debt was already satisfied through trust or insurance ( i.e., the company was compensated ). 
Reporting this as a charge-off is double-collection, misleading, and unlawful. 
Demand : Permanent deletion due to prior payment and misrepresentation. 

XXXX XXXX Charge-Off Same as above. Profit/loss status = already paid. 
Demand : Deletion under UCC 3-305. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) Late Payments Account is open and current. No late payments in over a year. 
I completed their hardship program, and have paid in full monthly since. 
Reporting of past delinquencies is outdated, punitive, and inaccurate. 
Demand : Remove all late marks per FCRA 1681e ( b ) and 605 ( a ) ( 5 ). 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX  XXXX Payments Also current and in good standing. 
Past late payment being reported is inaccurate this account was set on auto pay during the time they are reporting this. The account also had been paid every month Demand : Remove all past late marks. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Unknown Tradeline I never authorized, applied, or transacted with this company. 
Demand : Immediate deletion as this is unverifiable and unauthorized ( FCRA 1681b and 1681i ).

6. Unauthorized Inquiries ( Hard Pulls ) The following companies ran unauthorized hard inquiries without my consent : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX None were approved by me in writing or electronically. These are clear violations of FCRA 1681b ( c ) permissible purpose rule. 
Demand : Permanent removal of these inquiries. 

Additional Notes : I was a confirmed victim of the Equifax data breach. 
These inaccurate entries are damaging my credit and ability to secure stable housing, financing, and insurance. 
The credit bureaus have not conducted proper investigations or provided documentation as required under FCRA 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ).

complaint_text: I. Nature of Dispute I am formally disputing the reporting of a XXXX  collection account allegedly assigned to Diversified Adjustment Service and appearing on my credit reports with XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. XXXX and Diversified Adjustment have failed to provide any evidence or verification that I owe this alleged {$99.00} debt. Therefore, this account is unverifiable, inaccurate, and unlawfully reported under federal law. II. FCRA Violations 1. FCRA 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Failure to Provide Verification Under 15 U.S.C. 1681g, a consumer reporting agency must provide all information in the consumers file upon request, including the source of the information. Neither XXXX nor Diversified Adjustment has provided a signed contract, account statement, billing record, or other written evidence proving this debt belongs to me. If no verifiable documentation exists showing my legal obligation, this entry is unverifiable and must be deleted immediately. 2. FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation All three bureaus are required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation when a consumer disputes an account. Simply accepting Diversifieds word without verifying documentation or proof of contract constitutes a sham investigation ( as defined in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) ). You can not legally verify an account that lacks documentation, signatures, or original creditor validation. 3. FCRA 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Furnishing Inaccurate Information Diversified Adjustment and XXXX  have knowingly continued reporting an unverified debt. That is a direct violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ), which prohibits furnishers from reporting inaccurate or unverifiable information to consumer reporting agencies. The CFPB has fined major furnishers for exactly this behavior including XXXX  ( {$15.00} XXXX, XXXX ) for improper reinvestigations, and XXXX  ( {$23.00} XXXX, XXXX ) for failing to ensure accuracy in data furnished to credit bureaus. 4. FCRA 604 ( a ) Lack of Permissible Purpose If Diversified or XXXX accessed my credit report without a valid debt or signed authorization, they violated 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) by obtaining my credit information without permissible purpose. III. XXXX XXXX and Consumer Data Accuracy Violations The XXXX XXXX Compliance Guidelines, governed by the Consumer Data Industry Association ( CDIA ), require that furnishers : Report accurate, complete, and verifiable data ( XXXX XXXX, Field 23 & 25 Standards ) ; Delete unverifiable accounts ; and Not report accounts in dispute without an investigation outcome ( CDIA, 1.2.3 ). Yet the bureaus are reporting inconsistent data : XXXX  shows Account In Dispute Reported by Subscriber ( FCBA ) ; XXXX  shows Collection Account ; XXXX  shows Unpaid ; These inconsistent statuses violate XXXX XXXX uniform reporting standards and demonstrate that this account has not been verified. IV. FDCPA & Consumer Law Violations by Diversified Adjustment As a third-party debt collector, Diversified Adjustment is bound by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq. Under 1692g ( b ), upon written dispute, the collector must cease all collection and reporting activity until debt validation is provided. Diversified Adjustment failed to comply they continue to report this debt after receiving notice of dispute, constituting continued collection activity without validation, a direct FDCPA violation. -- - V. FTC and CFPB Enforcement Precedents Regulators have repeatedly penalized credit bureaus and furnishers for sham investigations and failure to verify disputed accounts, including : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) {$15.00} XXXX fine for improper dispute handling and reinvestigations. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$23.00} XXXX fine for repeated failure to ensure accuracy of reported data. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) Liability for relying on automated systems without meaningful investigation. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) Sanctions for deceptive and inaccurate reporting practices. These cases establish that a certification of accuracy is not a valid reinvestigation actual documentation and consumer consent are required. VI. Demands for XXXX XXXX I hereby demand the following actions be taken within 15 days of receipt of this notice : XXXX. XXXX deletion of this unverifiable XXXX / Diversified Adjustment account from all three credit reports ( XXXX XXXX, and XXXX  ) . 2. Provide complete documentation verifying the alleged debt, including : The original signed agreement with XXXX  ; Billing records or statements proving liability and amount owed ; Proof of assignment or sale to Diversified Adjustment. 3. Cease and desist from further reporting, collection, or sale of this account. 4. Provide written confirmation that this account has been permanently deleted from all consumer reporting databases. VII. Notice of Legal Intent If this account is not deleted or verified with proper documentation, I will file : A formal enforcement complaint with the CFPB, FTC, and Maryland Attorney General ; A civil claim under FCRA 1681n and 1681o for willful and negligent noncompliance, seeking statutory, actual, and punitive damages, attorneys fees, and costs ; A private action under FDCPA 1692k for continued collection activity on an unverified debt. This letter serves as your final opportunity to comply with federal law and remove this unverifiable account. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MD XXXX
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

XXXX XXXX  XXXX  is reporting a purported collection account allegedly owed to XXXX XXXX for {$2300.00}, originally opened XX/XX/year>, and most recently reported XX/XX/year>. Despite my formal written request for debt validation under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), this company has failed to provide any competent evidence demonstrating that I owe this alleged debt or that they have legal standing to collect it.

Nonetheless, XXXX XXXX XXXX  continues to furnish and maintain this account as Collection/Chargeoff Derogatory on my consumer reports, thereby damaging my credit reputation and violating multiple provisions of federal law.

LEGAL VIOLATIONS : FDCPA 1692g ( b ) : Continued collection activity without providing proper validation after a written dispute.

FDCPA 1692e ( 2 ) ( A ) : False and misleading representation of the character, amount, and legal status of the debt.

FCRA 1681s2 ( b ) : Failure to conduct a reasonable investigation after receiving notice of dispute and continued furnishing of unverified, inaccurate information to consumer reporting agencies.

FDCPA 1692f ( 1 ) : Attempting to collect amounts not expressly authorized by any agreement or permitted by law. 

These actions constitute willful and negligent violations of the FDCPA and FCRA, and have caused significant emotional distress, financial harm, and reputational injury. I estimate damages at {$2500.00} in actual harm, plus {$1000.00} in statutory damages per violation, as permitted by federal statute.

complaint_text:
XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX Last XXXX : XXXX TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX. 


Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report Dear TransUnion, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally dispute certain information on my credit report that I believe to be inaccurate, invasive and more importantly violations of my rights as a law-abiding citizen on the Federal Level . In Regards to the named accounts below : Collections Accounts : XXXX XXXX  Acct ( # XXXX ) {$490.00} Charge OFF : neither company provide a XXXX for any of these so called debt XXXX  Acct : ( XXXX ) {$1100.00} XXXX  XXXX Acct : ( XXXX ) {$2300.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Acct : ( XXXX XXXX XXXX {$4500.00} XXXX XXXX Acct : ( XXXX ) {$5500.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Firstly, I would like to draw your attention to 15 US code 1681 A, B and 42 USC Sec. 48, which expressly state that I never provided verbal or written consent to ANYONE or ANY Agency to furnish my information or allow anyone else to obtain my information. Therefore, any information obtained without my consent is in violation of federal regulations. Additionally, I would like to reference 15 US code 1692 and 15 US code 1666B, which address abusive collections practices in which you continuously aide these collection agencies and financial institutions in these egregious practices that violate my Rights. I believe that the late payments and inaccuracies reported on my credit report are not only misleading but also preventing me from accessing funding to secure my family that I am entitled to as a responsible borrower.

Furthermore, if I am indeed the original creditor per consumer law, it is important to note that it is against the law to transfer any contract, as stated in 15 US 1692a ( 4 ) and Sec 1692e # 6 A and B. Any transfer of my contract without my knowledge or consent would be a violation of my rights. As you have continued to aide these companies in these practices, according to 18 US Code 1028A this is Aggravated Identity Theft because you share and use my personal information for credit reporting without my written or verbal permission.

I kindly request that you immediately remove these negative accounts and take appropriate action to rectify the inaccuracies and Federal Violations on my credit report. I also request that you immediately update my report and remove any negative reports within the legally required timeframe, as outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
My name is XXXX XXXX. I currently live in XXXX XXXX, XXXX. Several years ago, my husband and I purchased a house located at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, XXXX for the purpose of allowing our daughter to live there. She made the mortgage payments and XXXX XXXX XXXX  payments as her rent. We paid the initial down payment, mortgage fees and closing costs. After that we never received any income from or paid any further expenses toward the house, but we were the legal owners. The initial mortgage was through XXXX, but it was later sold to Mr. Cooper Home Loans as of XX/XX/XXXX. My husband died on XX/XX/XXXX. I immediately sent a copy of his death certificate to Mr. Cooper informing the company of his death. Because we owned the property as tenants by the entirety, I became the sole owner of the property upon his death, and no one else held any interest in the property. 

In XXXX of XXXX my daughter residing in the property bought the house from me and the Mr. Cooper mortgage was paid off. On XX/XX/XXXX, nearly three months after the payoff, Mr. Cooper mailed me a check in the amount of {$1400.00}. I took the check to my bank to deposit, but was told I could not deposit it because it was made out to The Estate of XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX, and no account for The Estate of XXXX XXXX XXXX existed. My husband had no estate account. His assets, our home also owned as tenants by the entirety, automatically went to me, our only motor vehicle was in my name, and I was the named beneficiary to his IRA account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called Mr. Cooper and was eventually connected to someone named XXXX in XXXX XXXX sounded like he was eating his lunch while talking to me. I explained the situation and told him I needed them to stop payment on the check they sent me and send another made to me alone. At first he argued they couldnt do that. It was company policy to do it the way they did. I said so I cant get the money owed me? He said yes, and I said well I cant deposit it as written. Would you like to talk to my bank? When I started pushing him to talk to my bank he changed his tune and started furiously typing on his keyboard, eventually telling me he had taken care of it and I should receive a new check within 14 business days. I waited three weeks, and when no check was received I called again and spoke with someone named XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. Again, I explained the situation and was told again he had taken care of it and I should receive the revised check in 5-7 business days. That time period passed and no check appeared. I was scheduled to go on a trip beginning XX/XX/XXXX, and I put a hold on my mail until XX/XX/XXXX. Upon my return home and receipt of my held mail there was still no check for the {$1400.00}. During all this I also received a check for {$23.00}, which I mailed back to the company with a note explaining that check as well had to be made out to me only. In my held mail they had sent me a replacement check for {$23.00}, but it was still made out To the Estate of XXXX XXXX XXXX and myself. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I called the company again and asked to speak with someone in management. I was eventually connected to XXXX XXXX of the Executive Resolutions Team of Mr. Cooper. She listened to my complaint and assured me she could deposit the money directly in my account within 10 days. She just needed me to email her pictures of the two voided checks that read To the Estate of and a picture of a voided personal check to make the deposit. She emailed me her name and number but made no comments in the email. I return emailed her an attachment of pictures of the three voided checks. She said she would keep me informed of when those checks were voided there and she could make my deposit. When I had not heard from her by the XXXX, I emailed her to ask if there was a problem. I received no response. On XX/XX/XXXX, eight days after my initial contact with her, I emailed her again asking for an update. I received no response. complaint_text: Was not notified by new owner of debt that my account was sold. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), if a new collection agency takes over your debt, they must send you a written notice within five days of their first contact with you. This notice should include : The amount of the debt, The name of the original creditor, and Your right to dispute the debt within 30 days

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I'm reaching out because XXXX is helping XXXX XXXX put incorrect information on my credit report related to the account below XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX As Defined by the IRS : The IRS considers a charge-off to be income, either as gross or ordinary income. Income like this doesn't belong on a credit report, so this information on my report isn't accurate! 
By IRS rules, any canceled debt or charge-off is classified as income. Reporting this as debt is incorrect. 

According to 15 USC 1681 s-2, XXXX XXXX, as a provider of information to a credit reporting agency, is prohibited by law from sharing inaccurate info. I'm requesting that you delete this inaccurate information from my report right away.

**15 USC 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : ** " A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person has been notified by the consumer at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate and ; the information is, in fact, inaccurate. '' In summary, l 've shown you that this information is wrong, and youve been notified. Keeping this inaccurate info on my report is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and your role as a credit reporting agency. 
IRS referral is XXXX. 

Please delete this incorrect information from my report immediately. 
Thank you,

nder the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681, you are legally required to report only accurate and verifiable information. Given that my personal data was compromised due to a security breach, these accounts are invalid, and any continued reporting constitutes a willful violation of federal law.

Furthermore, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 U.S.C. 1692, any attempt to collect on a fraudulent debt is illegal. If you fail to remove these accounts immediately, I will pursue legal action for damages, including but not limited to : Violation of FCRA Reporting inaccurate information knowingly.

Defamation & Emotional Distress Damaging my financial reputation.

CEASE ALL COLLECTION ATTEMPTS related to these fraudulent debts. 
Failure to comply will result in formal complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my State Attorney Generals Office. Additionally, I will explore civil litigation for damages caused by your reckless disregard for federal law.

complaint_text:
We bought our house on XXXX XXXX XXXX, with XXXX XXXX.  Unfortunately, our mortgage was sold to Freedom Mortgage right away.  We never made one payment to XXXX, we have always made the payments to Freedom Mortgage.  When our mortgage was sold, my husband and I read their 1.7 star reviews and knew that this was not a reputable company, but seemingly, we were stuck with them.  In hindsight, I wish we somehow fought for Freedom not to take over our mortgage because dealing with them has been an ABSOLUTE NIGHTMARE.  Our original mortgage payment was XXXX, including our escrow account for taxes, homeowners insurance, and our PMI.  Unfortunately, I cannot attach an original statement because their website only goes back 6 months and doesnt allow you to see any payment history prior to that.  In XXXX XXXX, we received our mortgage statement with a new payment of XXXX due in XXXX  (see attached of XXXX  statement.) On XXXX XXXX, we received a letter from them (attached) stating that they had previously sent us an escrow check in the amount of XXXX, as well as an escrow analysis.  In the letter it stated that if we didnt receive this, to call them and they would reissue the check.  I called them on XXXX XXXX XXXX, told them we never received that, and they told us they would issue another check to us and it would take 7-10 business days.  We never received that, so I called back on XXXX XXXX.  The woman I spoke with said whoever handled it previously never submitted it, and she would take care of that now and it would take another 7-10 business days.  
On XXXX XXXX, my husband called them since we still hadnt received this elusive escrow check.  The woman he spoke with told him that the escrow check was canceled because now our account was showing an escrow deficit, so not only would we not receive the check, but our mortgage payment was increasing to XXXX.  There was no prior communication of this and we would have never known if we hadnt called them.  We did receive an Escrow Account Disclosure Statement dated XXXX XXXX (attached) that explained this, but we didnt receive this until XXXX XXXX, over a month later.  When my husband got off the phone after 18 minutes, I called them back because I was not satisfied with the explanation given.  I was on the phone for 59 minutes talking with a woman who explained that when our taxes were analyzed, they werent analyzed for county taxes, only town taxes.  I went through our closing disclosure (attached) and explained that it states county and town taxes were included, and that there is a XXXX  estimate of XXXX for both the county and town tax (attached.) (When I called the tax office, our town and county taxes are paid together, as one fee.)  On our closing disclosure, it states that the town property taxes are XXXX a month and our county taxes are XXXX per month.  When I explained this on the phone, the woman said that something seems off with the account and she isnt sure what happened, so she was going to have it audited and put it in for review herself.  Again, we were told we would hear back in 7-10 business days.  
	On XXXX XXXX XXXX, someone from Freedom Mortgage did call me (for the first and only time since this started) and I missed the call so I called back.  I spoke to a man who explained our escrow analysis was incorrect for XXXX  and thats why we were in a deficit.  He blamed this on XXXX, stating that this is what they received from XXXX  when they acquired the mortgage, but according to our closing disclosure, XXXX  did their job and estimated the taxes.  I have also attached the Initial Escrow Account Disclosure Statement from XXXX  for XXXX XXXX-XXXX XXXX.  On this sheet, it states that our payments to the escrow account would be XXXX a month, resulting in our original XXXX mortgage payment.  After that document, I have also included the portion of Freedom Mortgages Escrow Account Disclosure Statement that shows their projections for XXXX XXXX-XXXX XXXX, showing our escrow payment to be XXXX.  That is almost XXXX less in projected escrow payments.  Freedom Mortgage clearly analyzed our taxes incorrectly, tried to place the blame on another mortgage company, and then we had to pay for their mistake so our mortgage payment went up. 
In that same call, the man I spoke with also told me that an XXXX payment had been applied to our account on XXXX XXXX, the same day I had previously called to discuss the escrow check, and that our payment of XXXX, not the new amount of XXXX was due in XXXX.  XXXX  payment had already been applied to our account, which was also reflected on their website.  I asked him to tell me which account that XXXX payment came from because neither my husband, nor myself had made that payment, he said he is not authorized to tell me which account it came from.  My husbands uncle knows our account information and has paid money towards our mortgage before, and we had assumed this was the case.  This was an incorrect assumption on our part that Freedom Mortgage would apply money to the correct account being that all of the account information had to be on the screen, including our loan number and names.  We received a letter (attached) on XXXX XXXX dated XXXX XXXX confirming the above payment.  It is our loan number, however, not our last 4 digits of our bank account, which I stated in that phone call.  
	On XXXX XXXX, I called to ask why our mortgage payment was XXXX instead of the XXXX that I was told it would be on XXXX XXXX and why on their website it still says that we owe XXXX.  I was told because of our escrow deficit, but I explained that we were told on the phone of XXXX XXXX our XXXX  payment would be XXXX.  We then received two letters on XXXX XXXX dated XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX respectively (attached.) The first letter states they have been trying to contact us about our account.  I have not received more than one phone call from them, nor any voicemail.  The one I had received was the missed call that I previously stated. At this point, I had contact them so many times that if they needed to discuss anything about my account, they had many opportunities.  The second letter states that our account is 2 payments past due and to call them.  When I called them on XXXX XXXX to ask how this is possible, because we have never missed a mortgage payment, let alone been late on one, the woman told me the XXXX was rescinded and applied to the correct account.  I explained that I said it didnt come from our accounts when we were told about it.  She told me that it was a huge error on their part because in order to apply a payment to my account, all of my information, including our loan number, needs to be on the screen.  Again, I was told that she would look into it and we would hear back in 7-10 business days.  Our XXXX  payment was drafted from our account on XXXX XXXX XXXX, so at this point, we were only 30 days behind because of that XXXX payment. We then received a letter dated XXXX XXXX (AFTER I called the previous day) saying they have assigned us a single point of contact.  This has been of zero help because every time I do call, no one knows what the last person said.  I have to ask everyone to go back in the notes and listen to the recordings.  
	Since we had not heard back, yet again, my husband and I called on XXXX XXXX and were on the phone with them for 111 minutes.  We were first connected with a woman named XXXX, and we asked immediately to speak to a manager.  We explained the entire story to the manager and she said that she would apply the XXXX back to our account to take care of it. We told her not to do that, it wasnt our money, and it was just going to make more of a mess.  She finally understood that we were concerned because of their mistake, now we are considered late in our mortgage and it is going onto our credit report as a late payment of 30 days, plus we are being charged late fees on top of that.  She was able to get it off our credit report for XXXX  (attached) since it was their error, but then told us to just go ahead and make another mortgage payment to get us caught up.  I told her that since our XXXX  payment was already drafted, we didnt have the money to make another mortgage payment 6 days later.  She told me that there was nothing else she could do, so again, I asked for it to be escalated.  I was put in contact with someone named XXXX.  I explained the entire situation again, and XXXX  told me that she would try to get it deferred to the end of our mortgage since it was their error so we wouldnt be considered late on our credit and we wouldnt need to pay late fees.  Again, we were told we would hear back in 7-10 business days.
	On XXXX XXXX, not having heard back from them again, I called and immediately asked it to be escalated.  I was put in touch with XXXX XXXX XXXX, who is apparently a supervisor for the loss mitigation department. She told me that since this was their mistake, she was going to try to bypass the regular application for deferred payments. XXXX  said she wanted to get in touch with XXXX  from my previous conversation to get all of the details correct. Again, I was told we would hear in 7-10 business days.
	On XXXX XXXX, I yet again had to call them.  I asked to speak to XXXX  and gave her ID number.  She was in training that day, but I was told they put a message in the system for her to call me.  I was also told that our concern was in underwriting, but that I needed to respond by a certain date and since I hadnt, they had to submit it again.  I was told that if Im not notified that I have to respond, how would I ever know that and I was also told that someone would call me.  I was told again, I would hear in 7-10 business days.
	On XXXX XXXX I called back and spoke to a man who again, put in a request for XXXX  to call me back.  He said he understood my frustration and hopefully they could get to the bottom of this.
	On XXXX XXXX I called again.  I was told that I did receive a call on XXXX XXXX  I went through my phone logs and didnt see a missed call from them, nor did I have any voicemail from them.  I explained that now we are in the process of trying to finance our car since our lease is up and we cannot get financing because we have two payments on our credit report of 30 days late.  I said that this is completely ruining our credit and in turn, our livelihood.  Before this, we both had great credit.  He went through the notes and explained to me that in order for the payment to be deferred, it has to be more than 30 days late.  I was NEVER told this before.  In order for that to happen, he wanted us to stop our automatic payment due to come out XXXX XXXX XXXX  so that way it would be considered more than 30 days late and then it can be deferred.  We absolutely cannot do this.  Two 30 day late payments have already significantly damaged our credit, we cannot have it damaged even further.  
We need this resolved and taken off our credit report immediately.  It is harming our livelihood, and they have gotten away with this for too long.  Dealing with anyone at this company is a disgrace.  My husband wanted me to escalate this back in XXXX, but I kept telling him to let them make it right.  I should have listened to him because this is going on 6 months of no communication between the employees who work there, no communication between Freedom Mortgage and the customer, the employees do not seem to understand what they are doing, they all give you the runaround, they dont call you back, they dont communicate information, there are grave mistakes made.  There are no notes on their website, any letter we have received from them comes an untimely two-three weeks after its dated.  All of these conversations I have had with them are all well documented because they record every conversation.  It says at the beginning of the call and I asked them because I have asked them to go through the recorded calls.  They all seem to agree on one thing: that it was their error in the first place, but no one can do anything to help you.  We have been patient enough and have given them the benefit of the doubt, but now we are escalating this in every way we possibly can.
Thank you,
XXXX XXXX

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
On Saturday XX/XX/year> I tried using my debit card to get gas and transaction kept getting denied. I tried reaching out to my bank ( Current ) but they were closed and have no after hour line so I had to wait until Monday XX/XX/year> to speak with the bank. At this time I logged into my online account and saw in red at the top ( YOUR ACCOUNT IS UNDER REVIEW! For security reasons, some features may be temporarily disabled ) At this point I went to my email address on file for this account, I did not see a email from the bank at first, I then put the bank name in the search bar for my email and saw it went to my spam folder, I marked the email not spam and read it stated the following : After a review of your account, we noticed activity which requires us to verify your identity. As a result, your account has been temporarily restricted until we can obtain all of the information below. 
1- A selfie holding your non expired state id or US passport 2- Proof of address : Utility bill, phone bill, cable bill, or something similar aged 60 days or less that shows the same address as what is listed on your current account. 
Please submit the following documentation by replying to this email. If you do not provide the above information within 14 days your account will be suspended. We aim to provide a final resolution after receiving your response within 14 days. 
These are the ONLY transactions that has been made on this account : XXXX XX/XX/year> - credit to account + {$39.00} at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> - debit from account - {$18.00} at XXXX ( XXXX & XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/year> - debit from account - {$19.00} at XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/year> - credit to account + {$780.00} at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> - debit from account - {$97.00} at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> - debit from account - {$450.00} ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) I immediately provided the selfie holding my non expired drivers license as well as a current bill from XXXX XXXX XXXX with same address as on file with my current account, this was submitted on XXXX  XX/XX/year> I then reached out on XXXX  XX/XX/year> trying to speak with someone in the fraud department only to be told that I could not speak with anyone directly I could only correspond via email. When I sent the email XXXX  I received a automatic email stating thank you for submitting your documents, someone will contact you within 24 hours, Current has never been contacted back by email, phone or text. 
I have reached out to Current via phone trying to speak with someone to get this issue resolved with no luck on the following dates : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> I also sent XXXX different emails to the email address provided in the email received stating my account was disabled the first email I sent was the information they requested, to prove my identity on Saturday XX/XX/year> the next email I sent was on Tuesday XX/XX/year> was once again proving my identity, and I went a step further by proving each debit and credit to the account was mine, I attached the receipts for each transaction that was debited from the account I also provided my current paystub for the credit to the account. The XXXX email I sent was Friday XX/XX/year> trying to get a update or any information I could concerning when they will activate my account, Current has made effort to contact me to explain their reason ( s ) for flagging my account or why they suspected the activity was unusual/suspicious other than the email they sent on XXXX XX/XX/year> stating my account has been temporarily disable due to unusual/suspicious activity, Even all the time times I reached out to them by phone, no one could give me any information they would all tell me to contact fraud by email and they would respond which I have not received any response from the fraud department to date.

Experian shows my FICO score went down 30 points. I don't have anything on my credit, but an account that I paid off. Experian is showing some account in red, but when I click to see where the red account is from, nothing shows up.
primary_category: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
Account : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter is in response to your recent correspondence concerning the above-referenced account ( s ). In accordance with Uniform Commercial Code 9-210 ( a ) ( 2 ), I am making a good faith and lawful request for a full and complete accounting of any and all obligations, notes, and/or security interests Nelnet claims to hold , service, or enforce in connection with this account.

Please be advised that I expect a full response within 14 business days of your receipt of this request, as required under applicable law.

This request includes, but is not limited to, the following : 1. Complete Accounting of the Obligation ( s ) : The original balance and/or principal A complete history of all payments made and how each was applied ( principal, interest, fees, escrow, etc. ) An itemized list of all fees, charges, penalties, or advances assessed The current balance as of the date of your response Any changes in the terms of the obligation, including interest rate changes 2. Documentation of Any Assignment, Sale, or Transfer : Assignments of note or any related security instruments Endorsements, allonges, or indorsements related to the instrument ( s ) Documentation of any transfers or sales to third-party entities, including trust entities The full name and contact information of any successor-in-interest or authorized agent 3. Disclosure of Securitization or Trust Transfers : Full name of any trust, including series and trustee details Date of the transfer and names of the assigning/transferring parties A copy of any Pooling and Servicing Agreement ( PSA ) , trust agreement, or custodial record related to such transfer ALL documentation or evidence that the account ( s ) were securitized or sold to a third party 4. Identification of the Current Secured Party or Assignee of Record : Legal name and mailing address of the current secured party or assignee Name and contact information of any agent or servicer acting on their behalf If you deny or decline to comply with this request, you are required to cite the specific federal law or statutory authority that exempts Nelnet from compliance with UCC 9-210. Any such denial must be supported by valid legal authorityyour internal company policies or procedures are not a legal justification and will not be accepted as a lawful basis for refusal. 

Should your organization not be the correct party to respond, you are required to promptly forward this request to the appropriate department, servicer, or affiliated entity, and notify me in writing that you have done so.
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

complaint_text:
Creditor Account : DEPT OF EDUCATIONXXXX, {$53000.00} Account Number : XXXX Creditor Account : XXXX  XXXX {$4200.00} Account Number : XXXX Creditor Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Creditor Account : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX creditor account : XXXX XXXX ; {$3800.00} creditor account : XXXX XXXX {$1300.00} Reason for dispute : Late Payment/ Negative Status/Closed Account : The account reflects a late payment that I dispute. I believe this late payment should be removed from the account as it is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681a and 15 U.S. Code 1666. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, you are required to provide validation of the information reported. If you do not have appropriate documentation to substantiate the late payment, I request that this be removed from my credit report. 
Additionally, I would like a copy of all supporting proof within 30 days, including the original contract or agreement that reflects my obligation, as well as phone conversation records in relation to any discussions of my unemployment and XXXX, as these factors affected my ability to make timely payments. 
This inaccurate listing is negatively affecting my credit score and, by extension, my ability to secure loans or financial opportunities. As such, I ask that you investigate and correct the report accordingly. 
I look forward to hearing from you regarding this matter. Please forward a copy of my updated credit report to my address. Thank you.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text:
XX/XX/XXXX My son leases a new XXXX XXXX for three-years in XXXX XXXX. I am asked to sign as co-lessee ( please find attached copy of the original lease agreement ). 
XX/XX/XXXX My son moves to XXXX, XXXX  for new job opportunity. 
XX/XX/XXXX My son contacts Hyundai Finance to request an extension on his lease due to the XXXX Outbreak ( please find attached copy of the lease extension ) XX/XX/XXXX My son officially receives the six-month lease extension ( through XX/XX/XXXX ) from Hyundai Finance which he doc-u-signs and immediately returns. At no point did Hyundai Finance mention to him that I needed to sign this lease extension. On top of that, I was never notified nor contacted by phone, email or USPS mail with a copy of this lease extension by Hyundai Finance. 
XX/XX/XXXX My son makes payment # 2 on his six-month lease extension and continues to make monthly payments to Hyundai Finance in advance of his monthly due date of XX/XX/XXXX. He continues to make the following payments : XX/XX/XXXX ( # 3 ), XX/XX/XXXX ( # 4 ), XX/XX/XXXX ( # 5 ), XX/XX/XXXX ( # 6 ) all in advance of his due dateXXXX Hyundai Finance has accepted all six payments on the lease extension ( please find attached list of the lease extension payments made by XXXX  and received by Hyundai Finance ). 
XX/XX/XXXX My son goes to drive his car only to find out its no longer where he last parked it on the street in front of his new apartment. He contacts XXXX  to learn its been repossessed by Hyundai. 
XX/XX/XXXX He contacts Hyundai Finance and was informed that I needed to sign the lease extension and thats why the vehicle was repossessed. He is also told that Hyundai had attempted to contact him by phone but that they are not allowed to leave messages due to privacy laws. My son was unaware of any such calls ( as he does not pick up calls from unknown numbers especially with the proliferation of spam calls everyone receives these days ) and never received an e-mail from Hyundai Finance regarding any issue.

My son asks to speak to a manager and is told it would take 72 hours for a one to get back to him. 72 hours pass and no one contacts him. In fact, its now been over a month days and hes yet to receive a call from a manager. He contacts Hyundai at least half-a-dozen times and gets nowhere. Hes told his only option is to purchase the vehicle outright and pay all of the repo fees. 
XX/XX/XXXX I contact Hyundai Finance several times and speaks with 4 or 5 reps and gets nowhere. All of the Hyundai reps are completely dismissive. I also ask to speak with a manager but never receives a call back. I then contacts Hyundai Customer Relations and opens up a Complaint Case ( Case # : XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX I call to follow up on his case and is told there is no update and is then directed to call Hyundais repossession depart who inform them that there is no way they will reverse this repo order. I have never received an update on my case in nearly a month. 
XX/XX/XXXX We both call Hyundai Finance one last time and speaking to XXXX ( Supervisor ) in Texas to let her know that we are getting an attorney. 

Summary : I would just like to state that my son acted entirely in good faith during this entire process. 
He signed the six-month lease extension with Hyundai Finance as instructed and made every payment on time. He was actually planning on returning the vehicle prior to XX/XX/XXXX and leasing a new Hyundai. He's now been without a car for four weeks. He has been embarrassed, treated like a criminal by Hyundai and has had his and my credit destroyed. He cant even buy or lease a new vehicle right now because of this. Its apparent to us that there is a serious communication issue within Hyundai Finance for which we should not be punished. We firmly believe that their finance department is acting in a criminal manner by deciding to bleed out every last dime from XXXX before taking his car four weeks early after receiving the sixth and final payment of the lease extension. This is clearly a violation of Federal Banking Laws.
primary_category: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text: I am filing this complaint because the consumer reporting agency has failed to fulfill its obligations under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which requires the agency to provide a detailed description of the reinvestigation procedures used to verify disputed information when requested by the consumer. I specifically requested the name and contact details of the furnisher, the identity of the individual the agency communicated with, and the documentation relied upon to verify the accuracy of the disputed account. The agency failed to provide this information within the XXXX period mandated by law. This failure to respond constitutes a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA.

complaint_text:
PennyMac Loan Services LLC received my mortgage payment on XX/XX/XXXX. It is now Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX and PennyMac has not yet credited my mortgage account. PennyMac has held my payment, without crediting my account, for 8 business days. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX from my current loan servicer, PennyMac Loan Services , LLC . This letter states the following : effective XX/XX/XXXX, the servicing of my mortgage loan is being transferred from PennyMac Loan Services , LLC (  PennyMac ) to XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX. This means that after this date, XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX, will be collecting your mortgage loan payments from you. Nothing else about your mortgage loan will change. 
The letter also states that : Under federal law, during the 60-day period following the effective date of the transfer of the loan servicing, a loan payment received by PennyMac on or before its due date may not be treated by XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX as late, and a late fee may not be imposed on you. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX  EST, I contacted PennyMac by phone and spoke with XXXX. I explained to her that I need to make a payment. I stated that if I did not receive my new account number and mortgage statement from the new loan servicer, I would send my next payment to PennyMac. XXXX stated that I could send the payment to PennyMac and they would forward it to XXXX XXXX XXXX, if I didnt receive a mortgage statement from XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX EST, I contacted the new loan servicer, XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX and spoke to XXXX. XXXX stated that they did not have my information yet and that the loan will have a new loan number after it transfers to XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX stated that I will receive a welcome letter by XX/XX/XXXX, the date of the transfer. XXXX also stated that in order to receive a mortgage statement I will have to make a payment over the phone first or by mail, and then after my first payment the mortgage statements will be generated. I stated to XXXX that I will continue to make payments to PennyMac until I receive a mortgage payment from XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

By XX/XX/XXXX, I still had not received any letters from XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding my mortgage account with them. I had no mortgage statement and I did not have any payment coupon nor did I have the new account number from XXXX XXXX XXXX. As a result, I mailed the mortgage payment to PennyMac via USPS priority mail express ( the same way I have being mailing payments to PennyMac in the past 2-3 years ). As per USPS, my mortgage payment was delivered to Penny Mac on XX/XX/XXXX, and signed by XXXX XXXX ( see Attachments 1 and 2 ). 

On Saturday XX/XX/XXXX, I called XXXX XXXX XXXX and I spoke to XXXX to see the status of my account and he informed me that they just received the file from PennyMac the day before. XXXX stated that I was not in their system yet. XXXX stated that it takes a few days for the PennyMac file to load in their system but that by Wednesday XX/XX/XXXX my account should be in the system. I stated to XXXX that since I never received a mortgage statement or any correspondence from XXXX XXXX XXXX, I sent the mortgage payment to Penny Mac.  XXXX stated that Penny Mac will be forwarding the payment to XXXX XXXX XXXX. It is now Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX and I have not received any correspondence from XXXX  XXXX XXXX. 

I called PennyMac on XX/XX/XXXX to find out why they had not posted the check that they received on XX/XX/XXXX. I was able to speak with a customer service representative named XXXX. I asked him why, after receiving my payment, they decided not to credit the account. He answered that they had not yet received my payment. I replied to him this is not true and that I have the USPS ( US Postal Service ) tracking information which shows that the letter was delivered to PennyMac and signed for by XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX ( see Attachments 1 and 2 ). The representative then stated that it takes 7-10 business days to credit the account. I stated to the representative that this is also not true. In the past, after the payment is received, the check has posted to my account in less than 3 business day. For example, in XX/XX/XXXX, I mailed a payment, via USPS, on XX/XX/XXXX ( see Attachments 3 and 4 ). As per the USPS tracking information, the XXXX letter was delivered to PennyMac and signed for by XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX ( see Attachment 4 ). The check for the XX/XX/XXXX payment posted to my bank account on XX/XX/XXXX ( see Attachment 5 ). The XX/XX/XXXX payment was credited by PennyMac, to my account, within 2 business days after receiving the payment.

I believe that PennyMac is not crediting my account in order to be able to foreclose on my home. In the past PennyMac has made many attempts to foreclose on my home. I have filed several complaints against them with the CFPB. I am behind on my payments and I am in the process of catching up. I believe that PennyMac is now working in conjunction with the new servicer, XXXX  XXXX XXXX, to avoid crediting my account. By not crediting my account PennyMac will cause my account to reach 120 days past due and they will be able to foreclose on my home. I believe that PennyMacs goal has always been to foreclose on my home.

complaint_text:
I received an email notification from Citizens bank that my account had too many failed login attempts and had been locked out. Considering that I do not bank at citizens, I was very concerned and called the customer service phone number in the email. 

The first time I called, the customer service associate I spoke with told me I did not have an account with Citizens. 

I hung up and called again, choosing the Online account services prompt. This customer service associate confirmed that I did have an account with my personal email, and told me he would have the email removed from the account. 

Unsatisfied by the fact that I have now gotten 2 different stories, I called customer support again, and after giving my information to the customer service associate, she was asking questions about what type of account I had, and when I told her I was not sure, I just wanted to check the balance on all accounts, she said " why should I give you your balance if you don't even know what type of account you have with us? '' I then drove 2 hours to the nearest open branch location. I called the bank branch at XXXX XXXX when I left my house to ask the bank to place a hold on all accounts. They said Ok. 

When I arrived at the bank, I was placed in an office with a man named XXXX XXXX. I explained my concern and told him I would like all accounts in my name or using my social security number to be closed immediately. 

He was unable to find an account at first, and had to call customer support. With their help he found 2 old accounts from 11 years ago that were Charter One bank, which Citizen 's bank bought out in the past. 

I agreed that those were my old accounts, but I stated concern that my personal email was sent a message about a login attempt to an account which has been closed for 11 years. It did not make sense to me, or XXXX. 

XXXX called Online services, and got the same type of run-around that I did earlier today. 

XXXX also called another number, to a third party Credit card vendor that I also had an account open with the bank, which I do not remember at all. The last for account numbers of the account are XXXX. 

At this point, the Branch manager came in and asked if she could help. After explaining the situation to her, she told me that " maybe a computer glitch from another customer triggered the login failed email '', but this story does not make sense to me. 

I am rather fed up with Citizens Bank giving me the runaround, and if my exhusband has been using my identity again, and they are allowing him, I will proceed with the fullest extent of the law.

This debt collector engaged in abusive deceptive, and unfair practices of the FDCPA which it prohibits. They furnished this account that we didnt agree upon, and I didnt sign an agreement on. A legal contact signed by two parties, and I did not participate in any of it. More so they didnt follow the proper 5 step validation procedure which make these unfair practices. According to the FDPA Im entitled to XXXX dollars per violation and clearly, they violated my rights.
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

'' This debt is NOT mine. I am a victim of Identity Theft. And this is the 3rd time now that this " XXXX '' company has unlawfully posted this onto my " Equifax '' credit file in the last 2 consecutive years. I called up " XXXX '' and politely informed them of the facts. That I have been a customer of XXXX XXXX XXXX for over 22 consecutive years and NOT ever with XXXX The " XXXX '' customer rep. just rudely hung up on me.

I filed a dispute with transunion through certified mail. Transunion didnt not start the clock on my dispute. What transunion did was ask me to verify my correspondence which is a delay tactic. My documents were notarized with drivers license presented with the notary. XXXX verifying information was given. Transunion didnt start my request. Transunion in return asked me for my drivers license in order for Transunion to open dispute. They used this time to send a letter to my home address so they knew very well who requested a dispute. This is one of many violations that Transunion continues to get away with. Constant delay tactics. The account in question is reporting several different months on the different credit bureaus. Variations of date of reported XXXX day late from XXXX XXXX isnt consistent with the XXXX credit bureaus. This tells me the second party credit reporting agencies have provided transunion wrong information that has not been verified. Transunion is allowed to report unverified information to consumers credit report time and time again. I gave Transunion no permission to violate my consumer credit report in this manner of reporting.
