complaint_text:
I applied for assistance in saving my home by hiring an attorney who faxed my fully executed and complete financial package to Wells Fargo Home Mortgage on XXXX XXXX, 2015. My attorney confirmed Wells Fargo Home Mortgage received my application on XXXX XXXX, 2015. 

On XXXX XXXX, 2015 Wells Fargo Home Mortgage via XXXX XXXX XXXX filed and recorded a Notice of Sale on my property. The sale date was originally XXXX XXXX, 2015 and was extended to XXXX XXXX, 2015. 

On XXXX XXXX, 2015 my attorney confirmed Wells Fargo had denied me for a loan modification. My attorney has requested a copy of the denial letter and NPV chart as we believe an error was made in the review. As soon as we have a copy of the NPV chart my attorney will appeal the denial. However as of today Wells Fargo Home Mortgage states my home is still set to foreclose on XXXX XXXX, 2015. 

See Attorney 's note:XX/XX/2015 XXXX ( PST ) XXXX XXXX & XXXX XXXX Spoke to XXXX. XXXX said sale date is still set for XXXX/XXXX/15. He transferred me to foreclosure dept. XXXX XXXX she said sale date is still set XXXX/XXXX/15. She asked if we sent in appeal. I told her we have n't received denial letter or NPV so how can we send an appeal. She transfered me back to Loss Mitigation XXXX XXXX said we are under protective status and he agreed that sale date should be pushed out at least until XXXX/XXXX/15. He put me on hold to try to get a hold of the foreclosure dept and we got disconnect. 

Tomorrow will be XXXX business hours before my foreclosure date. Per CFPB Regulation x ( 1024.41 ) I am allowed 30 days from the date of the denial to appeal my review. XXXX XXXX, 2015 falls before my timeline to appeal. Per my attorney Wells Fargo is not supposed to move forward with the foreclosure sale date until # 1 ) I have advised WFHM that I am not going to appeal or # 2 ) I have appealed and my appeal has been denied. 

If you look at the attorney notes ( above ), even Wells Fargo staff itself states by law I have until XXXX/XXXX/2015 to appeal and no foreclosure should be scheduled at this time. 

I am demanding Wells Fargo confirm the sale date has been post phoned. I plan on appealing my denial. This is in violation of Regulation x.

XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, an incorrect bank transfer into my account was initated. This was a mistake as I was attempting to send my {$34000.00} out of my account to an external account. 
XXXX. There was a NSF on the external account and the transfer did not go through. Once again this was a mistake as I was attempting to send money OUT of my account. 
XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, in another attempt to send money OUT of my account I initiated a wire as I needed the funds transferred out immediately. 
XXXX. By Friday, XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX, I called Ally Bank inquiring about the status of my wire. I spent over XXXX hours speaking to multiple people who were unsure as to why the wire did not go out. In fact I spent XXXX hours with XXXX individual who was unable to get in touch with their wire department. The wire department was being completely unresponsive to the customer service representative and he indicated to me there was a problem with the bank sending wires. No action occured and no information was obtained as to why the wire was not sent out. Following XXXX hours of contacting customer service, I requested to cancel the wire. 
XXXX. I then initiated another ACH transfer OUT of my account for {$34000.00} on Friday. 
XXXX. On Monday XX/XX/XXXX, the funds did not leave the account. I called MULTIPLE times and spoke to multiple people who assured me that there was no restrictions on my account. No one could figure out why my funds were not leaving. 
XXXX. On Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX, I called multiple customer service representatives who were unable to determine why the funds were not leaving my account. I have one customer service representative assure me that any restrictions were lifting. Shortly after spending an hour to reach that conclusion, I received an email at XXXX XXXX indicated that Ally has suspended my transfers. I then called AGAIN and inquired as to why my account was being suspended for transfers. I spoke to MULTIPLE customer service representatives include XXXX XXXX ( Supervisor ) who accidently transferred me mid-call to XXXX XXXX in Deposit Operations. Neither had any clue as to why there was a restriction placed on my account.

ALLY Bank is holding my funds against my will. The customer service representatives are knowingly misleading me. I feel discriminated against. I have spent almost XXXX HOURS dealing with person after person after person. I want to remove my funds from ALLY and CLOSE MY ACCOUNT immediately and they wont let me. XXXX XXXX even tried to claim i didnt have {$34000.00} in my account! I dont feel as though my money is safe. I feel defrauded. I dont know what to do. No one is helping me. I am submitting the latest screenshot of my account as of XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX ET in case ALLY attempts to defraud me and steal my money.

I am submitting this formal complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to report multiple inaccurate, misleading, and harmful credit entries that are currently being reported by furnishers and credit reporting agencies. These accounts have been damaging to my credit profile, affecting my ability to obtain fair credit and causing emotional and financial hardship. Despite my repeated efforts to dispute and request verification, these accounts remain unresolved and continue to violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I respectfully request the CFPBs assistance in investigating these issues and ensuring that my credit report is corrected as required by law.

Issue : Multiple listings of same account Story : This is confusing and manipulates the appearance of more negative activity Instruction : Remove duplicates and ensure single accurate listing I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate these matters thoroughly and take appropriate enforcement or corrective action to ensure my rights as a consumer are protected. These inaccuracies have caused serious damage to my credit score and financial wellbeing, and they remain unresolved despite my good faith efforts to communicate with the furnishers and the credit bureaus. I respectfully ask the CFPB to ensure these accounts are properly verified or deleted and to hold the reporting entities accountable for any violations of federal law. I request copies of all findings and results once the investigation is complete.

complaint_text:
To Whom It May Concern, I am filing this complaint against Experian for willfully and negligently reporting inaccurate personal identifying information and erroneous derogatory account data on my credit report, despite multiple attempts to correct the information. These errors are in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S. Code 1681, specifically sections 1681e ( b ) and 1681i ( a ), among others.

Inaccurate Personal Information ( Wrong Addresses ) : The following addresses are not associated with me and should not appear on my credit file. Their inclusion raises privacy and security concerns and implies potential mixed-file or identity theft issues : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX LA XXXX XXXX Address XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, LA XXXX Wrong Address Violation : Under FCRA 1681e ( b ), Experian is required to maintain maximum possible accuracy in the information they report. Reporting incorrect addresses indicates a failure to establish and follow reasonable procedures to assure accuracy. 
Inaccurate Account Reporting : XXXX. XXXX ( Acct : XXXX XXXX  ) High Balance : {$2000.00} Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Issue : Charge-Off This account is inaccurately reported as a charge-off. I have not received any proper validation from XXXX regarding this alleged debt, and no original documentation has been provided. Furthermore, this account may be the result of identity theft or reporting errors caused by incorrect personal identifiers.

Violations : FCRA 1681s-2 ( b ) : Failure to investigate and correct inaccurate information after a consumer disputes it.

FCRA 1681i ( a ) : Failure to reinvestigate disputed information in a timely and accurate manner.

FCRA 1681e ( b ) : Failure to assure maximum possible accuracy. 
My Experience & Harm : Despite submitting disputes to Experian regarding both the inaccurate addresses and the XXXX charge-off, Experian failed to properly investigate or remove the errors. This negligence has caused me substantial emotional distress, has lowered my credit score, and has interfered with my ability to obtain housing and credit. I believe these reporting failures were willful, or at minimum, negligent, and are in direct violation of FCRA obligations. 
Relief Requested : I respectfully request that the CFPB compel Experian to : 1. Immediately remove all inaccurate addresses from my credit report.

2. Conduct a proper reinvestigation of the XXXX charge-off entry and provide proof of validation or remove the account entirely. 
XXXX. Provide a corrected credit report to me.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
XXXX XXXX, XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Re : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX # VA XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau : This is a letter of formal complaint regarding Ditech Financial, LLC, XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, SC XXXX handling of my loan and intended modification application submitted since XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 
As an honorable veteran who has served his country faithfully, I initially utilized my entitlement to obtain a home loan in XXXX. Since purchasing the above property in XXXX, the home loan has been " sold '' approximately four ( 4 ) times. In XXXX, XXXX XXXX 's acquired the Ditech brand due to FCC and your charges against Greentree Mortgage Company. Apparently, this acquisition has not eradicate years of Greentree Mortgage legal and unethical practices towards their consumers, because Ditech is the same, if not worse to their consumers. They are unethical, harassing me about my debt, calling all times of day and night, from different numbers, when I have told them not to contact me, being misleading and threatening towards me. 
Since Ditech Financial, LLC has handled the loan, my experience with the company has been totally reprehensible and a violation of my rights. The company has failed to appropriately handle my loan modification request submitted on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, after I filed numerous complaints both, verbal, written and in contacting their corporate office. Instead of resolving the matter, my complaints aggravated the entire matter without any personal recourse or advocacy. In submitting the loan modification application, they would always provide " XXXX to XXXX '' DIFFERENT FAX NUMBERS TO EITHER SUBMIT OR RE-SUBMIT INFORMATION which has been very misleading. After submitting the information, they would always say " they did not receive the information. '' My PERSONAL INFORMATION WENT TO SOMEONE ... SOMEWHERE!!! With months of delaying the loan modification, my credit rating has been affected, additional costs have occurred on the loan and this ordeal has taken a mental and physical toll on me and my family. 
I am locked into Ditech being my loan servicer. At this point, I do not feel or believe that I am or will be treated fairly regarding my loan modification or any other matter. I am in financial distress, and I am not seeking to negate my financial responsibilities. However, I am attempting to work towards resolving my delinquent status and to modify the mortgage payments. 
Lastly, I and my wife are very disturb to the fact that Ditech had a third party to deliver a " door knocker '' to our address on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX with a number of XXXX. When my wife called the number it was a XXXX XXXX!! When my wife brought it to XXXX ' attention and thought it was intentional. They responded as if it was not a problem or concern. The next month on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, the " door knocker '' had a different number, XXXX. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX. XXXX

I have an issue with Ocwen Loan Servicing. I lost my job XX/XX/XXXX due to illness, and have been working as hard as possible to make the mortgage payment since. On XXXX XXXX, I filled out the paperwork for a loan modification. I called Ocwen XX/XX/XXXX to find out what I needed to do. I received a letter stating that my profit / loss statement was invalid because it was not signed ( I own the business ) .The female I spoke with said I had been approved for a HAMP modification, which I knew nothing about. I told Ocwen I had not received any paperwork. She emailed me the information, which I received on XXXX XXXX. I was also set up with a phone meeting with my Ocwen loan representative, XXXX XXXX on XXXX XXXX. I did receive a phone call from Ocwen on XXXX XXXX, but not from my loan representative. I stated that I had read the information and would like to move forward with the HAMP modification. I was told it was no longer an option because I had missed 2 of the trial payments, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. I politely told the gentleman that I had not even received the information on the modification until XXXX XXXX, and that there was no way I could have made a payment on XXXX XXXX, when I was n't even aware I was approved for the modification. He had no answer for this, but insisted I send a signed profit / loss statement to them. They had asked for the last 3 months, in my original modification filing on XXXX XXXX, I had given them the last 3 months plus my entire XX/XX/XXXX profit / loss statement. I explained to the man that I owned the company and the statements were generated by my accounting software. He instead asked for an email with XXXX numbers on it, gross income, business expenses and net income. My statements had all XXXX. He then set me up with another phone meeting with my loan representative for XXXX XXXX and I have yet to receive any information on modification programs. This is just the latest issue with Ocwen. I have our small mortgage which was originally a line of credit in collections. I attempted to pay it up to date by sending them a check which was less then XXXX, they held the check until the next months payment was due, then returned it saying they needed a certified bank check, which no where in my original note does it give them permission to demand a certified check. I have called them to complain about " inspection fee 's '' listed on my statement. My next statement would have the same amount listed as " Other Fees ''. They said it was a drive by inspection, but when I asked them if the home was under construction or not ( it is ) they could not answer. They have claimed to have sent certified mail to the home, but can not produce a signed mail receipt. The address on the statements is not even the correct mailing address. I am at wits end with them and am very afraid that their goal is to make it almost impossible to pay my mortgage resulting in foreclosure. What can I do?

After a XXXX XXXX in XXXX, I was given a medical aid to use at home from XXXX XXXX XXXX. They were to bill my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) and I would pay the balance. They delayed the Insurance billing and I informed XXXX XXXX that I would pay after the XXXX was issued. XXXX sent my file prematurely to a Collections Company which reported a {$47.00} Collection Record on XXXX and Equifax. In XXXX, XXXX I received notice of XXXX submitting their portion of the {$47.00} payment to XXXX XXXX and an updated billing from XXXX which also reflected XXXX payment of their share of the bill. I then paid my balance to XXXX XXXX which totaled {$9.00} in XXXX, XXXX. In XXXX, XXXX I submitted a Refinance Application for my home and discovered a Collection Record on my Equifax from XXXX ( XXXX XXXX '' ) for the original amount of {$47.00}. This should never have been sent to Collections, as my account has been paid " on time '' with XXXX XXXX in conjunction with my Insurance Company payment. My Mortgage Lender tells me that this item has decreased my Mortgage Credit Score by at least XXXX points and I will be forced to pay a higher Interest Rate and Loan Service Fee unless I have this erroneous Collection Record removed from Equifax. XXXX is not reporting the Collection and my XXXX Mortgage Credit Score is XXXX, while my Equifax Mortgage Credit Score is in the high XXXX with this particular Collection Account as the only Negative Item reported. I have all the billing and payment information to show the transactions as I described and I need this erroneous and Collection Record removed from Equifax.

XX/XX/2023 Attention : Square XXXX Department & Customer Service : Square has misappropriated over {$20000.00} in my funds by locking my account XXXX and then refusing to further engage with me via my account service contact ( likely because it has been using a bot to respond rather than a person ). This is severely damaging my business, which relies upon access to those funds. Those funds are held in trust, and Square is both in breach of its contract and has committed unjust enrichment, as well as a failure to meet the duty of good faith and fair dealing. 

I am continuing to try and resolve this in good faith and through direct communication. Please have an account representative correct this matter promptly and restore my access. If an account representative is unable to act, please forward this to your legal department, as they should, at a minimum, recognize the wrongful conduct committed by Square and act promptly to avoid legal costs. 

My professional photography business, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, operates seasonally. My business is licensed by the XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have been utilizing Square to receive payments for my photography services, and Square held a substantial balance of my funds as of XX/XX/2023. Without making any attempt to contact me about any concerns, Square suddenly deactivated my account. Square then claimed it did so because my account could not be verified, and refused to further engage with me. All while keeping all of my funds. This is significantly impacting my ability to operate my business and to pay contractors for their services. 

Either this is a simple mistake that has not been brought to the attention of the right people, or a deliberate policy of theft. Based on a cursory review of online complaints, many others have been forced to deal with the same issue. If this is a deliberate policy action, it may be that a class action is the only recourse to obtaining justice for both myself and to ensure that others like me dont have to suffer the same issue. But I do hope this is just an oversight and not a policy issue, and that it is resolved promptly and fairly once this notice has your attention. 

Please release the amount of {$20000.00} from my account. You may contact me at XXXX or by phone at XXXX. This is my final attempt to resolve this through direct discussion. I hope you act accordingly. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

complaint_text:

XXXX XXXX XXXX their Attorneys have not communicated with them the fact that the foreclosure sale was overturned. My Attorneys office has tried to explain to GreenTree and XXXX XXXX XXXX the issues, however, we are now in XXXX and GreenTree nor XXXX XXXX XXXX has made any effort to assist. Please help. I am trying to save my home. For further proof or evidence my case is under XXXX XXXX and the case number is XXXX. 
Thank You.

Completed and submitted a Making Home Affordable application with lender Green Tree Servicing. Attempted to contact Green Tree/Lender by phone and email on several occasions, leaving messages each time and have never heard back from them other than to send a letter stating they denied my application. There is additional information concerning the application that I have been unable to convey to them due to their lack of communication concerning the application. Now a " Notice of Trustee 's Sale '' on date XXXX/XXXX/15 has arrived on my front door. Green Tree/Lender does n't appear to be interested in anything but foreclosure. Assistance would be appreciated.

This letter is a formal compliant that you are reporting and incomplete credit information. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify, through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract, any and all accounts that you post on a credit report. Otherwise anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. I demand to see verifiable proof ( I.e. : an original consumer contract with my signature on it ) that you have on file I demand that the following accounts be verified or removed immediately failure on your behalf to provide a copy of any alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature may result in a small claims action against your company. Therefore, either provide the requested information or cease your collection efforts and reporting of this account on my credit reports immediately. Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person who personally verified this alleged account, so that I can inquire about how they verified without providing any proof, bearing my signature. As per FTC opinion letter from Attorney XXXX XXXX XXXX, you should be aware that a printout of a bill or itemized document does not constitute verification. I am again formally requesting a copy of any documents, bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay you the alleged amount

The first thing was that I informed that I would have partial modification for my mortgage. However when I took my taxes in last year they informed me that they gave me a full modification. Secondly my escrow and taxes for my house went up almost two hundreds. They informed me that this was an estimate for the house for they next year. Two year ago I over paid in my taxes instead of them given me options that made the choice for me which I did not understand why did they asked me I would had put for payment. I can not trust them because I have not seemed the changes in the amount for the outstanding amount. It is always the same I know I have reduced the amount. I have been paying on this house for at least 15 years and they still saying that I old XXXX on this house. This house is not even worth that much. At not time have they as if I was a service man Finally I thought when you getting a modification that you do n't pay they tell me to keep paying until it is final.

This is a second complaint filed -- the initial complaint resulted in the bank rescinding the original foreclosure. We discussed the payment required to enter into a forbearance agreement. The original amount discussed was significantly lower -- the amount that was offered by the bank was eventually much higher and the funds were not available to make such a payment. We agreed to sell the family home after making certain renovations : those renovations ( about 80 % ) were made at a cost of over {$40000.00}. We began listing the house a short while ago. It was our understanding that the bank would give us the time to try and sell the house at a reasonable valuation. The listing price was almost XXXX % below the tax appraised value -- I think it showed we were serious about selling the home as quickly as possible. A great deal of work went into the staging and removal of most personal items to a storage center. 

We were scheduled for a realtor open house last weekend when a stranger knocked at our door saying the property was listed in the paper for foreclosure just a a little over a week away and wanted us to retain him to fight the bank -- we declined. A couple of days later a letter arrived from the Bank 's law firm saying the foreclosure was re-instated and scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX. The bank officials with whom we had discussed the forbearance, etc.had out emails and telephone numbers -- they made no attempt to contact us an alert us they were moving in this direction. We in good faith made several investment renovations decisions in the prior week, including purchasing new counter tops and appliances for the kitchen and replacement windows. It appears that this investment has been for nothing and we will lose these money. The auction will only bring an amount close to the banks loan/lien and we will see $ XXXX - $ XXXX of equity disappear. 

Given our willingness to list and sell the house at a discount, I think it would only have been right for the bank to provide this time. Also they should have communicated sooner that they were moving forward with the foreclosure so we could have stopped investing in renovations to the home.

complaint_text: I want to stress that I did not give written permission for these specific transactions to be included in my consumer report. At no point did I authorize these entries, and their presence on my report is unwarranted. Consequently, I am formally requesting that these accounts be blocked and removed from my report immediately. It is important to clarify that this request is not due to any error or negligence on my part. There has been no oversight or misunderstanding on my end. Instead, this issue arises solely from the fact that I did not explicitly authorize the inclusion of these transactions in my report. I am diligent about maintaining the accuracy and privacy of my financial records, and these unauthorized entries compromise that integrity. I trust that you will handle this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. Please confirm the removal of these transactions from my report as soon as possible. Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue.

I hope that upon receiving this letter, you will promptly comply with my request. I prefer to avoid filing a complaint and believe that your cooperation is in both our best interests. If the appropriate steps to rectify this situation are not completed within 10 days, I will be filing a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) against your company. XXXX XXXX XXXX

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. 

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text:
I have had a Capital One business account for decades. I've used their XXXX XXXX service to pay my personal bills and business invoices. Some of them are regular recurring payments. 

The bank changed payment contractors, notifying me only after the " completion '' of the process. However I was no longer able to access the service from their web portal. 

XXXX times in succession I was told that a service ticket was submitted and that they tale XXXX days for each to be addressed by the " digital team ''. On the fourth complaint I was told that it has been submitted for a " secondary review '' with an open ended resolution time. 

Several times I asked to speak with someone more directly connected to the new contractor and was told that it's just not possible, until XXXX supervisor did actually transfer my call to the company. They told me that my account was not transferred to me by the bank. 

Meanwhile, for XXXX weeks I've had to make alternate arrangements to pay my debtors and figure out who were the recurring payments. 

In addition, I just learned that XXXX debtors who I paid by ACH through the bank did not receive the funds, though the funds were taken from my account. 

Capital One Bank has been very unresponsive, not helpful, and doesn't seem to be concerned. 

I requested a written statement from the bank with an explanation accepting accountability that I can provide to my debtors who were not paid on time. They said that the request would be submitted and I can expect a decision in XXXX months!

complaint_text: I XXXX XXXX and my Power of attorney went to my Bank ... Chase and asked to withdrawn {$100000.00} ... The person we spoke to asked for Id 's from both of us then went away and came back and asked my Power of attorney if we were sending this money to the XXXX XXXX and if not was the money going over seas??? Her name happens to be XXXX XXXX!!! She said absolutely not and that she did not know anyone overseas or in the XXXX XXXX. He said that the bank did not have this type of cash on hand and that it would have to be ordered. This was on a Monday so we asked how long it would be??? He said next week some time. We asked why so long and he said to make sure this is not fraud!!! So we left and decided in a couple days that really if it was such a big deal maybe we could just get {$50000.00} ... so we returned to the bank two days later and asked for just {$50000.00}!!! Thats when we were informed that all the five accounts had been frozen and that they did not know why and it was out of their control at the bank level!!! The bank manager XXXX XXXX told us this. He gave us a number to call if we had any questions ... The name and number is XXXX XXXX XXXX ... J P Morgan Chase Global Security Investigations. This has been a month ago!!! We have tried and tried to reach this person but he has never returned our phone calls!!! And we have never til this day received any paperwork in the mail with an explaination or a phone call from this person or Chase Bank located at XXXX XXXX XXXX ... XXXX XXXX Michigan XXXX ... Phone # XXXX. Each time a dozen times we have went to the bank for answers we're constantly being told they don't know anything and can not help ... sorry!!!

On Friday, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX, I got a text from Wells Fargo asking if I could verify card activity of {$160.00}. I immediately looked at my account information online and saw that I had 4 non-Wells FargXXXX ATM withdrawals. Luckily, the 5th withdrawal was declined. 
I called their XXXX number at XXXX to let them know that I had fraudulentcharges on my card. They asked me what charges weren't mine and I told them, a charge from XXXX WA for {$120.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, a charge from XXXX XXXX WA for {$120.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, a charge from XXXX WA for {$120.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, and one on from XXXX WA for {$120.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. Again, all from non-Wells Fargo ATMs. They asked me if I still had my card with me and I said yes. They asked me if I've given my card out to anyone and I said no. They canceled my card right away and told me to wait for 5 minutes while she talked to claims. Upon return she said it was denied. 
I was shocked at how fast they decided to decline my claim. I'm assuming they denied my case because unfortunately, all the transactions happened in Washington and I currently live in Washington. But I assumed my bank would have done a more thorough investigation because {$490.00} is ALOT of money for me and seeing that we're in a pandemic, I just thought they would be more helpful and caring since that is what they preach on their website about their response to the impact of COVID-19. 
The same day I went to my nearest Wells Fargo bank to talk to someone in person because the person I talked to over the phone really lacked any sort of empathy for my situation. The person that I talk to, I believe his name is XXXX XXXX, sat down with me and we discussed what had happened. He too was surprised that they only reviewed my case for 5 minutes. I asked him if it was possible for people to make fake cards and he said yes, hackers can do that and that skimmers can get that information. He helped me submit an ask for a 2nd review. He told me that I should hear back from someone and if I don't hear from anyone to call back. 
While I was waiting to hear back from Wells Fargo, I did my own research. XXXX printed out a " Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX '' where I'm able to see the time of each transaction and sometimes the address, bank, or ATM number it was withdrawn from. I called the XXXX in XXXX and XXXX XXXX  to ask if they could give me some pictures around the time that the ATM withdrawals happened. They both said they couldn't give that information out to the public but would happily give it to my bank if they requested it, and they added that they SHOULD request it because that's what banks are supposed to do, or at least that'swhat XXXX and XXXX XXXX  does. Only slightly relieved, I thought that surely my bank would ask them for that information and see that it's someone else withdrawing money. I also noticed that I was at work on one of those dates during the time the withdrawal occurred. I asked my place of work if they could write a letter for proof and they sent it to me which I'll be attaching. 
I called the XXXX number today, Monday XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX and asked where my investigation was at. I was told that it was denied, again. I asked if I was able to submit my work letter because that's solid evidence that the withdrawal couldn't have been me and she said no. She explained that Wells Fargosreasoning is that the transactions say that my card was swiped and that the pin was put in. XXXX told me that it is possible for thatinformation to get out and get duplicated. So I'm hearing from Wells Fargo staff that fake cards can exist, but the staff over the XXXX number are acting like that couldn't possibly be an option, and different major banks are saying that Wells Fargo should also be requesting footage from when/where the transactions took place but I don't think they even attempted to get the footage. I'm stuck left wondering, what exactly did Wells Fargo specifically investigate then? 

Thank you for your time.

Received a reply from experian today that the information will remain the same nothing was verified at all. Have reports from the bankruptcy itself stating that they do not report to credit agencies. To Whom It  May Co ncern : I have recently been informed that there is a Bankruptcy in the file you maintain under my Social Security number. Upon ordering a copy of my credit report, I see an entry listing a   Bankruptcy in I do not have a Tax Lien or Bankruptcy.
( UNITED STATES BANKRUPTCY COURT DISTRICT MINNESOTA ) does not report ( type of file - Tax Lien or Bankruptcy ) to credit bureaus.     Federal law protects the privacy of most personally identifiable information reported. However, credit bureaus actively search public records for any judgements or tax liens.     A Bankrup tcy filing is public information. Again, ( UNITED STATES BANKRUPTCY COURT DISTRICT MINNESOTA ) does not report anything to the various credit bureaus, nor do they verify that the information reported is accurate. ( CB Name-  XXXX  ,  XXXX  , Experian ) has found information on ( type of file - Tax Lien or Bankruptcy ) through third party research.      Please validate this information and provide me with copies of any documentation associated with this account bearing my signature. In the absence of any such documentation bearing my signature, I formally request that this information be immediately deleted from the credit file you maintain under my Social Security number.     Please note that you have 30 days to complete this investigation, as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act, section   623 ( a ) ( 3 ), and I am keeping careful record of your actions.
Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter will result in a small claims action against your company. I will be seeking {$5000.00} in damages for : 1. Defamation 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act You will be required to appear in a court venue local to me, in order to formally defend yourself.

complaint_text:
Wells Fargo failed to mention that there was a balloon note in my mortgage in XXXX. When I did the modification in XXXX I again only signed one page and sent it back not seeing a full disclosure. I believe I was taken advantage of as a senior citizen. I wrote letters and called the Presidents office. I received a letter stating they would investigate. 
In XX/XX/XXXX, I went to the Wells Fargo Mortgage Center in XXXX California to retain a full copy of my loan papers and check with what I had been previously given. In those documents I did not receive a truth in lending disclosure or pages 16-19 & page 22 were not in my papers or copies I received initally at Wells Fargo Home Mortgage. And I realized they had deceived me in this process. I 've been paying mortgage but with the outrages balloon payment and outrages rate I am at risk of foreclosure, although my loan is up to date.

Starting with my XX/XX/XXXX payment and with each monthly payment through XX/XX/XXXX in addition to my monthly payment, I included an additional {$10000.00} dollar payment to go to paying down my outstanding principal. This was submitted with the companies own payment coupon and was clearly stated for what each amount was being payed. These additional payments have not been properly posted to my account. 

Before the {$10000.00} payments were credited against my outstanding principal, the next month 's payment was subtracted from it and the remainder credited to my outstanding principal. This has resulted in my outstanding principal balance being too high and me being over charged on interest owed. 

I have written letters to my mortgage company twice asking for this problem to be corrected and my outstanding principal balance to be brought up to date. These letters were sent on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

The first letter resulted in my balances being corrected for XXXX and XXXX but not for XXXX Another attempt to correct the situation was made by Roundpoint Mortgage but that did n't address the over charges made for interest due and thus did n't resolve the problem. As of today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) my outstanding principal is stated as being {$130000.00} instead of the {$130000.00} that it should be. 

Each month that this continues only compounds the problem. I am being over charged on interest and my payments against my outstanding principal are smaller than they should be.

I am reaching out regarding several concerning accounts in my credit report that require investigation for a lawful resolution. Upon review, I identified inaccuracies and inconsistencies that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The violations I have noted include : Violation of Timely Payments Regulations Violation of Finance Charge Determination Violation of United States Code Law ( TILA 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ) I request that you provide proper evidence showing that I was late on this account, in compliance with Section 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) Ai, 15 USC 1666b, and 1637 ( b ). If you can not supply the required evidence, you can not deem payment as late, which constitutes a violation of Section 15 USC 1681s-2. Please update the account as " PAID '' or " PAID AS AGREED. '' Additionally, I am filing this complaint due to the multiple inaccuracies in my report, which have negatively impacted my ability to secure credit. The violations that need prompt attention are : FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance FCRA Section 603 ( 4 ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes Privacy Act violations U.S.C 552a ( g ) ( 1 ) ( A ) USC 1692e I demand verifiable proof, specifically the original consumer contract with my signature, for the accounts listed. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed if you can not provide this proof. Therefore, I insist that the accounts be VERIFIED or REMOVED immediately.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

complaint_text:
LoanCare has not resolved an Escrow mis-calculation complaint that was submitted by mail on XX/XX/XXXX. The complaint was acknowledged by LoanCare on XX/XX/XXXX and followed up by a letter dated 35 days later on XX/XX/XXXX indicating that they had opened a research inquiry with the tax department and that they would be sending an update within 7 to 10 days. As of today ( XX/XX/XXXX ), we have not received the update that was promised by their letter to be given by the first of XX/XX/XXXX. 

As per the account information online at XXXX as of today XX/XX/XXXX, the escrow analysis still indicates a inflated monthly escrow amount of {$600.00}. This was calculated by the using the incorrect tax impound amounts supported by the documents that were sent to Loancare with the complaint. The notification of the error was originally emailed to Customer service in XX/XX/XXXX and later sent by letter on XX/XX/XXXX that was acknowledged on XX/XX/XXXX. Based on this erroneous escrow analysis, Loancare indicated that there was a {$2100.00} escrow shortage that calculated a new monthly escrow impound of {$600.00} ( up from the original amount of {$280.00}, a whopping {$320.00} increase! ) With the application of the correct tax impound, the shortage today ( since I have now made 2 mortgage payments with the impound amount calculated by using erroneous property tax information ) would be calculated at {$750.00}. Since LoanCare requires a minimum 2 month reserve, this translates to a new monthly escrow impound of {$330.00}. It appears LoanCare may be attempting to drag this resolution out, well past the RESPA 60 day requirement which is a violation of Section 6 of the Real Estate Settlement procedures Act, until I have made the XX/XX/XXXX payment with the erroneous impound amount. This could be an attempt to require me to pay the entire remaining shortage at that point of {$410.00} within 30 days because it would then not be required to be spread over 12 months as it would then be less than 1/6 of the yearly escrow projection. I hope that this is not the case, and has not been the intention of the company from the beginning. I am concerned because of the 100s of complaints that are readily available on line about LoanCare and their questionable loan servicing practices. 

This issue was originally brought to LoanCares attention by submission of the information through their online secure form email portal on XX/XX/XXXX shortly after the error was made in their escrow calculation they did on XX/XX/XXXX. This submission was never acknowledge and prompted the letter to be sent by mail on XX/XX/XXXX.

Synchrony Bank has XXXX derogatory accounts listed on my credit report via JC Penny and Walmart. Both accounts have remarks that state " paid after charge off to XXXX party collections. '' I called synchrony to establish a date of deletion and they informed me that they do not have any accounts details such as account number and date of deletion. It is my understanding that they ca n't report negative information to the credit bureaus if they do not have enough information to validate the account.

Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to urgently request your intervention in rectifying significant inaccuracies and unauthorized disclosures on my credit reports held by XXXX and Equifax. These inaccuracies not only unfairly affect my financial standing but also represent clear violations of federal laws designed to protect consumers. 

Specific Concerns : Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : My reports include hard inquiries from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, not excluding The credit accounts ; that are being ILLEGALLY REPOTED made without my consent. This violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 1681a ( i ).

Erroneous Accounts and Late Payments : Entries related to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX including late payments, need immediate correction. The Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ), protects against unfair billing practices by ensuring accurate reporting. 

Banking Transactions and Unauthorized Disclosures : The inclusion of banking transactions and the reporting of negative information by the aforementioned entities breaches the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), 15 U.S.C. 6802, aimed at protecting consumer privacy.

Immediate Actions Required : Removal of All Negative and Inaccurate Information : I demand the immediate removal of all negative and inaccurate information from my credit reports, including unauthorized hard inquiries, erroneous accounts and late payments, and any unjust banking transactions. 

Prompt Update of My Credit Report : Following the removal of inaccuracies, my credit reports held by XXXX and Equifax must be updated promptly to reflect the corrected information within five business days from the receipt of this notice. 

Compliance Deadline : I hereby provide XXXX and Equifax, along with the implicated entities, a strict deadline of XXXX business days from the receipt of this notice to implement these significant corrections and updates. Failure to address these concerns within the specified timeframe will compel me to pursue further legal action to enforce my rights and seek remedies for the resultant damages. 

This situation demands your prompt and serious attention. The actions I am requesting are not only within my rights under federal law but are also critical for rectifying the harm done to my financial reputation.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX XXXX

complaint_text:
On XX/XX/2022, I attempted to open a checking account at TD Bank. I was advised that the only way I could open the account is if I provided a credit card number in the form of the Social Security number, which I do not own but am a beneficiary of. 

I did provide the Social Security number and did open the account as a beneficiary. Any activity on the account is to be for my benefit. TD began deducting money from the account and I do believe that the money that was deducted was done so fraudulently, in violation of Consumer Protection Laws, and not for my benefit. 

I did contact TD Bank between XX/XX/2022 and XX/XX/2022 regarding the fraudulent deductions. I was informed that the matter would be corrected, and the money that was removed from the account was put back. 

As of XX/XX/2022, TD Bank has begin deducting money from the account again, fraudulently, and not for my benefit. When I attempted to speak to someone by calling the customer service phone number, I was told that I would have to go back to the location I opened the account in. When I asked for the contact number or email address for the legal team or law department, I was instructed that there was no contact information and that I could not speak to anyone to settle this matter. 

I have attached a redacted version of the new account form, where I signed as beneficiary.

I'm really not sure what happened. I have mailed off letters to the credit bureaus continuously and thus far I have not gotten a response. My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX and I am filing this complaint for falsely reporting misleading information. There is no third party involved. Please review the uploaded letters.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text: My loan from XXXX for {$36000.00} is no longer my responsibility. My truck was stolen from me and the loan is going to be paid shortly

In XXXX, funds were fraudulently transferred via wire from our bank account. We realized this in less than 30 minutes. In that time frame USAA Bank had authorized a wire transfer of {$5600.00} from our bank account. They never opened a legitimate investigation instead were strung along and lied to for months stating that it was under investigation. After a couple months of us contacting them, my husband, the Veteran, was told if we want our money back, we would need to get an attorney. The funds stolen was all we had in our account at the time. To not default, we had to use credit cards while they investigated the account, due to direct deposits not going through. USAA not only allowed our money to be fraudulently taken in less than 30 minutes, but they refused to investigate or file a claim with the FDIC. We were lied to by the very institution that is supposed to protect and insure our money. We have filed complaints with every institute possible and continue to contact the CEO office.

On XX/XX/21 i sent a letter regarding inaccurate and unknown things on my credit report. to this day over 45 days later i have not received a response yet. I fell like i am being taken advantage of and being ignored of my disputes. Section 611 ( a ), it is plainly stated that a failure to investigate these items within 45 days gives a reason to immediately remove those items from my report it has been well over 45 days so they should be deleted promptly. I demand these accounts be deleted immediately or i will fill litigation due to stress you caused me. My information was also impacted by the equifax data breach and may have got into the hands of the wrong person.

complaint_text: Have been working with the loss draft department to disperse funds for the rebuilding of our home due to house fire. During this process, have finally come to consensus that to get more funds for materials we need to submit a materials list for materials only and no labor included. This was done shortly after the first required inspection was completed. after weeks of back and forth and outright refusal of our processor to contact my contractor, a correct material list was submitted by my contractor that met their requirements on XX/XX/year>. Was told would be and 8-10 Day wait for processing. Called on XX/XX/XXXX and was told material list was incomplete, only to discover they simply needed to combine the two documents we already sent the XXXX for a complete material list. They do this and start the 8-10 day time frame over. I call after this time frame and am told our processor is on leave and had to assign a new one. But this new processor has reviewed our material list and submitted to Upper management for review, give an additional 2 days. I call after two days and am told the new processor has NOT looked at our material list as previously stated and just reviewed that day and is waiting for response from upper management and give additional 2 days. I call after two days, our material list was approved BUT now requires another inspection because one has not been done in 30 days, even though no additional work has been done on the home and money for materials which we have already submitted is needed to continue. The customer service person requests the inspection be waived due to this fact on Thursday, XX/XX/XXXX, call to back on Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX and should be a decision. Receive a call on Tuesday from the processor with no knowledge of inspection request or really much of what is going on with case. I explain our situation again with material list, processor escalates with management again. I call back the following day and am told the processor has escalated the case so give an additional 3-5 days for management to respond. So each time I call i time frame given, I am given and excuse why our funds to purchase materials for my home, that is incurring damages from weather elements daily, is delayed and no resolution in sight. We simply need funds to purchase materials to be able to demolish and rebuild roof in one go round so no more damage is done to home from weather but no matter how many times I state this it never gets through

My Mortgage is with OCWEN which recently has converted to PHH. My loan number is XXXX. About six months ago they increased the rate to 5.625 from 4.875. All the increase in payment went to Interest not principle. After ten years of this loan I am paying {$920.00} in interest and {$540.00} in principle. Before the rate increase the amount of interest and principle were approximately even. 

This is my complaint. Two things : First I feel they have cheated in the way they applied the extra payment and that now I have almost no principle reduction. Second I requested an amortization schedule and they have refused to provide it.

During the week of XX/XX/XXXX I requested to have my payments be bi-weekly as they were before the loan was sold after correcting bank account information and payment source. I informed the company that my account was paid in advance from the time we purchased our home with XXXXXXXX XXXX. I was incorrectly informed by someone from their team on a recorded call to submit a payment logic change form to initiate the bi-weekly payments. After monitoring for the payments to be drafted, I noticed they were not withdrawn from my bank account. I called again the week of XX/XX/XXXX and a different representative informed me that the first representative provided incorrect information and that I needed to complete a different form for bi-weekly payments which I did. I made an additional payment on XX/XX/XXXX despite the fact that I made three payments in XXXX which paid for XXXX and the first half of XXXX therefore paying the mortgage through the second week of XXXX. I have called numerous times without resolution to have my bi-weekly payments initiated. The lender has erroneously stated that our account was not paid in advance despite the fact that I verbally provided them the payments and also emailed my mortgage statements to them on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX I filed two formal complaints after calling being denied the opportunity to provide a bi-weekly payment despite abiding by their terms and paying a full additional mortgage payment on XX/XX/XXXX to be eligible and consenting to a draft payment being completed for XX/XX/XXXX due to XX/XX/XXXX being a federal holiday. To date, we do not have any resolution, the mortgager continues to claim we are not paid in advance despite receiving a payment audit document from XXXXXXXX XXXX ( previous lender ) which is financially harming us by denying us the opportunity to continue to pay bi-weekly as we had before the loan was sold.

I think me and millions of americans are being lied to by the credit reporting agencies. Hope the fines keep coming. This is ridiculous.

I can see they received it but nothing has changed. See supporting documents. even the USPS tracking. I tried to log into my bank account online banking and my account has been frozen. I called Discover and the woman told me that back on XX/XX/year>, someone added an email address to my account that I did not know about. Discover never sent me any email or notification that a new email address had been added to my account. She refused to tell me the email account that was added. She refused to give me access to my account to see if any transactions had been posted fraudulently. She refused to give me my money that is still currently sitting in the account. I asked to speak with her supervisor and the supervisor then at least told me the transactions that had come through my account. Most were mine but some were not. She also refused to give me my money from my account. Then she hung up on me. I caleld back and waited over XXXX min for another supervisor then was disconnected. I called back a third time, and the supervisor I was connected to said her name was XXXX and her extension number was XXXX. XXXX was instantly rude and disrespoectful to me making my agitation at the situation even worse. At this point, I had already been on the phone with them for well over an hour on 3 different phone calls. She kept saying that she was going to open a new account in my name and transfer my money to that account. I was very clear in insisting that she not open any new account in my name. She said my agreement with them was that they could do that any time they wanted to. I asked for her to send me any such agreement but she has not done so. I was then very clear with her that I was revoking any previous permission I may have inadvertently agreed to allowing them to open any new account with my name or social security number attached to it. I asked repeatedly to have access to my money that is currently sitting in my bank account and she repeatedly refused. I even asked her to take the money currently in my account and credit it to my credit card account I have with Discover and she again refused. Discover is stealing my money and refusing me access to get my money out of that account. How can this be even remotely legal to take my money and refuse me access to it? I have done nothing wrong and just want my money out of that account. This is MY money, not Discover 's. I do NOT want any new account with them. I will be taking my business elsewhere. I have had this account for several years. I have another account with XXXX XXXX and now that they are merging, I will be closing that account as well and taking that business elsewhere also. I want my money back!

I strongly request you to address and rectify the unauthorized accounts on my credit report. These entries, which I have no connection to, are adversely impacting my credit standing. Kindly ensure their swift removal and take measures to prevent such errors in the future.

complaint_text: XXXX we received our monthly statement along with the Escrow shortage statement from Guranteed XXXX. complaint_text:
" The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence, which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. 

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for each account listed without my expressed written consent. 

I looked at my consumer reports and noticed accounts I never gave anyone permission to report. Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role and have a responsibility to report consumer information to the best of their ability with maximum possible accuracy like the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly states. I did not provide written consent to report them.

"
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

complaint_text: Green Tree/ Ditech are holding up my loan modification. They put me in a streamline modification and never sent me any info of contract or forms to sign. Told me after I pay the XXXX payments I will receive papers. I owe less than 15 yrs on mortgage and told me the streamline would put me in a 40 yr. I only owe about {$6000.00} in back mortgage payments. I told the loan modification agent I want to apply for HEMP which will be better for me. They told ( me after XXXX applications that conveniently continue to miss only the important page of income verification ), that I did n't qualify. It was like pulling teeth to have them give me a reason why, which they eventually stated they were missing my proof of income again which was untrue as I had prior phone call with agent verifying they had all papers needed. Then they claim I was denied because I did n't live in a designated area. No such requirement!! They finally admitted I was approved for HEMP but they determined I was better served to stay in streamline modification. Really!! They refuse to send me any written info on my HEMP application. They want me locked into a 40 yr mortgage with all service charges, late fees and what ever bogus charges they choose to tack on without letting me know in writing until I 'm locked in. They are obviously blocking all applications for loan modifications by losing papers, not sending timely documents for me to sign, dragging their feet and giving false information. How can a government program be left in the hands of these crooks. I say follow the money and there 's no way the government does n't know what 's going on. Desperate home owners are being forced into a streamline mortgage which is basically restructuring the loan to be extended XXXX the original time left on a mortgage.Forcing an applicant to agree to all the hidden terms until the owner is locked in. It states on the info on the government web site that if a homeowner is offered the streamline it is a great benefit to apply for the HEMP modification as it can greatly reduce interest and additional cost which would be added if one stayed with the streamline. It states that one has only 30 days once the applicant is approved for streamline and paid the first XXXX payments on time to apply for HEMP. So why does Green Tree refuse to allow the applicant the ability to apply for the HEMP. The agents repeatedly claim the streamline is so much better and you do n't need to do anything just make your first XXXX payments. They even lied about when the payments were due. If I had n't been pro active and investigated the actual date payment due I would have been 1 week late. I would have lost my home!!! Green tree/Ditech have no interest in helping the home owner, only how to steal your home for XXXX on the dollar or have you be locked into a high interest mortgage plus extra charges for 40 yrs. Seems like loan shark tactics. I need a good lawyer to look into whistle blower class action law suit. If one see this, I have all documentation and records of dates times and names etc.

I'm filing this complaint because it's been over 35 days and you are still reporting these items without permission and that is fraud.

complaint_text:
Issue Type : Credit Reporting / Mortgage Servicing Company : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Mortgage Loan Problem Description : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has refused to correct multiple late payment entries on my credit report that are factually inaccurate, unsupported by servicing records, and appear to be part of a systematic scheme to trigger foreclosure default. These entries stem from misapplication of payments, delayed crediting, and servicing errors that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ). 

Despite timely payments made within grace periods or within the same billing cycle, the bank reported the following months as delinquent : XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Their own records show payments were received within reasonable timeframes ( e.g., XX/XX/XXXX for XXXX payment ), yet they still marked the account as 3090 days past due. This pattern suggests intentional misreporting designed to manufacture default status, enabling foreclosure proceedings and damaging my credit profile. 

I have submitted prior disputes and received a response that they can not make corrections, despite clear contradictions in their own documentation. This refusal to investigate and correct errors violates : 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Reporting information known to be inaccurate 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) Failure to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation 12 C.F.R. 1024.35 Servicing errors under RESPA This misconduct has caused irreparable harm, including emotional distress, loss of housing opportunities, and reputational damage. I demand immediate correction of all late payment entries, a full audit of payment application history, and a written explanation of their investigation procedures. 


Reported Month Claimed Past Due Month Payment Received Date Status Reported Challenge XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX 30 days late Payment received within same monthshould not be reported late XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX 60 days late Payment received XXXX months laterno explanation of delay cause XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX 30 days late Duplicate reporting for same monthpossible servicing error XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX 60 days late Payment received in XXXX not reflect XXXX delinquency XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX 90 days late Payment received 4 months laterno XXXX XXXX provided XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX 60 days late Payment received within 45 daysshould not trigger XXXX delinquency XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX 30 days late Same payment date as XXXX misapplied funds XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX 30 days late Payment received within grace periodreporting is excessive These entries reflect servicing delays, misapplied payment cycles, and failure to account for grace periods or hardship accommodations. Under 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), furnishers may not report information they know or should know is inaccurate. Your blanket assertion that no corrections can be made is legally indefensible. 

Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation Your response fails to meet the standard of a reasonable investigation under 12 C.F.R. 1022.43 ( e ) : You did not address the impact of the XX/XX/XXXX data breach, which compromised consumer access and may have delayed payments.

You failed to provide any audit trail, internal servicing logs, or payment application records to support your findings.

You ignored the possibility of servicing errors, misapplied funds, or systemic delaysall of which are material to the dispute.

Demand for Remediation I hereby demand the following corrective actions within ten ( 10 ) business days : Complete removal of all late payment notations from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. 
Written certification of these deletions to all major credit reporting agencies. 
A copy of your investigation procedures and servicing logs used to reach your conclusion.

Immediate updates to my consumer report reflecting a corrected payment history.

Legal Action if Noncompliant If XXXX fails to comply, I will initiate litigation seeking : Statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation under 1681n ; Actual, punitive, and emotional distress damages ; Injunctive relief and attorneys fees ; A formal CFPB enforcement review and referral to the FTC for deceptive practices. 
This notice is issued in good faith and with full reservation of rights under federal and applicable state law. I urge XXXX to reconsider its position and take immediate corrective action to avoid further escalation.
primary_category: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
secondary_category: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

complaint_text:
My Alabama state tax lien was paid and released in XXXX/XXXX -- Income Tax Year : XXXX Case : XXXX Lien : XXXX However, it 's still showing up on two of my credit reports ( Equifax and XXXX XXXX. The fact that it is still on my credit reports has caused me to be denied a loan and has also caused my XXXX score to drop significantly. Other than this tax lien, my credit is PERFECT. 
I disputed this a couple of years ago but each of the credit bureaus told me that it has to stay on my credit reports for 10 years! 
You should also know that I was n't even aware that I owed the state of Alabama DOR any money. I did n't even know there was a tax lien until I noticed it on my credit reports. Needless to say, I paid it as soon as I could. 
I have worked very hard to maintain my excellent credit rating and have been a law-abiding and attentive consumer. Yet because of a ridiculous rule, I have to suffer this " punishment ''? When is someone going to start looking at these types of situations and realize that they only hinder the consumer? The whole credit reporting system has been messed up for years. 
I have attached a letter from the Alabama DOR stating that it has been " paid and released ''. How can I get Equifax and XXXX to remove this negative item?

On XX/XX/2022 the Union Bank denied my claim using the regulation E and stating that I was negligent in promptly notifying them and imposed liability on me in the amount of {$5700.00} honoring only {$110.00} to conclude the claim. 

I am appealed that the bank would use such a lame excuse in order to deny consumer protection that is guaranteed by the law. 

The regulation E makes it clear that the consumer is entitled to receive protection under regulation E even in consumer acted negligently.

The financial institution did not consider all the relevant information regarding the protection.

Regulation E takes into consideration extension of time limits due to extenuating situations.

In the past six months I have had to travel overseas for four weeks at the time to take care of a terminally ill father in law. I was absent from the country for many, many weeks.

I have communicated about my position to two different banking representatives and explained that since I was out of the country for very prolonged blocks of time I may have not acted by the books, and that I did not discover some of these unauthorized transaction on time. The larger debits that amounted to over {$5000.00} were reported within the 60 day time limit. The bank did not consider any of these facts when creating greater liability on me then premiered by the law. The bank representatives kept stating that I am not protected and were not introduced in hearing about the hardships that I was facing with extended travel and terminal illness of my close family member.

I am asking the CFPB to investigate and provide me with the protection that is guaranteed to me by the law.

I firmly believe that this unauthorized account is a direct result of identity theft and I am actively taking all necessary steps to address this situation. 

I have already taken initial actions by contacting Pro Collect to dispute the account and have filed a report with local law enforcement to report the identity theft. Nevertheless, as the impact on my credit report persists, I am reaching out to request your assistance in rectifying this issue. 

I kindly request your support in investigating and promptly removing this fraudulent account from my credit report. Your intervention and guidance in this matter would be immensely appreciated to ensure the accuracy of my credit history is restored. 

Enclosed with this email, you will find the pertinent details regarding the fraudulent account for your reference. Should you require any further information from my end to facilitate the resolution of this matter, please do not hesitate to reach out. 

I am fully committed to cooperating with your team to swiftly resolve this issue. Thank you for your attention to this pressing matter. I eagerly await your guidance and assistance.

complaint_text:
Complainant : XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, TX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Fraudulent Account Reporting Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act I am filing this complaint regarding a fraudulent collection account appearing on my credit report. The account is listed as follows : Collection Agency / Debt Buyer : XXXX  / LVNV Funding Account Number : XXXX Account Type : Debt Buyer Responsibility : Individual Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Status : Collection account, {$850.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX Balance Updated : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$850.00} On Record Until : XX/XX/XXXX I did not open, authorize, or have any relationship with this company or the original creditor. I have received no signed agreement, billing statements, or verification linking this account to me. This account is fraudulent and is causing harm to my credit. 

This reporting violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Requires credit reporting agencies to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of information.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) : Requires prompt reinvestigation and deletion of unverifiable or inaccurate information within 30 days.

15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) : Prohibits debt collectors from continuing collection efforts until the debt is properly validated. 

I request the CFPBs assistance to ensure this fraudulent account is fully investigated and permanently removed from all credit reports. complaint_text:
I sent portfolio recovery this document certified mail and portfolio recovery did not send me the documentation I requested in my letter. 

Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed, and validation is requested. Under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, XXXX vs XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I may presume there is no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any debt, in fact exists and under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt. DO NOT SEND ME COPIES! SEND ME THE ORIGINALS! THIS IS MERELY A PAPERTRAIL. 
This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC1692gSec. 809b ) of the FDCPA. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. 
At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report unvalidated information to any of the XXXX major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character. 
I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. 
If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I will require XXXX  days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your offices fail to respond to this validation request with XXXX  days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. 
It would be advisable that you and your client assure that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action. 
CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION Please provide the following : Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. 
Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein I agreed to pay the creditor. 
Any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account. 
Any Judgments obtained by any creditor regarding this account. 
Name and address of alleged creditor. 
Name on file of alleged creditor. 
Alleged account number. 
Address on file for alleged debtor. 
Amount of alleged debt. 
Date this alleged debt became payable. 
Date of original charge off or delinquency. 
Verification that this debt was assigned or sold to collector. 
Complete accounting of alleged debt. 
Commission for debt collector if collection efforts are successful. 

Please provide the name and address of the bonding agent for PORTFOLIO RECOVERY in case legal action become necessary. Your claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of the above is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please allow XXXX  days for processing after I receive this information back. 
Best Regards XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Commission
secondary_category: Attempts to collect debt not owed

complaint_text:
Re : Chapter XXXX Bankruptcy reported on my CR. 

The US Bankruptcy Federal Court of FL Does not report to Credit bureaus. Federal law protects the privacy of most personally identifiable information reported. However Credit bureaus actively search public records for any judgments. A bankruptcy is public information, again the US Bankruptcy Federal Court does not report anything to various credit bureaus, nor they VERIFY that information reported on my Credit Report is ACCURATE. EXPERIAN has find information through third party research. 
I contacted Experian by mail to provided me with copies of any documentation associated with this account " BEARING MY SIGNATURE '' with the name of the contact person in court that furnish the information to Experian. Experian failed to provide me with the requested information sending just a letter stating they " VERIFY '' the information and to contact the furnisher that is on my credit report and this is The US Bankruptcy Federal Court, I contacted the court and what I wrote at the beginning of this complaint was the court response. I sent the same request letter to XXXX and they removed the information from my report due to the lack of documentation. 
Experian Violated the law reporting information that they ca n't Validate with the Court stating that they " verified '' the info with the furnisher and this is the court and the court does not provide any information to them. 

No documentation were provide to me bearing my signature or how they verify the information. 
I formally request that this information be immediately deleted from my credit file Experian maintain under my Social Security number.
